Complete Quiz Set

1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: Communicative language is the means of transmission of our values and social norms. Statement II: Language defines and communicates the world around us.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
2. Human communication involves (UGC NET 8th Oct 2022- Morning shift) A. Message transmission B. Message reception C. Verbal and non-verbal messages D. Power packed message only E. Messages or non-consumption
  • B, D and E
  • A, C and E
  • B, C and D
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A, B and C
3. Language for communication is a product of: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Everyday life
  • Laboratory simulation
  • Religious affiliations
  • Elitist preference
Correct Answer: Everyday life
1. Shannon and Weaver's communication model was not focused on: (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Evening) A. Message transmission B. Contents of messages C. Meanings of messages D. Intention behind messages E. Medium of transmission
  • C, D, E only
  • B, C, D only
  • A, D, E only
  • A, B, C only
Correct Answer: B, C, D only
2. The Shannon and Weaver mathematical model of communication was based on a linear system of: (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Print communication
  • New communication
  • Electronic communication
  • Traditional communication
Correct Answer: Electronic communication
The first Indian Education Commission was set up in
  • 1868
  • 1872
  • 1878
  • 1882
Correct Answer: 1882
1. Who among the following founded the Imperial Library which he wanted to see as a Future Bodleian Library or a British Museum of the East? (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Lord Canning
  • Charles Wood
  • Lord Mountbbaton
  • Lord Curzon
Correct Answer: Lord Curzon
2. The most important fallout of university reforms under whose leadership, was the first official announcement of the future education policy of the Government of India to reduce the tension created among the educated Indians by the process of his university reforms? (UGC NET 08 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Curzon
  • Charles Wood
  • Hunter
  • Dalhousie
Correct Answer: Curzon
3. During the British rule who among the following said, "...our system of higher education in India is a failure; that it has sacrificed the formation of character upon the alter of cram." (UGC NET 23 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Annie Besant
  • Dalhousie
  • Macaulay
  • Curzon
Correct Answer: Curzon
Which initiative is responsible for Compulsory Primary Education in our country?
  • Gokhale’s Bill of 1921
  • Sadler Commission in 1927
  • Gokhale’s Bill of 1911
  • Sadler Commission in 1917
Correct Answer: Gokhale’s Bill of 1911
Which Commission laid emphasis on the Teacher’s training and thus the Central advisory Board of Education was set up?
  • Sargent Commission in 1917
  • Sadler Commission in 1907
  • Sargent Commission in 1907
  • Sadler Commission in 1917
Correct Answer: Sadler Commission in 1917
Which is the highest body to advise central and state governments on education? (UGC NET 11 Nov 2020 Morning)
  • NIEPA
  • NSDA
  • CABE
  • UGC
Correct Answer: CABE
Following the recommendations of which of the following Committee the Central Advisory Board of Education (CABE) was revived in 1935? (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Hartog Committee
  • Sadlar Committee
  • S.H. Wood Committee
  • Wood-Abbot Committee
Correct Answer: Hartog Committee
In 1937, Gandhiji evolved a scheme popularly known as the Wardha Scheme of Basic National Education. In order to implement the recommendation of Wardha Scheme, a committee was set up under the Chairmanship of: (UGC NET 24 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • B.G. Kher
  • Zakir Hussain
  • A.K. Azad
  • M.K. Gandhi
Correct Answer: Zakir Hussain
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 29 Oct 2022 Morning) Statement I: The recommendations of the Radhakrishnan Commission in 1949 resemble those of Calcutta University Commission in 1917. Statement II: The recommendations of the Mudaliar Commission in 1953 resemble those of John Sargent's post-war Educational Development Plan in 1944.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
According to the recommendation of Sarkar Committee (1945), higher technical institutes were formed based on the in the ________ four regions of India. (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Imperial College of Science and Technology, UK
  • Massachusetts Institute of Technology, USA
  • Max-Planck Institute, Germany
  • California Institute of Technology, USA
Correct Answer: Massachusetts Institute of Technology, USA
1. The disadvantages of Aristotle's model of communication are: (UGC NET 20th Oct 2022 Morning shift) A. Weak encoding B. Audience created content C. One‐way communication D. Stress on the speaker E. Ignorance of noise
  • A, D and E only
  • C, D and E only
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
Correct Answer: C, D and E only
2. Identify the correct sequence of the elements of communication set by Aristotle: (UGC NET 9th July 2022- Morning shift) A. Speech B. Speaker C. Audience D. Occasion E. Effect
  • A, D, B, C, E
  • D, B, A, E, C
  • C, D, A, E, B
  • B, A, D, C, E
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C, E
1. Match the following. (UGC NET 23 Oct 2022 Morning) List I (Commissions) A. University Education Commission 1948 B. Secondary Education Commission 1952 C. Education Commission 1964 D. National Knowledge Commission 2005 List II (Chairperson) I. Dr. Sam Pitroda II. Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan III. Dr. D.S. Kothari IV. Dr. Lakshmanaswami Mudaliar
  • A-IV, B-III, C-I, D-II
  • A-III, B-I, C-II, D-IV
  • A-I, B-II, C-IV, D-III
  • A-II, B-IV, C-III, D-I
Correct Answer: A-II, B-IV, C-III, D-I
2. Match the following. (UGC NET 12 Oct 2022 Morning) List I A. National Education Policy B. National Policy on Education C. National Knowledge Commission D. Learning without burden Report of the National Advisory Committee List II I. 1993 II. 2009 III. 1986 IV. 2020
  • A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
  • A-IV, B-III, C-II, D-I
  • A-IV, B-II, C-III, D-I
  • A-IV, B-III, C-I, D-II
Correct Answer: A-IV, B-III, C-II, D-I
1. Which of the following recommendations were put forward by University Education Commission appointed after independence by the Indian Government concerning medical education in India? (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Medical colleges should admit a maximum number of hundred students. B. History of medicine with special reference to Indian systems should be taught in the first-degree course in medicine. C. More importance should be attached to public health, Engineering and Nursing. D. There should be provision of ten beds per student admitted in the medical college.
  • B, C and D only
  • B and C only
  • A, B, C and D
  • A and B only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 05 Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: Before Independence, the Britishers failed to create a national system of higher education in India. Statement II: After 1947, the University Education Commission (1948-49) was mandated to suggest improvement to suit the needs of higher education in India.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
3. Given below are 2 statements: (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Morning) Statement I: The Radhakrishnan Commission recommended to standardize university teaching in India. Statement II: The Radhakrishnan Commission also suggested the establishment of an All-India University Examination Board.
  • Both Statement I and II are false.
  • Both Statement I and II are true.
  • Statement I is false but Statement is true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
4. The Government of India in November 1948 appointed a University Education Commission under the Chairmanship of: (UGC NET 13 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Dr. S. Radhakrishnan
  • Mrs Annie Besant
  • D.S. Kothari
  • Ms Sucheta Kriplani
Correct Answer: Dr. S. Radhakrishnan
1. Which one of the following groups of commission on education has been chronologically in an order of year in which they were constituted? (UGC NET 5 Dec 2019 Evening)
  • Mudaliar Commission, Kothari Commission, Radhakrishnan Commission
  • Kothari Commission, Mudaliar Commission, Radhakrishnan Commission
  • Radhakrishnan Commission, Mudaliar Commission, Kothari Commission
  • Radhakrishnan Commission, Kothari Commission, Mudaliar Commission
Correct Answer: Radhakrishnan Commission, Mudaliar Commission, Kothari Commission
2. In which year Secondary Education Commission was appointed under the chairmanship of Dr. A.L. Mudaliar? (UGC NET Dec 2018 Evening)
  • 1950
  • 1951
  • 1952
  • 1962
Correct Answer: 1952
3. Who was the Chairman of Secondary Education Commission set up in 1952? (UGC NET Dec 2018 Evening)
  • Dr. A.L. Mudaliar
  • Sh. K.C. Pant
  • Dr. B.R. Ambedkar
  • Dr. S. Radhakrishnan
Correct Answer: Dr. A.L. Mudaliar
The University Grants Commission was constituted on the recommendation of which of the following? (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Mudaliar Commission
  • Radhakrishnan Commission
  • Sargent Commission
  • Kothari Commission
Correct Answer: Radhakrishnan Commission
1. Who among the following was the Chairperson of the Committee setup by the National Council for Women Education in 1962 to examine the differentiation of curriculum for boys and girls at all stages of education? (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Margaret Cousins
  • Bhaktavatsalam
  • Durgabhai Deshmukh
  • Hansa Mehta
Correct Answer: Durgabhai Deshmukh
2. Hansa Mehta Committee was appointed by the National Council for Women's Education in 1962 with the purpose to: (UGC NET 13 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Establish science laboratories in universities.
  • Formulate policy for use of educational satellites for rural areas.
  • Examine the differentiation of curriculum for boys and girls at all stages of education.
  • Carry out inspection of schools in rural areas.
Correct Answer: Carry out inspection of schools in rural areas.
1. Which of the following education commissions of India noted that - "It is obvious that if higher education is not radically improved, our administration and technical progress, our intellectual standards and social advance, will all be most seriously handicapped”? (UGC NET 06 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • University Education Commission of 1948
  • Radhakrishnan Commission
  • Kothari Commission
  • Hunter Commission
Correct Answer: Kothari Commission
2. Which commission of Education in India expressed the opinion that to avoid famine in the country, the production of Food must be doubled in the next 15 years and maintain an adequate growth thereafter? (UGC NET 06 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Kothari Commission
  • Nation Education Commission of 1964
  • University Education Commission of 1948
  • None of the above
Correct Answer: Kothari Commission
3. Some important recommendations of the Kothari Commission were: (UGC NET 12 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Establishment of clusters of advanced centres in major universities. B. Abolition of the system of affiliate colleges. C. Abolition of continuous evaluation system. D. Establishment of six major universities. E. Improving the quality and content of lecturing.
  • A, D, E Only
  • C, D, E Only
  • B, C, D Only
  • A, B, C Only
Correct Answer: A, D, E Only
4. The recommendation that no student should be allowed to specialize in teaching a subject unless he had it in BA/B.Sc. was made by: (UGC NET 14 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • The Yashpal Committee
  • The Knowledge Commission
  • The Education Commission (1964-66)
  • The N.B. Sarkar Committee
Correct Answer: The Education Commission (1964-66)
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 14 Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: The Indian universities to reach global standards need sustained support for programmes in research and development. Statement II: The ‘knowledge economy’, as envisaged by the Knowledge Commission, does not need government involvement in higher education.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
2. Which of the following recommended the establishment of national universities in India? (UGC NET 15 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Kothari Commission
  • Yashpal Commission
  • Radhakrishnan Commission
  • Knowledge Commission
Correct Answer: Knowledge Commission
1. The Lasswellian model of mass communication is the foundation of media: (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Causal theory
  • Ethical studies
  • Effects theory
  • Culture analysis
Correct Answer: Effects theory
1. Which among the following are the main thrusts of the NEP‐2020 regarding institutional restructuring and consolidation? (UGC NET 29 Nov 2021 Evening) 1. A rigid separation of discipline, with early specialization and streaming of students into narrow areas of study. 2. Developing a spectrum of institutions with a focus on research only. 3. To establish stage‐wise mechanism for granting graded autonomy to colleges 4. Developing vibrant communities of scholars, breaking down harmful silos, enable students in disciplines including artistic, creative and sports. 5. To end the fragmentation by transforming higher education institutions into large multidisciplinary universities.
  • 1, 2 and 3 only
  • 2, 3 and 4 only
  • 1, 4 and 5 only
  • 3, 4 and 5 only
Correct Answer: 3, 4 and 5 only
2. Who was the Chairperson of drafting committee of New National Education Policy?
  • Vasudha Kamat
  • K. Kasturirangan
  • Ram Shankar Kureel
  • Manjul Bhargava
Correct Answer: K. Kasturirangan
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 02 Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: According to the National Education Policy document, the teacher must be the locus of basic reforms in the country's educational reforms. Statement II: Historically marginalized or the disadvantaged student sections of society should get paid quality education irrespective of their place of residence.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
2. The National Education Policy, 2020, also focuses on: (UGC NET 05 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • High quality education in Indian languages
  • Hill area education
  • Foreign education through Indian languages
  • Coastal area education
Correct Answer: High quality education in Indian languages
1. As per NEP 2020 Gross Enrolment Ratio (GER) is sought to be achieved to the extent of 50% by: (UGC NET 02 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • 2047
  • 2040
  • 2035
  • 2030
Correct Answer: 2035
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 08 Oct 2022 Morning) Statement I: The National Education Police 2020 envisages that the extant 10+2 structure in School Education will be modified with a new pedagogical and curricular restructuring of 5+4+4+3 covering ages 3-18. Statement II: The National Education policy 2020 envisages that prior to the age of 5 every child will move to a "Preparatory class" or "Balvatike", which has an ECCE - qualified teacher.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
1. The Aim of NEP 2020 is to increase the Gross Enrolment Ratio in higher education including Vocational education from 26.3 % in (2018) to: (UGC NET 11 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • 50% by 2035
  • 40% by 2030
  • 35% by 2030
  • 60 % by 2030
Correct Answer: 50% by 2035
2. Match List I with List II. (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Evening) List I (Verticals of Higher Education Commission of India - HECI) A. First vertical of HECI B. Second vertical of HECI C. Third vertical of HECI D. Fourth vertical of HECI List II (Name of the Vertical) I. General Education Council (GEC) II. National Higher Education Regulatory Council (NHERC) III. National Accreditation council (NAC) IV. Higher Education Grants council (HEGC)
  • A - III, B - IV, C - II, D – I
  • A - II, B - IV, C - Ill, D - I
  • A - II, B - III, C - IV, D - I
  • A - III, B - II, C - IV, D - I
Correct Answer: A - II, B - III, C - IV, D - I
3. What is the full form of NHERC? (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • National Higher Education Regulatory Complex
  • National Higher Education Repository Council
  • National Higher Education Regulatory Council
  • National Higher Education Review Council
Correct Answer: National Higher Education Regulatory Council
4. By ____________, all Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) shall aim to become multidisciplinary institutions and shall aim to have larger student enrolments as per NEP 2020, recommendations. (UGC NET 24 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • 2040
  • 2030
  • 2035
  • 2025
Correct Answer: 2040
5. According to NEP 2020, India will be promoted as a global study destination providing premium education at affordable costs thereby helping to restore its role as: (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Shiksha Guru
  • Economic power
  • Knowledge Economy
  • Vishwa Guru
Correct Answer: Vishwa Guru
6. Which of the following will be model Public Universities for holistic and multidisciplinary education, at par with IITs, IIMs with the aim to attain the highest global standards in quality education? (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • MPEUs (Multidisciplinary Pedagogical Educational Universities)
  • MVEUs (Multidisciplinary Vocational Education Universities)
  • MERUs (Multidisciplinary Education and Research Universities)
  • MVOUs (Multidisciplinary value oriented Universities)
Correct Answer: MERUs (Multidisciplinary Education and Research Universities)
7. As per NEP-2020, in Higher Education Institutions (HEIs), the focus areas of vocational education will be chosen based on: (UGC NET 16 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Gender basis B. Skill gap analysis C. Value oriented learning D. Mapping of local opportunities E. Visual arts
  • C, D and E only
  • B and D only
  • A and C only
  • A, B and D only
Correct Answer: B and D only
1. In a classroom situation, a teacher organizes group discussion to help arrive at a solution of a problem. In terms of a model of communication used, it will be called (UGC NET 24th June 2019 Morning Paper)
  • A linear mode
  • A transactional model
  • A horizontal model
  • An interaction model
Correct Answer: A transactional model
2. What are the key features of transactional model of communication? (UGC NET 1st Oct 2022- Morning Shift) A. Absence of noise B. Extensively used in interpersonal communication C. Feedback is a new message D. Role exchange by encoder and decoder E. Encoder and decoder discrimination is the order
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only
3. The important features of the transactional model of communication are (UGC NET 05th Mar 2023 Evening) A. Feedback is repetitive. B. It is mostly used for inter-personal communication. C. The senders and the receivers of messages can inter-change their roles. D. Feedback is simultaneous. E. The heavy dose of noise provides a message.
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only
1. According to NEP 2020, which of the following will not be the function of National Educational Technology Forum (NETT)? (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • To articulate new directions for research and innovation in educational technology.
  • To envision strategic thrust areas in educational technology.
  • To provide grants for setting up educational technology centres in central government institutions.
  • To build intellectual and institutional capacities in educational technology.
Correct Answer: To provide grants for setting up educational technology centres in central government institutions.
2. As per NEP 2020, National Education Technology (NETF) will have following functions: (UGC NET 12 Jul 2022 Morning) A. Provide independent evidence-based advice to central and state government agencies in technology-based interventions. B. Articulate new directions for research and innovation. C. Envision strategic thrust area in the education technology domain. D. Develop curriculum for technical courses. E. Build intellectual and institutional capacities in educational technology.
  • A, B, D, and E only
  • A, B, C, and D only
  • B, C, D, and E only
  • A, B, C, and E only
Correct Answer: A, B, C, and E only
3. NEP‐2020 proposes to establish NETF. What are the stipulated functions of this body? (UGC NET 20 Nov 2021 Morning) A. Articulate new directions for research and innovation in technology. B. Provide a platform for free exchange of ideas on use of technology to understand learning. C. Engage multilingual experts to help promotion of all Indian Languages. D. Advancing international research efforts to address global challenges in healthcare agriculture and climate change using AI (Artificial Intelligence). E. Build intellectual and institutional capacities in Educational technology.
  • A, D, E only
  • A, B, E only
  • A, C, D only
  • B, D, E only
Correct Answer: A, B, E only
The education imported through institutions of higher learning in India such as ‘Sanskrit Vidyapith’ is an example of (UGC NET 17 Oct 2020 Evening)
  • Oriental Learning Programmes
  • Value Education Programmes
  • Non-conventional learning programmes
  • Professional education programmes
Correct Answer: Oriental Learning Programmes
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: Conventional education uses traditional teaching-learning methods in which teachers and learners are involved by interacting in a face-to-face manner in the classroom. Statement II: In active learning the timely feedback from either the instructor or fellow students is not critical to the learning process.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
2. Which among the following is based on passive learning, where the child listens to teachers and follows directions from them? (UGC NET 14 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Conventional learning
  • Non-conventional learning
  • Cooperative learning
  • Play way learning
Correct Answer: Conventional learning
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 16 Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: Teacher centred learning is one of main characteristics of non-conventional learning. Statement II: Prescribed curriculum is one of the main characteristics of conventional learning.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
4. Which of the following are the characteristics of conventional learning? (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Cost-effective B. Teacher-centred learning C. Learner oriented D. Prescribed curriculum E. Require regular attendance.
  • A, B and D only
  • B, D and E only
  • A, D and E only
  • C, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, D and E only
1. Which of the following are the characteristics of non-conventional learning? (UGC NET 14 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Controlled and assessed by the teacher B. Learner oriental C. Based on lecture method D. No fixed curriculum E. Cost-effective
  • A, C and D only
  • B, D and E only
  • A, C and E only
  • B and D only
Correct Answer: B, D and E only
2. Which of the following are the characteristics of non-conventional learning? (UGC NET 22 Mar 2023 Morning) A. No fixed curriculum B. Teacher-centred learning C. Cost-effective D. Require regular attendance
  • B and C only
  • B and D only
  • A and D only
  • A and C only
Correct Answer: A and C only
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 11 Oct 2022 Evening) Statement I: Skill based education is focused on the idea that it may be learned better if it is practiced in real life. Statement II: Non-conventional higher education is totally based on the teaching-learning activities that are offered on campus with fixed-time classes.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
4. Disruptive technologies in education mean: (UGC NET 29 Nov 2021 Morning)
  • Obsolete technology.
  • Prevention of technology in education.
  • New technologies that completely change the way things are done in education.
  • Use of Artificial Intelligence.
Correct Answer: New technologies that completely change the way things are done in education.
5. Identify the non-conventional learning programmes: (UGC NET 12 Nov 2020 Morning) i) Gerontology ii) Psychology iii) Ethical hacking iv) Anthropology v) Pet Groomers
  • i, iii and v
  • iii, iv and v
  • ii, iii and iv
  • i, ii and iii
Correct Answer: i, iii and v
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 22 Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: UGC is a Central Government organization established by an Act of Parliament in 1956. Statement II: UGC has established five regional centres in order to ensure proper functioning.
  • Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
2. The University Grants Commission (UGC) covers the following: (UGC NET 01 Oct 2022 Evening) A. Universities B. University Teaching Departments C. Affiliated colleges D. Teacher Training Institutions E. Nursing Institutions
  • B, C and D only
  • A, D and E only
  • A, B and D only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only
3. Which among the following is NOT the responsibility of UGC? (UGC NET 05 Jan 2022 Evening)
  • To fund research projects of faculty.
  • To suggest model curriculum to the universities.
  • To regulate quality of higher education.
  • To maintain discipline in campuses of institutions of higher education.
Correct Answer: To maintain discipline in campuses of institutions of higher education.
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 11 Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: The purpose of higher education is to promote critical and creative thinking abilities among students. Statement II: Deemed Universities can design their own syllabus and course work but cannot grant degrees.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is false but Statement H is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
2. Which among the following are the types of universities existing in India currently? (UGC NET 05 Jan 2022 Evening) A. Community University B. Deemed University C. Research University D. Central University E. Private University
  • A, B, C, D only
  • B, D, E only
  • A, B, D, E only
  • A, C, D only
Correct Answer: B, D, E only
3. For maintenance of standards of teaching examination and research and coordination of University Education, which of the following section of UGC Act should be referred to? (UGC NET 21 Nov 2021 Evening)
  • Section 12
  • Section 28
  • Section 25
  • Section 15
Correct Answer: Section 12
4. UGC is established for: (UGC NET 28 Nov 2021 Evening) A. Promoting research and innovations in higher education in the country. B. Coordination, determination and maintenance of standards of university education. C. Increasing access to higher education in the country. D. Disbursing grants to the universities and colleges. E. Serving as a vital link between the Union and State Governments and institutions of higher learning.
  • B, D and E only
  • A, C and E only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: B, D and E only
1. Which of the following come under the mandate of the University Grants Commission (UGC)? (UGC NET 11 Nov 2020 Evening) (i) Promotion and coordination of University education. (ii) Determining and monitoring standards of teaching, examination and research in Universities. (iii) Organizing continuous professional development Programmes for college and University teachers. (iv) Framing regulations on minimum standards of education. (v) Disbursing and regulating grants to the universities and colleges.
  • (ii), (iii), (iv), (v) only
  • (i), (ii), (iii), (iv) only
  • (i), (iii), (iv), (v) only
  • (i), (ii), (iv), (v) only
Correct Answer: (i), (ii), (iv), (v) only
2. Which of the following statements represent the main functions of UGC? (UGC NET 26 June 2019 Morning) (i) Recognition of institutions (ii) Maintenance of quality and standards (iii) Appointment of Vice Chancellor (iv) Giving grants to institutions (v) Making state governments responsible for educational development
  • (i), (ii) and (iii)
  • (i), (ii) and (iv)
  • (ii), (iii) and (v)
  • (i), (iii) and (iv)
Correct Answer: (i), (ii) and (iv)
3. Which among the following is the statutory function of the UGC? (UGC NET 6 Dec 2019 Evening)
  • To control the conduct of examination in universities
  • To appoint teaching faculty in universities
  • To develop curriculum for university courses
  • To determine and maintain the standards of teaching and research in universities
Correct Answer: To determine and maintain the standards of teaching and research in universities
1. The key features of the interaction model of communication are: (UGC NET 11th Oct 2022- Evening shift) A. It is a two way process B. The physical context of communication is unimportant C. The psychological context of communication D. Feedback is not a response to the message received E. It is less message focused
  • A, C, E
  • C, D, E
  • B, C, D
  • A, B, C
Correct Answer: A, C, E
2. The main features of the interactional model of communication are: (UGC NET 16th Mar 2023 Morning) A. It is best suited for new media. B. The feedback is done in circles. C. It is associated with the concept of field of experience. D. This model is also known as convergence model. E. Here the communication always happens between two familiar persons.
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
1. A deemed to be University: (UGC NET 24 Dec 2021 Evening) A. must come through a gazette notification of the Central Government on the advice of the Commission. B. has autonomy to run its own courses. C. can use the word ‘University’. D. is a Central University. E. is a State University.
  • D and E only
  • C and D only
  • B and C only
  • A and B only
Correct Answer: A and B only
2. Given below are two statements (UGC NET 29 Sept 2020 Morning) Statement I: Universities are established by Central/State Act under 2(f) of the UGC Act, 1956 Statement II: Deemed to be University is declared by a Notification of the Central Government, on the advice of the UGC, under section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
3. In order to be eligible for the status of ‘Deemed to be University’, an institution, among other essential conditions, must have to its credit. Which of the following is correct? (UGC NET 13 Nov 2020 Morning)
  • At least 2 research publications in peer reviewed or SCOPUS/WOS journals per year per faculty.
  • At least 1 research publication in peer reviewed or SCOPUS/WOS journals per year per faculty.
  • At least 3 research publications in peer reviewed journals per year per faculty.
  • At least 5 research publications in peer reviewed or SCOPUS/WOS journals per year per faculty.
Correct Answer: At least 2 research publications in peer reviewed or SCOPUS/WOS journals per year per faculty.
4. University and University-level institutions are categorized into: (a) Central Universities (b) State Universities (c) Private Universities (d) Deemed-to-be Universities (e) Institutions of Higher Learning (f) Civil Sector Institutions
  • (a), (c), (e) and (f)
  • (b), (d), (e) and (f)
  • (a), (b), (c) and (d)
  • (c), (d), (e) and (f)
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c) and (d)
Most of the Universities in India are funded by
  • University Grants Commission
  • Central Government
  • State Governments
  • Private bodies and Individuals
Correct Answer: University Grants Commission
1. Which of the following are the Central Universities of India? (UGC NET 05 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Nagaland University, Nagaland B. Acharya Nagarjuna University, Andhra Pradesh C. Sikkim University, Sikkim D. Manipur University, Manipur E. Guwahati University, Assam
  • C, D and E only
  • A, B, C and E only
  • C and D only
  • D and E only
Correct Answer: C and D only
2. Which of the following are Central Universities? (UGC NET 24 Nov 2021 Morning) A. Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Open University B. Jamia Millia Islamia C. Panjab University D. Punjabi University E. University of Mumbai
  • A and B only
  • C and E only
  • B and C only
  • C and D only
Correct Answer: B and C only
3. Central Universities are: (UGC NET 26 Dec 2021 Morning) A. established by the UGC. B. established by an act of the Parliament. C. established by the Department of Education, Government of India. D. funded by the Central Government. E. Funded by the ‘NITI Aayog’
  • C and E only
  • B and D only
  • B and E only
  • A and D only
Correct Answer: B and D only
4. Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R. (UGC NET 13 Nov 2020 Morning) Assertion A: Central Universities are considered elite higher education institutions in India. Reason R: Despite their elitist image, these institutions do not find place in the top order of international ranking
  • A is true. but R is false.
  • Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is false. but R is true.
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
1. Match the following. (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022 Morning) List I (Institutes of National Importance) A. National Institute of Design B. National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education and Research C. Vishvesaraya National Institute of Technology D. School of Planning and Architecture List II (Locations) I. Mohali II. Ahmedabad III. Vijayawada IV. Nagpur
  • A-III, B-IV, C-II, D-I
  • A-IV, B-III, C-I, -II
  • A-II, B-I, C-IV, D-III
  • A-I, B-III, C-IV, D-II
Correct Answer: A-II, B-I, C-IV, D-III
2. Identify the institution of National Importance among the following: (UGC NET 20 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Jawaharlal Nehru
  • Rashtriya Raksha University, Gandhinagar
  • Aligarh Muslim University
  • Banaras Hindu University
Correct Answer: Banaras Hindu University
Choose the institutions which are not authorized to confer degree according to UGC Act 1956: (UGC NET 5 Dec 2019 Evening) (a) Institutions established under linguistic minority (b) Deemed to be Universities (c) Constituent Colleges (d) Affiliated Colleges
  • (a), (b) and (c) only
  • (b), (c) and (d) only
  • (a), (b) and (d) only
  • (a), (c) and (d) only
Correct Answer: (a), (c) and (d) only
1. Which of the following universities have been recognised as Institutes of Eminence? (UGC NET 08 Oct 2022 Evening) A. Banaras Hindu University B. Amrita Vishwa Vidya Peetham C. Calcutta University D. Central University of Hyderabad E. Jawaharlal Nehru University
  • A, B and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, B, C, D only
  • A, B and E only
Correct Answer: C, D and E only
2. A Government institution recognised as an Institute of Eminence is to get additional funding of: (UGC NET 23 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Rs.200 Cr
  • Rs.500 Cr
  • Rs.1,000 Cr
  • Rs.100 Cr
Correct Answer: Rs.1,000 Cr
3. Which of the following universities is an Institute of Eminence? (UGC NET 29 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Tezpur University
  • Central University of Gujrat, Gandhinagar
  • University of Hyderabad
  • Jamia Millia Islamia
Correct Answer: University of Hyderabad
4. A Government University with Institute of Eminence status can have foreign faculty up to a maximum of: (UGC NET 09 Jul 2022 Morning)
  • 35% of total faculty strength
  • 20% of total faculty strength
  • 30% of total faculty strength
  • 25% of total faculty strength
Correct Answer: 25% of total faculty strength
5. Given below the two statements: (UGC NET 09 Jul 2022 Evening) Statement I: Universities recognized as Institute of Eminence (IoE) are exempted from Government approvals for seeking academic collaborations with any foreign higher education institutions. Statement II: Universities with the status of IoE have complete Academic/Administrative/Financial autonomy.
  • Both Statement I and II are false.
  • Statement I is true and Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false and Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and II are true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true and Statement II is false.
6. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 04 Dec 2021 Morning) Statement I: IITs are different from other normal engineering colleges in our country. Statement II: In IITs science of engineering is taught whereas in normal engineering colleges mostly technical aspect of engineering is taught.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.

  • D and E only
  • C and D only
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
Correct Answer: B and C only
1. Communication with oneself is known as (UGC NET Jun 2008)
  • Grapevine Communication
  • Organizational Communication
  • Interpersonal Communication
  • Intrapersonal Communication
Correct Answer: Intrapersonal Communication
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 16th Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: Of all the types of communication, interpersonal communication is the most effective. Statement II: Human factors in direct communication are the greatest influencers as they carry the element of credibility.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.

  • C, D, E only
  • A, B, C only
  • A, D, E only
  • B, C, D only
Correct Answer: B, C, D only

  • A and B only
  • A and E only
  • B, C and E only
  • A and D only
Correct Answer: A and D only

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

Karnataka State Open University C. Yashwantrao Chavan Maharashtra Open University D. Nalanda Open University E. Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Open University (Andhra Pradesh)
  • E, A, D, C, B
  • B, C, A, E, D
  • E, D, A, B, C
  • A, C, E, D, B
Correct Answer: A, C, E, D, B

To provide opportunities for lifelong learning D. To make education innovative E. To improve the quality of education

  • B, C, E only
  • A, B, D only
  • A, B, C, D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C only

  • UNESCO

  • 2000
Correct Answer: 1985

Statement II: Technical Education was defined as programmes of education in Engineering. Technology. Architecture, Town Planning, Management, Pharmacy and Applied Arts and Crafts.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

Funding salary of teachers in engineering colleges. C. Planning and coordinating development of technical education system. D. Promoting continuous and open learning in technical education. E. Regulation and maintenance of norms and standards.
  • A, B, E only
  • A, C, E only
  • A, C, D only
  • A, D, E only
Correct Answer: A, C, E only

  • D and E only
  • C and D only

  • 1986
  • 1987
  • 1988
  • 1989
Correct Answer: 1987

  • A and B only

Correct Answer: A, B, C and D
2. Which of the following acronym and its expansion are incorrectly matched? (UGC NET 15 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • NCERT- National Council of Educational Research and Training.
  • NCTE- National Council for Teacher Education
  • ICAR- Indian Council for Applied Research
  • AICTE- All India Council of Technical Education
Correct Answer: ICAR- Indian Council for Applied Research

Statement II: Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) provides financial and professional support to Agricultural Universities for modernization and Strengthening of academic facilities.

  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.

  • B Only

Correct Answer: D Only

  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.

(UGC NET 11 Nov 2020 Morning) (i) Curricular aspects (ii) Teaching-learning and Evaluation (iii) Continuous improvement in attainment of outcomes (iv) Research, innovation and extension (v) Facilities and Technical support
  • (iv), (v), (i) only
  • (i), (ii), (iii) only
  • (iii), (iv), (v) only
  • (i), (ii), (iv) only
Correct Answer: (i), (ii), (iv) only

  • C, D and E only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only

  • SAARC University
  • NUEPA
  • AIU
  • Nalanda University

  • Association of Indian Universities

  • NUEPA
  • ICSSR
Correct Answer: AIU
1. Statement II: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) is an autonomous organization set up in 1961 by the Government of India.

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.

  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

  • A, B, C only
  • B, C, D only
  • C, D, E only

  • DEB

  • (a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)
  • (a)-(i), (b)-(iv), (c)-(iii), (d)-(ii)
  • (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • (a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)

  • 7 years
  • 12 years
  • 10 years
  • 15 years
Correct Answer: 7 years

  • Statement I is true and Statement II is false
  • Both Statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is false and Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true and Statement II is false

Statement II: Credits once used or redeemed by a student cannot be used for any other formal purpose or course wavers
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.

  • HTML

  • District Institute for Knowledge Sharing

Correct Answer: Digital Infrastructure for Knowledge Sharing

  • C, D, E only
  • A, B, E only
  • B, C, D only
  • A, C, D only
Correct Answer: A, C, D only

It is built considering the whole teacher's life cycle - from the time student teachers enroll in Teacher Education Institutes (TEIs) to after they retire as teachers.
  • DIKSHA
  • SWAYAM
  • NPTEL
  • INFLIBNET
Correct Answer: DIKSHA

  • Dr. B.R. Ambedkar open university
  • Yashwant Bao Chavan open university
  • Indira Gandhi National Open university
Correct Answer: Indira Gandhi National Open university

  • Only (iii)
  • Only (i) and (ii)

  • Only (i) and (iii)
Correct Answer: Only (iii)

  • Online courses
  • Educational FM radio network
  • Global initiative of Academic networks
  • Satellite based educational T.V. Channel
Correct Answer: Satellite based educational T.V. Channel

  • GIAN
  • Gyan Vani
  • Gyan Darshan
  • Gyan Dhara
Correct Answer: Gyan Vani

Statement II: The NMEICT has produced wondrous benefits for young minds studying in primary, secondary and higher education institutions.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
2. NMEICT is an acronym for: (UGC NET 26 June 2019 Evening)
  • National Multipurpose Education through Information and Communication Technology
  • National Massive Education through Information and Communication Technology
  • National Mission on Education through Information and Communication Technology
  • National Mode of Education through Information and Communication Technology
Correct Answer: National Mission on Education through Information and Communication Technology
1. Match List I with List II (UGC NET 17 Oct 2020 Evening) List I (Digital Initiative) I. NAD   II. SWAYAM PRABHA III. NDL IV. SWAYAM List II (Objective) 1. Utilization of satellite communication technologies for transmission of education e-contents through National channels 2. All-digital library that stores information (metadata) about different types of digital contents 3. 24*7 online store house of all academic viz. Certificates. Degrees etc.  4. Offers various online courses for school education and higher education.
  • I-3, II-4, III-2, IV-1
  • I-4, II-1, III-2, IV-3
  • I-2, II-1, III-3, IV-4
  • I-3, II-1, III-2, IV-4
Correct Answer: I-3, II-1, III-2, IV-4
2. Which of the following statements is/are correct in the context of ‘Digital India’ Initiative of Government of India? (UGC NET 5 Dec 2019 Evening) (a) National Digital Library of India (NDL India) is a 24 × 7 online store house of all academic awards duly digitized and lodged by academic institutions. (b) National Academic Depository (NAD) is an all – digital library that stores information (metadata) about different types of digital contents relevant to the citizens.
  • Both a and b
  • b only
  • a only
  • Neither a nor b
Correct Answer: Neither a nor b
3. Which of the followings is an online store house of academic awards (degrees, diplomas, certificates, mark-sheets etc) lodged by the academic institutions / school boards / eligibility assessment bodies in a digital format.
  • National Academic Depository (NAD)
  • DIKSHA
  • National Digital Library (NDL)
  • Shodhganga
Correct Answer: National Academic Depository (NAD)
Match List I with List II:- (UGC NET 29 Nov 2021 Morning) List I (Government of India Projects) a. Shodhganga b. SWAYAM PRABHA c. Vidwan d. SAKSHAT List II (Purpose) i. Expert database + Researcher network. ii. Thesis database. iii. Online content delivery platform. iv. DTH educational channel.
  • a‐ ii, b‐ iv, c‐ i, d‐ iii
  • a‐ i, b‐ iii, c‐ ii, d‐ iv
  • a‐ iv, b‐ i, c‐ iii, d‐ ii
  • a‐ iii, b‐ ii, c‐ iv, d‐ i
Correct Answer: a‐ ii, b‐ iv, c‐ i, d‐ iii
1. MHRD’s scheme ‘VIDWAN’, is aimed at: (UGC NET 1 Oct 2020 Evening)
  • Awarding national professorship to a faculty
  • Making available e-resources
  • Creating a database and national research network
  • Promoting entrepreneurship among faculty
Correct Answer: Creating a database and national research network
2. Which of the following ICT initiatives of MHRD deal with e-governance for institutions/universities?  (UGC NET 5 Nov 2020 Morning)
  • SAMARTH
  • IRINS
  • SWAYAM
  • VIDWAN
Correct Answer: SWAYAM
3. Which of the following terms is related to the digital learning environment for design? (UGC NET 3 Dec 2019 Morning)
  • e-Acharya
  • e-Kalpa
  • e-Vidwan
  • e-Yantra
Correct Answer: e-Kalpa
4. Match List I with List II: List I (E-initiatives) (a) Vidwan (b) Digi locker (c) Sakshat (d) Shodh Ganga List II (Descriptions) (i) Repository for full-text thesis, e-books and journals (ii) Education portal to facilitate learning (iii) Database of leading scientists/researchers (iv) Platform for issuance and verification of documents and certificates
  • (a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
  • (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
  • (a)-(iv), (b)-(ii), (c)-(i), (d)-(iii)
  • (a)-(i), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)

  • Non‐transactional
  • Horizontal
  • Authoritarian
  • Convoluted
Correct Answer: Horizontal

  • Risk communication
  • Horizontal communication
  • Vertical communication
  • Personal communication
Correct Answer: Horizontal communication

  • NEET
  • NEAT
  • SWAYAM PRABHA
Correct Answer: NEAT

  • National Education Alliance for testing
  • National Educational Alliance for Technology
  • National English Aptitude Test
  • National Engineering Aptitude Test
Correct Answer: National Educational Alliance for Technology

  • Facilitating medical entrance examination
  • Promoting 'SWATCH+ campuses under Swatchh Bharat Abhiyan
  • Better learning outcomes in higher education
  • Better financial resource management
Correct Answer: Better learning outcomes in higher education
4. Which of the following are correct about National Educational Alliance for Technology (NEAT)? (i) It is a Public Private Partnership (PPP) Scheme by the Ministry of HRD. (ii) The objective is to use technology for better learning outcomes in Higher Education.  (iii) The implementing agency for NEAT programme is UGC.  (iv) EdTech companies would be responsible for developing solutions and manage registration of learners through the NEAT portal.
  • (i), (ii), (iii), (iv)
  • (i), (ii), (iv)
  • (i), (ii), (iii)
  • (ii), (iii), (iv)
Correct Answer: (i), (ii), (iv)

  • A, B, C, D only
  • A, B, D, E only
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D only

  • Research and Professional practice
  • Outreach and inclusivity
  • Campus Placement
  • Teaching, Learning and Resources

  • Madrid ranking

  • Environmental knowledge
  • Environmental awareness
  • Environmental skills
  • Environmental attitude
Correct Answer: Environmental attitude

Stage IV- Value consolidation  List II (Exemplification of value formulation) I. Choosing and imbibing the values one cherishes II. Observing and Imitating the adult behaviour, particularly parents   III. Predictability of Human behaviour is assured IV. Finding out gaps in values preached and Practice
  • A-II, B-I, C- IV, D-III
  • A-III, B-II, C-I, D-IV
  • A-I, B-IV, C-III, D-II
  • A- IV, B-III, C-II, D- I
Correct Answer: A-II, B-I, C- IV, D-III

1. Amar’s college uses a form to collect data from new students. The data is used to create information that can be used by the college. Which of the following statements are true about information? A. Information is raw facts and figures that have not been given a meaning. B. Information can be produced by processing raw data. C. Information is automatically encrypted when it is produced. D. Information is raw facts and figures that have been given a context.
  • A and C Only
  • A and B Only
  • B and D Only
  • C and D Only
Correct Answer: B and D Only

No correct answer provided
1. In 1945, who among the following developed the idea of a stored program computer?
  • John Von Neumann
  • Tim Berners Lee
  • Blaise Pascal
  • N.R. Narayanamurthy
Correct Answer: John Von Neumann
2. The Analytical engine developed during the first generation of computers used _______ as a memory unit.
  • RAM
  • Floppies
  • Cards
  • Counter wheels
Correct Answer: Counter wheels
1. The advantages of diagonal communication are: (UGC NET 26th Dec 2021 Evening paper) A. Resistance B. Side-tracking C. Anomie D. Morale boosting E. Co‐ordination
  • B, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: B, D and E only
2. Communication with oneself is known as (UGC NET Jun 2008)
  • Intrapersonal Communication
  • Interpersonal Communication
  • Organizational Communication
  • Grapevine Communication
Correct Answer: Intrapersonal Communication
1. Computers have evolved from the early mainframes to the relatively small smart devices with high computing power used today. Which of the following inventions contributed to reduce the physical size of computers?
  • Vacuum tubes
  • Integrated circuits
  • Registers
  • Solid state memory
Correct Answer: Integrated circuits
2. Identify the correct chronological order of the following Computers based their released date, from earliest to most recent.  A. IBM 701 B. Altair 8800 C. Apple Macintosh D. IBM 1620 E. Apple iMac
  • C, E, B, A, D
  • B, A, D, C, E
  • C, B, D, A, E
  • A, D, B, C, E
Correct Answer: A, D, B, C, E
3. Identify the correct order of the following major technological changes in computers based on fourth to first generation of computers. A. Microprocessors B. Vacuum tubes C. Integrated circuits D. Transistors
  • C, A, D, B
  • A, C, B, D
  • A, C, D, B
  • D, B, A, C
Correct Answer: A, C, D, B
4. What did Marcian E Huff invent?
  • Laser printer
  • Microprocessor
  • Scanner
  • CD-ROM
Correct Answer: Microprocessor
5. First Generation Computers used ___________ language.
  • Machine
  • Assembly
  • Both A and B
  • High level
Correct Answer: Machine
6. Speed of third generation computers was in _____.
  • nano seconds
  • milli seconds
  • micro seconds
  • pico seconds
Correct Answer: nano seconds
1. Which of the following is not a mobile device?
  • Tablet
  • Smartphone
  • Desktop PC
  • e-reader
Correct Answer: Desktop PC
2. Regarding wearable technology, which of the following tasks is/are accomplished by wearable devices? A. Providing more security compared to other computing devices B. Sharing of a wearable device's Internet connection with other connected computers C. Assisting hearing impaired persons
  • A and B only
  • B only
  • B and C only
  • C only
Correct Answer: C only

  • Both statement I and II are true
  • Both statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Statement I is false but II is true
Correct Answer: Both statement I and II are true
5. Which of the following statements is/are true? A. Desktop computer is a general-purpose computer made up of a separate monitor, keyboard, mouse and processor unit B. Laptop is where monitor, keyboard, pointing device, processor unit are combined in a single device C. Tablet is a device with a touch screen; which has a virtual keyboard which uses touch screen technology D. Smart Watch is a device that uses CRT technology so that the screen can bend around the wrist E. Mainframe computer runs small application where small data need to be processed
  • A and B only
  • A, B and E only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, B, C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B and C only
4. Which of the following statements are correct regarding Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) of India? A. Setting up of C-DAC was to build supercomputers in context of denial of import of supercomputers by USA B. C-DAC started building Indian Language Computing Solutions with setting up of GIST group (Graphics and Intelligence based Script Technology) C. This centre was started in the year 1995
  • A and B
  • B and C
  • A and C
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A and B

  • super and micro computers
  • mini and micro computers
  • analog and digital computers
  • super and mini computers
Correct Answer: analog and digital computers
1. Identify the correct input technology based upon the description.
No correct answer provided

  • A and B only
  • B and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A and C only
Correct Answer: A and C only
3. Choose the correct answer from the options given below: Statement I: Hardware represents the physical and tangible parts of the computer Statement II: Operating system is tailor made software according to user’s requirements
  • Both statement I and II are true
  • Both statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Statement I is false but II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but II is false
4. Which of the following statements are correct regarding Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) technology? A. RFID refers to a wireless system comprising two components: tags and readers B. The reader is a device that has one or more antennas that emit radio waves and receive signals back from the RFID tag C. Passive RFID tags are powered by the reader and do not have a battery
  • A, B and C
  • B and C
  • A and C
  • A and B
Correct Answer: A, B and C

6. Which statement is NOT true for QR (Quick Response) codes?
  • There is no need for the user to write down or key‐in a website address
  • QR codes can store website addresses
  • QR codes cannot hold digits
  • QR codes can be scanned anywhere
Correct Answer: QR codes cannot hold digits
7. Computer peripherals are external devices connected to a computer. Which list contains input peripheral devices ONLY?
  • Keyboard, Projector, Mouse, Flash drive
  • Laser printer, Graphic tablet, Barcode reader, Hard disk
  • Microphones, Track-ball mouse, Scanner, touch screen
  • Speakers, Scanners, Mouse, Modem
Correct Answer: Microphones, Track-ball mouse, Scanner, touch screen
1. Choose the correct words to complete the following paragraph which explains the role carried out by different parts of the CPU.
No correct answer provided
2. Which of the following statements are correct? Principal components of a CPU in a computer include: A. The Solid State Drive (SSD) that stores data persistently, typically using flash memory. B. The Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) that performs arithmetic and logic operations. C. Processor registers that supply operands to the ALU and stores the results of ALU operation. D. The Control Unit (CU) that orchestrates the fetching (from memory), decoding and execution of instructions.
  • A, B and C
  • B and C
  • A and D
  • B, C and D
Correct Answer: B, C and D
3. Which one of the following is a part of the processor?
  • Cache memory
  • Data bus
  • Control unit
  • Address bus
Correct Answer: Control unit
4. Which piece of the computer hardware is known as the “brain” of the computer and is responsible for processing instructions?
  • ROM
  • Motherboard
  • CPU
  • RAM
Correct Answer: CPU
Which of the following is/are main memory of a computer? A. RAM B. Hard disk C. CDROM D. Pen Drive
  • A, C and D only
  • B only
  • A and B only
  • A only
Correct Answer: A only
1. Identify the correct sequence for successful communication. (UGC NET 4th Jan 2022- Morning Shift)
  • Sender → Encode message → Decode message → Channel → Audience → Feedback
  • Sender → Encode message → Channel → Decode message → Audience → Feedback
  • Sender → Encode message → Channel → Decode message → Feedback → Audience
  • Sender → Encode message → Audience → Channel → Decode message → Feedback
Correct Answer: Sender → Encode message → Audience → Channel → Decode message → Feedback
2. Feed-back of a message comes from: (UGC NET Jun 2007)
  • Media
  • Sattelite
  • Audience
  • Communicator
Correct Answer: Audience
3. Identify the correct sequence of the following: (UGC NET Jun 2010)
  • Source, message, receiver, channel
  • Source, receiver, channel, message
  • Source, message, channel, receiver
  • Source, channel, message, receiver
Correct Answer: Source, message, channel, receiver
Drag the element of communication into the correct box of characteristic feature.
No correct answer provided
1. Chatting on WhatsApp is an example of: (UGC NET 29th Nov 2021 Evening paper)
  • Friendly communication
  • Asynchronous communication
  • Non‐verbal communication
  • Synchronous communication
Correct Answer: Synchronous communication
2. Real time communication media are known as: (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Synchronous media
  • Vertical media
  • Grapevine media
  • Asynchronous media
Correct Answer: Synchronous media
3. An example of asynchronous media is (UGC NET 05th Mar 2023 Evening)
  • The television
  • The cinema
  • The newspaper
  • The radio
Correct Answer: The newspaper
1. Which of the following statement is true in respect of computers?
  • Software is loaded into secondary storage from RAM and is then executed by CPU.
  • Software is loaded into RAM from secondary storage and is then executed by CPU.
  • Software is loaded into RAM from secondary storage and is then executed by motherboard.
  • Software is loaded into secondary storage from RAM and is then executed by motherboard.
Correct Answer: Software is loaded into RAM from secondary storage and is then executed by CPU.
2. Which of the following are the advantages of Dynamic RAMs (DRAM) over Static RAMs (SRAM)? A. They are much less expensive to manufacture than SRAM. B. They consume less power than SRAM. C. They have a higher storage capacity than SRAM. D. They are much faster than SRAM when it comes to data access.
  • A, B and C only
  • A and C only
  • B and C only
  • A and B only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only
3. Which of the following statements are correct regarding Random Access Memory (RAM)? A. It is an internal chip where data is temporarily stored B. It stores the part of operating system currently in use C. It is used to store the BIOS D. It is non‐volatile memory
  • A, B and C only
  • C and D only
  • A and B only
  • A, C and D only
Correct Answer: A and B only
4. In the light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options below: Statement I: Most PCs use dynamic RAMs for CPU cache Statement II: Static RAM is faster and more expensive than Dynamic RAM
  • Both statement I and II are true
  • Both statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Statement I is false but II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but II is true
5. Virtual memory is ____.
  • an extremely large main memory.
  • an extremely large secondary memory.
  • an illusion of extremely large main memory.
  • a type of memory used in super computers.
Correct Answer: an illusion of extremely large main memory.
6. In the light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options below: Statement I: DRAM consists of a number of transistors and capacitors Statement II: DRAM needs to be constantly refreshed
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
7. In the light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options below: Assertion A: Static RAM is typically used for PC's main memory while Dynamic RAM is used for CPU cache. Reason R:  Static RAM is faster and more expensive than Dynamic RAM.
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
  • Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • A is true but R is false
  • A is false but R is true
Correct Answer: A is false but R is true
1. In the light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options below: Statement I: EEPROM stands for Electronically Extendable Programmable Read Only Memory. Statement II: RAM is much faster to write or to read from than other types of memory; but its main drawback is its non-volatility.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is False but Statement II is true
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false
2. With respect to RAM and ROM, which of the following statements are true? A. ROM is Real optical memory B. RAM stores instructions you are currently working on C. ROM stores the BIOS D. RAM allows the user to read and write data E. Both RAM and ROM lose their data when the power is turned off
  • A, D and E
  • A, B and C
  • C, D and E
  • B, C and D
Correct Answer: B, C and D
3. Match the correct fabrication method with the type of computer memory:
No correct answer provided
4. The motherboard of a computer contains a special chip known as BIOS. Which one of the following is NOT a function of BIOS?
  • It provides a basic interface between operating system and hardware
  • It searches for operating system and load into the system
  • It accomplishes the execution of a program
  • It tests computer’s processor memory
Correct Answer: It accomplishes the execution of a program
1. With respect to Information Technology, which statement best describes ‘Cache Memory’?
  • USB memory connected to a computer to increase its storage space
  • An area of memory that contains settings for operating the computer
  • An area of the hard disk that is used when there is insufficient RAM
  • High speed memory that is included in devices to improve response time
Correct Answer: High speed memory that is included in devices to improve response time
2. Arrange the following computer memory types from the slowest to the fastest speed: A. Main memory (RAM) B. L2 Cache C. Hard Disk D. L1 Cache E. CD­ROM
  • E, C, A, B, D
  • E, C, A, D, B
  • B, D, A, C, E
  • C, E, B, A, D
Correct Answer: E, C, A, B, D
3. With respect to Computers, which of the following groups consists of volatile memory only?
  • RAM and Pen Drive
  • Hard Disk and ROM
  • RAM and Cache
  • Cache and ROM
Correct Answer: RAM and Cache
In light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below. Statement I: Address bus carries signals relating to addresses between the processor and memory Statement II: It is bi‐directional
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
1. In the light of the given statements, choose the correct option from the choices given below: Assertion A: The clock speed of CPUs has not increased significantly in recent years Reasons R: Software now being used is faster and therefore processors do not have to be faster
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
  • Both A and R are true and R is not the correct explanation of A
  • A is true, but R is false
  • A is false, but R is true
Correct Answer: A is true, but R is false
2. In the history of computing, Moore’s Law says that the number of Integrated Circuit (IC) chips in a computer double every two years, which implies that the computers become twice as powerful every two years. According to Moore’s Law, how many years from now will computers be 32 times more powerful as they are now?
  • 5 years
  • 10 years
  • 12 years
  • 8 years
Correct Answer: 10 years
1. Identify the correct printer based upon the given description.
No correct answer provided
2. Which of the following statements are correct? A. Laser printers use dry ink B. Unlike dot matrix and inkjet printers, laser printers do not use ink when producing a document C. Laser printers use the property of static electricity D. Laser printers produce ozone gas and tiny toner particulates in the air
  • A and C only
  • A, B and D only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D only
3. The term Plotter is best described as:
  • An output device to produce drawings and graphics
  • A fast storage device for storing good quality graphics
  • An input device to produce good quality graphics
  • A multipurpose device for taking inputs as well as outputs
Correct Answer: An output device to produce drawings and graphics
4. Which of the following is not an output device?
  • Printer
  • Keyboard
  • Monitor
  • Speaker
Correct Answer: Keyboard
1. In the light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: Statement I: Cache memory is volatile memory and is much slower than Random Access Memory (RAM) Statement II: CDs, DVDs and Magnetic Tapes are all optical media devices
  • Both Statement I and II are true
  • Both Statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Statement I is false but II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and II are false
2. Arrange the following computer memory types from fastest to slowest speed: A. Hard disk B. RAM C. CD-ROM D. CPU registers E. Cache
  • A, C, B, D, E
  • E, D, B, A, C
  • D, E, B, A, C
  • D, E, A, B, C
Correct Answer: D, E, B, A, C
3. One a laptop/desktop computer, which of the following components (A-C) take care of (i) computing, (ii) storing date temporarily, and (iii) storing data permanently in that order? A. RAM B. Hard disk drive C. CPU
  • C, B, A
  • A, C, B
  • C, A, B
  • B, A, C
Correct Answer: C, A, B
4. In the light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: Statement I: Cache memory is faster than random access memory Statement II: Random access memory is closer to the processor than cache memory
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
5. In comparison to secondary storage, the primary storage is:
  • Faster and lesser expensive
  • Faster and more expensive
  • Slower and more expensive
  • Slower and lesser expensive
Correct Answer: Faster and more expensive
1. The main challenges of grapevine communication are: (UGC NET 28th Nov 2021 Morning paper) a. Its formal nature b. Distortion c. Misunderstanding d. Source anonymity e. Conformity
  • b, c and d only
  • a, b and c only
  • a, c and d only
  • c, d and e only
Correct Answer: b, c and d only
2. The grapevine communication is often driven by: (UGC NET 8th Oct 2022- Morning shift)
  • Top management of an organization
  • Social networks of employees
  • Competing organizations
  • External professional agencies
  • Competing organizations
Correct Answer: Social networks of employees
3. Identify the CORRECT sequence of categories of grapevine communication. (UGC NET 28th Nov 2021 Evening paper) A. Cluster chain B. Probability chain C. Gossip chain D. Single strand chain
  • D, C, B, A
  • B, C, D, A
  • C, D, A, B
  • A, B, C, D
Correct Answer: D, C, B, A
1. With respect to computers. which of the following are random access storage devices? A. Magnetic Tape B. Hard Disk C. Pen Drive D. CDROM
  • A, C and D only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, B and D only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only
2. Which of the following devices would be considered a typical sequential access medium?
  • Magnetic Hard Disk
  • Magnetic Tape
  • CD ROM
  • Magnetic Floppy Disk
Correct Answer: Magnetic Tape
1. With respect to computer storage devices, which of the following is/are magnetic storage device(s)? A. CD‐R B. DVD‐RW C. Flash memory stick D. External Hard Drive
  • A and B only
  • C only
  • D only
  • C and D only
Correct Answer: D only
2. Which one of the following is INCORRECT with reference to advantages of magnetic storage?
  • Its storage capacity is unlimited
  • Its rate of data transfer is low
  • It possesses high data density
  • It is very easy to transfer information from one place to another
Correct Answer: Its rate of data transfer is low
1. Arrange the following optical storage devices in decreasing order of their storage capacity.  A. DVD  B. CD‐ROM  C. Blu‐Ray
  • C, B, A
  • C, A, B
  • B, C, A
  • A, C, B
Correct Answer: C, A, B
2. In computers, a DVD-ROM is:
  • an optical storage media and it can be written many times.
  • a magnetic storage media and it can be written only once.
  • an optical storage media and it can be written only once.
  • a magnetic storage media and it can be written many times.
Correct Answer: an optical storage media and it can be written only once.
3. Select the option that shows the storage devices in order of capacity from lowest to highest.
  • CD-ROM, DVD-ROM, Blu-ray
  • Blu-ray, CD-ROM, DVD-ROM
  • DVD-ROM, Blu-ray, CD-ROM
  • DVD-ROM, CD-ROM, Blu-ray
Correct Answer: CD-ROM, DVD-ROM, Blu-ray
4. Select the option that contains only optical storage media.
  • USB memory stick, Blu–Ray disk, CD–ROM, DVD
  • DVD, CD–ROM, USB memory stick, CD-RW
  • Hard disk, USB memory stick, CD–ROM, DVD
  • DVD, CD–R, Blu–Ray Disk, CD-RW
Correct Answer: DVD, CD–R, Blu–Ray Disk, CD-RW
1. What are the main benefits of using an SSD rather than an HDD? A. SSD uses spinning disks and is thus more reliable. B. SSD is considerably lighter and has a lower power consumption. C. SSD accesses data considerably faster.
  • A and B only
  • A and C only
  • B and C only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: B and C only
2. An IT Company has recently produced a new laptop model that uses less power, is smaller in size and weighs less than previous laptop models. The technology that has been used to accomplish this, is:
  • Faster RAM
  • Blu‐Ray Drive
  • Solid State Hard Drive
  • LCD Technology
Correct Answer: Solid State Hard Drive
1. A photograph occupies 10 MB of storage. A memory stick with 4GB capacity can store approximately ____ such photographs.
  • 300
  • 400
  • 500
  • 450
Correct Answer: 400
2. If one MegaByte is equal to 220  Bytes of computer data storage, then 2048 TeraBytes is equal to how much data storage?
  • 251 bits
  • 244 bits
  • 254 bits
  • 257 bits
Correct Answer: 254 bits
3. A computer is used to store photographs and videos. The average size of each photograph is 8 MB and the average size of each video is 400 MB. How much memory (in gigabytes) is needed to store 800 photographs and 80 videos? (1 KB = 1024 Bytes)
  • 3.75
  • 4.75
  • 34.25
  • 37.50
Correct Answer: 37.50
4. 1 yotta byte =
  • 1024 Terabytes
  • 1024 Exabytes
  • 1024 Zettabytes
  • 1024 Petabytes
Correct Answer: 1024 Zettabytes
5. Which is the smallest of these data storage capacities?
  • 2 Kb
  • 2049 Bytes
  • 0.5 Mb
  • 3 GB
Correct Answer: 2 Kb
6. In the light of the given statements. choose the correct answer from the options given below: (1 KB = 1024 bytes) Statement-I: 0.2 terabytes (TB) is equal to 204.8 gigabytes (GB) Statement-II: 1 petabyte (PB) is equal to 253  bits.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
1. In describing elements of communication, a person or an event which provides verbal or non-verbal cues to which someone can respond is known as: (UGC NET 3rd Dec 2021 Morning paper)
  • Message
  • Communication context
  • Channel
  • Source
Correct Answer: Source
In the light of the given statements. choose the correct answer from the options given below: Statement I: Operating system is a set of program necessary to carry out operation for a specified application. Statement II: Hardware represents the physical and tangible parts of the computer.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
In the light of the given statements. choose the correct answer from the options given below: Statement I: Operating system is a set of program necessary to carry out operation for a specified application. Statement II: Hardware represents the physical and tangible parts of the computer.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
What is a Utility program?
  • It translates data into a format understood by the device
  • It permits the sharing and exchange of data
  • It makes copies of files on another storage device
  • It is a part of the operating system which carries out defragmentation or disk formatting
Correct Answer: It is a part of the operating system which carries out defragmentation or disk formatting
A device driver is:
  • A port that connects a device and a system
  • A software that performs disk compression
  • A software that performs disk defragmentation
  • A software that communicates with the operating system and translates data into a format understood by the device
Correct Answer: A software that communicates with the operating system and translates data into a format understood by the device
1. In light of the given statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. Statement I: Compilers are software Statement II: Touch screen monitors are input/output devices
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
2. In computer related activities, which of the following is inappropriate for describing a language translator?
  • Assembler
  • Compiler
  • Interpreter
  • Codec
Correct Answer: Codec
3. A computer program that converts assembly language to machine language is-
  • Assembler
  • Intersection
  • Comparator
  • Complicate
Correct Answer: Assembler

Assertion A: VisiCalc, the first spreadsheet software application, is a commonly cited example of one of the first killer applications. Reason R: VisiCalc helped in bringing PCs into the business realm.
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
  • Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • A is true but R is false
  • A is false but R is true

  • Spreadsheet
  • Graphics Package
  • Document Processor
Correct Answer: Spreadsheet

  • Noise laden
  • Mediated
  • Point to point
  • Impersonal
Correct Answer: Point to point

  • Slow expression of words
  • Presentation without pause
  • Resorting to semantic jugglery
  • Varying the speed of voice and tone

C. keep a history of the websites visited by the users. D. give the ability to go backward and forward to websites opened. E. provide the user with access to Internet
  • D and E only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, C and E only
  • A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D only
