  • A and C only
  • B and C only
  • A only
  • C only
Correct Answer: C only

  • A, C, D and E
  • B and E
  • B, C and D

  • Cookies
  • Bookmarks
  • Blogs
  • Wikis
Correct Answer: Cookies

  • Cookie
  • Bookmark
  • Blog
  • Wiki
Correct Answer: Bookmark
1. Microsoft Access, Oracle and SQL are example of
  • File Data Base
  • Relational Data Base
  • Template
  • Attribute
Correct Answer: Relational Data Base
2. The data storage hierarchy consists of:
  • Bytes, bits, fields, records, files and databases
  • Bits, bytes, fields, records, files and databases
  • Bits, bytes, records, fields, files and databases
  • Bits, bytes, fields, files, records and databases
Correct Answer: Bits, bytes, fields, records, files and databases
1. Which one of the following is a disadvantage of using proprietary software rather than open source software?
  • Proprietary software can only be accessed with a password
  • Proprietary software can only be used on proprietary systems
  • Proprietary software is usually more expensive
  • Proprietary software can only be used with an Internet connection
Correct Answer: Proprietary software is usually more expensive
2. What is the example of COTS?
  • Microsoft Office
  • Gyandoot project
  • Bhoomi project
  • None of the above
Correct Answer: Microsoft Office
The process of writing computer instructions in a programming language is known as –
  • File
  • Coding
  • Folder
  • Processing
Correct Answer: Coding
1. What is the difference between mnemonic codes and machine codes?
  • There is no difference
  • Machine codes are in binary; mnemonic codes are in shorthand English.
  • Machine codes are in shorthand English; mnemonic codes are in binary.
  • Machine codes are in shorthand English; mnemonic codes are a high-level language
Correct Answer: Machine codes are in binary; mnemonic codes are in shorthand English.
2. PROLOG is an AI programming language which solves problems with a form of symbolic logic known as predicate calculus. It was developed in 1972 at the University of Marseilles by a team of specialists. Can you name the person who headed this team?
  • Alain Colmerauer
  • Nicklaus Wirth
  • Seymour Papert
  • John McCarthy
Correct Answer: Alain Colmerauer
1. In verbal communication, words act as: (UGC NET 20th Dec 2018 Morning)
  • Fillers
  • Symbols
  • Passive barriers
  • Decorative
Correct Answer: Symbols

  • C, D and E
  • B and C
  • A and B
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: B and C

  • Java

  • firmware
  • hard disk drive
  • IP address
Correct Answer: firmware

No correct answer provided

  • Hacking
  • Software piracy
  • Software literacy
  • Cracking
Correct Answer: Software piracy

  • public domain software
  • freeware
  • open-source software
  • shareware
Correct Answer: shareware
1. Which of the following are the main benefits of networking computers and devices rather than using a number of stand-alone computers? A. Devices, such as printers, can be shared, thus reducing costs. B. Licences to run software on networks are often far cheaper than buying licenses for an equivalent number of stand-alone computers. C. Users cannot share files and data. D. Access to reliable data that comes from a central source, such as a file server.
  • A and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B, C and D
  • A, B and D only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only
2. Computer Network is:
  • Collection of hardware components and computers
  • Interconnected by communication channels
  • Sharing of resources and information
  • All of the Above
Correct Answer: All of the Above

  • Precise

  • VoIP
  • Email
  • Voicemail
  • Text messaging
Correct Answer: VoIP

  • A, B and E only
  • A, B, D and E only
  • A, C, D and E only
  • B and C only
Correct Answer: A, B, D and E only
3. In light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: Assertion A: In computer networking, a MODEM is considered as both input and output device Reason R: MODEM sends data (upload/output) and receives data (download/input) at the same time
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
  • Both A and R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A
  • A is true but R is false
  • A is false but R is true
Correct Answer: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
4. Which of the following statements are true? A. Simplex data transmission is in two‐directions only B. Half‐duplex data transmission is in both directions but not at the same time C. Full‐duplex data transmission is in both directions simultaneously D. Serial data transmission is when data is sent, 8 bit at a time, over a single wire E. Parallel data transmission is when one bit of data is sent down over a single wire
  • A, B and C only
  • C, D and E only
  • C and D only
  • B and C only
Correct Answer: B and C only
5. Communication between a computer and a keyboard involves ________ transmission.
  • Automatic
  • half duplex
  • full duplex
  • simplex
Correct Answer: simplex

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

  • A, B and C only
  • B and D only
  • C and D only
  • A and D only
Correct Answer: B and D only

  • a, b and e
  • b, c, d and e
  • e only
  • a, b, c, d and e
Correct Answer: a, b, c, d and e

  • Router
  • Switch
  • Bridge
  • Modem
Correct Answer: Bridge
1. The hardware address of a computer network device consists of 48 bits. Which of the following is a valid address in hexadecimal numbers?
  • 00E0071944A0
  • 0A23B5
  • 1E07FG124372
  • 398A7E9412110408
Correct Answer: 00E0071944A0
2. A Network Interface Card (NIC) contains
  • Domain address
  • IP address
  • MAC address
  • Port address
Correct Answer: MAC address
3. In light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:   Statement I: The MAC address identifies which device is connected at a given IP address Statement II: MAC addresses are unique to each device
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
4. What is the size of MAC Address?
  • 16-bits
  • 32-bits
  • 48-bits
  • 64-bits
Correct Answer: 48-bits
1. With respect to data communication, which of the following statements is true about fibre optic cable?
  • Fibre optic cable carries data in pulses of light and is prone to interference
  • Fibre optic cables carries data as electronic signals and is not prone to interference
  • Fibre optic cable carries data as electronic signals and is prone to interference
  • Fibre optic cable carries data in pulses of light and is not prone to interference
Correct Answer: Fibre optic cable carries data in pulses of light and is not prone to interference
2. Which of the following cables can transmit data at high speeds?
  • Flat cable
  • Optic fibre cable
  • Co-axial cable
  • Twisted pair cable
Correct Answer: Optic fibre cable
1. In the light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: Statement I: Wi‐Fi has a shorter range than Bluetooth. Statement II: Wi‐Fi can transmit data at a faster rate than Bluetooth.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
2. Kavita uses a Wifi adapter to connect the computer to an interactive whiteboard. Which one of these statements is false?
  • Wifi has a greater range than Bluetooth
  • Wifi signals are capable of passing through solid objects
  • Bluetooth has a greater range than Wifi
  • Bluetooth signals are capable of passing through solid objects
Correct Answer: Bluetooth has a greater range than Wifi
3. Which of the following is true about the wireless networking? (i) It is easier to expand the network (ii) Data is less secured than wired system (iii) Reliability is more than wired (iv) Faster than wired network
  • i, ii and iv
  • i and ii
  • ii and iii
  • i, ii and iii
Correct Answer: i and ii
4. Which of the following statements is/are true? (i) Fibre optic cables are wooden fibres to provide high quality transmission. (ii) Wireless communication provides anytime, anywhere connection to both computers and telephones. (iii) Mobile phones are capable of providing voice communication and also digital messaging service.
  • i and iii
  • ii and iii
  • i and ii
  • iii only
Correct Answer: ii and iii
What is the meaning of Bandwidth in Network?
  • Transmission capacity of a communication channels
  • Connected Computers in the Network
  • Class of IP used in Network
  • None of Above
Correct Answer: Transmission capacity of a communication channels

  • A, D and E only
  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only

  • A, D and E
  • B, C and D
  • C, D and E
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: C, D and E
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 1st Oct 2022- Evening shift) Assertion A: As regards communication, a major function is to build, manipulate and use symbols. Reason R: One of the functions of communication is to entertain the receivers.
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • A is true but R is false.
  • Both A are R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is false but R is true.
Correct Answer: Both A are R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A.
4. Given below are two statements (10th Oct 2022 Evening Shift) Statement I: Non-verbal signals are used to emphasize and support the verbal communication. Statement II: Non-verbal signals are not a substitute for verbal communication
  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Both statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is false but II is true
  • Both statement I and II are true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but II is false
1. Which of the following statements are correct? A. A WLAN is a wide area network B. A hub sends an incoming data packet to the correct device on a network C. An IP address is assigned to a device at the manufacturing stage D. A network Interface card is needed to allow a device to connect to a network E. Routers inspect data packets received over the internet
  • A and B only
  • B and E only
  • D and E only
  • B, C and D only
Correct Answer: D and E only
2. What are Firewalls?
  • Used for address translation in the Network layer
  • Used to store the Network Interface Card
  • Used for Network congestion control
  • Hardware or software that sits between a user's computer and an external computer
Correct Answer: Hardware or software that sits between a user's computer and an external computer
3. The following list indicates different types of computer networks. Arrange them in an ascending order on the basis of geographical space implied.
  • WAN, LAN, MAN
  • LAN, MAN, WAN
  • MAN, LAN, WAN
  • LAN, WAN, MAN
Correct Answer: LAN, MAN, WAN
Network congestion occurs
  • in case of traffic overloading
  • when a system terminates
  • when connection between two nodes terminates
  • none of the mentioned
Correct Answer: in case of traffic overloading
1. Which of the following statements about computer networks are TRUE? A. An intranet is a public network. B. The Internet is a group of interconnected networks. C. An extranet is an internal network that can be accessed externally by authorized users
  • A and B only
  • A and C only
  • B and C only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: B and C only
2. Which of the following statements regarding Intranets are correct? A. The Intranet can be accessed from anywhere by anyone B. The Intranet has public access C. They are more secure than internet D. In Intranet, it is possible to control external links
  • A, B and C only
  • C and D only
  • A, C and D only
  • B and C only
Correct Answer: C and D only
3. In the light of the given statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: Statement I: A company-wide network, closed to public access, which uses internet-type technology, is called World Wide Web Statement II: MODEM is a device that enables a computer to communicate over telephone lines.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
4. Which of the following statements are correct?  (i) Internet is larger than intranet (ii) Intranet is larger than Internet (iii) Internet and intranet are same (iv) Internet is a network of networks (v) World Wide Web is an example of intranet
  • ii and v only
  • i and iv only
  • iii and v only
  • ii and iii only
Correct Answer: i and iv only
1. Which of the following protocol is/are defined in Transport layer?
  • FTP
  • TCP
  • UDP
  • Both B and C
Correct Answer: Both B and C
2. Repeater operates in which layer of the OSI model?
  • Physical layer
  • Data link layer
  • Network layer
  • Transport layer
Correct Answer: Physical layer
Which of the following layer of OSI model also called end-to-end layer?
  • Presentation layer
  • Network layer
  • Session layer
  • Transport layer
Correct Answer: Transport layer
Router operates in which layer of OSI Reference Model?
  • Layer 1 (Physical Layer)
  • Layer 3 (Network Layer)
  • Layer 4 (Transport Layer)
  • Layer 7 (Application Layer)
Correct Answer: Layer 3 (Network Layer)
1. Match the items given in List – I with the most suitable items in List – II: List – I a. Wireless networking b. Network devices c. Network models d. Network Topology List – II i. Ring ii. Infrared iii. Network Repeater iv. TCP/IP 4 layered protocol
  • a-ii, b-i, c-iii, d-iv
  • a-iv, b-ii, c-iii, d-i
  • a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i
  • a-iii, b-iv, c-i, d-ii
Correct Answer: a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i
2. Which network is able to connect and send data to each computer via central hub or switch without looking where the data is sent?
  • Star
  • Router
  • Bus
  • LAN
Correct Answer: Star
3. An alternate name for the completely connected network topology is
  • Star
  • Ring
  • Mesh
  • Bus
Correct Answer: Mesh
1. Given below is a typical URL that identifies a web page: http://book.com/author/index.html The hostname 'book.com' is converted into an IP address by a ____________ server that has a database of matching names and addresses and is queried for the address.
  • SMTP
  • FTP
  • DNS
  • HTTP
Correct Answer: DNS
2. Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is:
  • Transferring file from one computer to another
  • A text‐based protocol used when sending emails
  • Protocol used to find an IP address
  • Fetching an HTML document from a web server
Correct Answer: Fetching an HTML document from a web server

1. Which of the following constitute the paralanguage in communication? (UGC NET 18th Dec 2018 Evening) (a) Pitch of the voice (b) Internal noise (c) External noise (d) Use of pause (e) Rate and volume of speech
  • (a), (c) and (e)
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (a), (d) and (e)
  • (a), (b) and (c)
Correct Answer: (a), (d) and (e)
2. Which of the following is an exclusive example of Non‐verbal cue that includes the pitch, rate, volume and use of pauses? (UGC NET 20th  November 2021 Evening paper)
  • Linear Model of Communication
  • Para‐Language
  • Non‐Verbal Cues
  • Interactional Model
Correct Answer: Para‐Language

  • A, B and C
  • B, C and E
  • B, C and D
Correct Answer: B, C and D

  • Person

  • a and b only
  • b and c only
  • a and c only
  • a, b and c

1. In light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below Statement I: In computer networking, the purpose of changing the IP addressing scheme between IPv4 and IPv6 is to allow for more IP addresses. Statement II: A web cookie is stored on the server machine.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
2. In IPv6, an address is given by eight 16-bit numbers usually written in hexadecimal. For example, here is an IP address: 3221 : IDE5 : CAI4 : ADIF : 1111 : 1111 : 1111 : 1111 How many unique address does IPv6 support overall?
  • 216
  • 264
  • 655364
  • 655368
Correct Answer: 655368
3. The number of bits in IPv6 addressing are:
  • 32 bits
  • 64 bits
  • 128 bits
  • 256 bits
Correct Answer: 128 bits
4. In a classful IPv4 addressing, what are the number of netID bits and number of hostID bits for the network Class A?
  • 16, 16
  • 12, 12
  • 8, 24
  • 24, 8
Correct Answer: 8, 24
Each IP packet must contain:
  • Only Source address
  • Only Destination address
  • Source and Destination address
  • Source or Destination address
Correct Answer: Source and Destination address

  • b only
  • both a and b
  • neither a nor b
Correct Answer: both a and b

  • A, B, C
  • A, C, E
  • B, C, E
  • C, D, E
Correct Answer: B, C, E
2. Select the option that lists components for a cyberspace address (URL) in the correct order from beginning to end?
  • Protocol, domain name of the host, path/file
  • Path/file, protocol, domain name of the host
  • Protocol, path/file, domain name of the host
  • Domain name of the host, protocol, path/file
Correct Answer: Protocol, domain name of the host, path/file

  • .edu
  • .com
  • .inst
Correct Answer: .edu

  • Anti-virus

Correct Answer: Ill health
Which of the following best describes a computer worm?
  • Malware that does not replicate itself but spreads through social engineering
  • Malware that replicated by attaching itself to a word processing document
  • Malware that replicates by attaching itself to an executable programme
  • Malware that replicate itself as standalone software
Correct Answer: Malware that replicate itself as standalone software
1. A destructive computer program that masquerades as a useful application is called
  • Virus
  • Worm
  • Trojan
  • Firmware
Correct Answer: Trojan
2. Which of the following statements about malware are true? A. A Trojan horse is malware distinguished as legitimate software B. A virus inserts itself into another program. It runs and spreads itself when the program is opened C. A worm is similar to a virus except that it does not need a program in order to run. It spreads by itself.
  • A, B
  • A, C
  • B, C
  • A, B, C
Correct Answer: A, B, C
3. Which one of the following is a type of malware embedded in a program on a computer that will set off a malicious function when certain conditions are met?
  • Worm
  • Trojan
  • Spyware
  • Logic bomb
Correct Answer: Logic bomb
1. A keylogger is an example of:
  • Trojan
  • Spyware
  • Worm
  • Logic Bomb
Correct Answer: Spyware
2. What is Anti‐spyware software?
  • Checks files before they are loaded on a computer
  • Manages the data traffic
  • It detects and removes programs installed illegally on a user's computer system
  • Makes the files non‐readable
Correct Answer: It detects and removes programs installed illegally on a user's computer system
3. What is spyware in respect of computer software?
  • Software that aims to gather information about a person without his/her knowledge, and that may send such information to another entity.
  • Legitimate software that allows companies to monitor and supervise the computers of their employees from a central location.
  • Software used to disrupt computer operation or gain access to private computer systems.
  • A computer program hidden within another seemingly harmless program that produces copies of itself them into another programs or files.
Correct Answer: Software that aims to gather information about a person without his/her knowledge, and that may send such information to another entity.
Extra browser window of commercials that open automatically on browsing web pages is called:
  • Spam
  • Virus
  • Phishing
  • Pop-up
Correct Answer: Pop-up
A virus hoax is an untrue virus warning, email. When you receive a virus hoax such as the one below, what is the appropriate action? Subject: Warning! A new Virus has been detected in your computer. Format your hard disk and re-install all software’s immediately.
  • Ignore this email
  • Format your hard disk and re-install all software immediately
  • Reply to the sender
  • Forward this email to your friends
Correct Answer: Ignore this email
An unsolicited e-mail message sent to many recipients at once is a
  • Inbox
  • Spam
  • Virus
  • Attack
Correct Answer: Spam

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false

  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true

She forwarded this message to her friend, Arun and asked him to do the same. But Arun refuses and tells Madhu that her personal and private information, such as online account names, login information and passwords can be stolen and she should be careful of such ______ attacks.
  • Phishing
  • Spamming
  • Scamming
  • Plagiarism
Correct Answer: Scamming

  • B and C Only
  • C and D Only

Correct Answer: B and C Only

  • Digital security infrastructure
  • Food security infrastructure
  • Health care and education infrastructure
  • Telecommunication and transportation infrastructure
Correct Answer: Digital security infrastructure
2. Match the implementation technique with network security.
No correct answer provided
3. Asymmetric Encryption: Why can a message encrypted with the Public Key only be decrypted with the receiver's appropriate Private Key?
  • Not true, the message can also be decrypted with the Public Key
  • A so called "one-way function with back door" is applied for the encryption
  • The Public Key contains a special function which is used to encrypt the message and which can only be reversed by the appropriate Private Key.
  • The encrypted message contains the function for decryption which identifies the Private Key
Correct Answer: The Public Key contains a special function which is used to encrypt the message and which can only be reversed by the appropriate Private Key.

1. 1’s complement of 1011101 is ____________.
  • 0101110
  • 1001101
  • 0100010
  • 1100101
Correct Answer: 0100010
2. 2’s complement of 11001011 is ____________.
  • 01010111
  • 11010100
  • 00110101
  • 11100010
Correct Answer: 00110101
3. The binary equivalent of is (-23)10 is (2’ complement system for negative numbers is used:
  • 111010010
  • 111010001
  • 111010111
  • 111110001
Correct Answer: 111010001
4. The binary equivalent of (–15)10 is (2’s complement system is used):
  • 11110001
  • 11110000
  • 10001111
  • 11100001
Correct Answer: 11110001
5. The binary equivalent of (-19)10 in signed magnitude system is
  • 11101100
  • 11101101
  • 10010011
  • 10010111
Correct Answer: 10010011

  • e-Administration
  • e-Governance
  • e-Marketing
Correct Answer: e-Governance
4. A group’s access to digital technology and another group’s lack of access to it, will cause a disparity known as:
  • Internet inequality
  • Web inequality
  • Technological imbalance
  • Digital divide
Correct Answer: Digital divide
5. One aspect of e-governance deals with flow of information between the Government and citizens. Which of the following are Government to Citizens (G2C) initiatives?  (i) e-Help (ii) e-Health (iii) e-Tendering (iv) e-Feedback
  • i and ii only
  • iii and iv only
  • ii and iv only
  • ii and iii only
Correct Answer: i and ii only
1. Which domain does MCA 21 e-governance project focus upon?
  • Immigration
  • Passport
  • Corporate affairs
  • Pension
Correct Answer: Corporate affairs
2. Identify the correct words to complete the sentences.
No correct answer provided
Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding e-governance? (a) Decreasing transparency is an ICT enabled advantage of e-Governance. (b) e-Governance is related to the implementation of ICT in the government processes and functions. (c) Common Service Centres (CSCs) help in providing and using e-Governance related services.
  • a, b, and c
  • b and c only
  • a and c only
  • a and b only
Correct Answer: b and c only
Which of the following statements is/are correct about e-Pragati? 1. 'e-Pragati' is a comprehensive framework for implementing e-governance and provides e-services to citizens of Karnataka. 2. It is developed in association with Infosys.
  • Only 1
  • Only 2
  • Both 1 and 2
  • Neither 1 nor 2
Correct Answer: Neither 1 nor 2
1. In communication, cross‐cultural barrier refers to: (UGC NET 29th Nov 2021 Evening paper)
  • Physical entities
  • Perceptions of people
  • Sincerity of speaker
  • General human values
Correct Answer: Perceptions of people
Drag the words into the correct boxes
No correct answer provided
Which of the following statements is/are correct? A. Digital governance has been legalized by the IT Act (2000) in India. B. IT Act is a watershed in conceptualizing administrative reforms in India. C. Digital governance is a boon in curbing bureaucratic red-tapism.
  • B and C
  • B only
  • A and C
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A, B and C
1. In a keyboard, left-right-up-down set of keys facilitates which among the following functions?
  • Deleting data
  • Page scrolling
  • Launching start menu
  • Initiating search and help
Correct Answer: Page scrolling
2. Which of the following keys of keyboard are called modifier keys?  (i) Ctrl (ii) Shift (iii) End (iv) Alt
  • i, ii and iii
  • i, ii and iv
  • i, iii and iv
  • ii, iii and iv
Correct Answer: i, ii and iv
1. F2 key use to change the ________ of file/folder.
  • Colour
  • Size
  • Name
  • Style
Correct Answer: Name
2. To move to the bottom of a document, you can press _____.
  • Home key
  • End key
  • Ctrl + End
  • Insert key
Correct Answer: End key
1. Which of the following is a short-cut to “Undo Typing”?
  • Ctrl+Y
  • Ctrl+Z
  • Ctrl+S
  • Ctrl+P
Correct Answer: Ctrl+Z
2. What happens when you press CTRL + V key?
  • A capital V letter is typed into your document at the cursor point
  • The chosen drawing items are circulated vertically on the page
  • The selected item is pasted to the clipboard
  • The selected item is pasted from the clipboard
Correct Answer: The selected item is pasted from the clipboard
3. Ctrl + X is used for:
  • Copy selected items
  • Cut selected items
  • Move the selected data
  • Exchange selected items
Correct Answer: Cut selected items
4. Short cut to justify a paragraph is:
  • Ctrl + S
  • Ctrl + A
  • Ctrl + J
  • Ctrl + P
Correct Answer: Ctrl + J
1. What is the short cut key for Print a Document?
  • Alt + P
  • Ctrl + P
  • Shift + P
  • Ctrl + Alt + P
Correct Answer: Ctrl + P
2. What is the short cut key for Select all contents of the page?
  • Ctrl + A
  • Alt + A
  • Ctrl + Alt + A
  • ALT + DEL + A
Correct Answer: Ctrl + A
3. What is the keyboard short key to move to the next workbook?
  • Ctrl + F6
  • Ctrl + F5
  • Ctrl + F3
  • Ctrl + F7
Correct Answer: Ctrl + F6
4. What is the short cut key to paste a cell?
  • Ctrl + S
  • Ctrl + A
  • Ctrl + V
  • Ctrl + C
Correct Answer: Ctrl + V
5. What is the keyboard shortcut to open an old workbook?
  • Ctrl + O
  • Ctrl + F
  • Ctrl + M
  • Ctrl + N
Correct Answer: Ctrl + O
Truth and falsity are attributes of: (UGC NET Dec 2018- Morning Shift)
  • Debates
  • Arguments
  • Propositions
  • Opinions
Correct Answer: Propositions
1. ‘Every law is an evil, for every law is an infraction of liberty’. The above is: (UGC NET Dec 2018- Evening Shift)
  • A justification of beliefs
  • An argument
  • A proposition of facts
  • An explanation of facts
Correct Answer: An argument
2. A cluster of propositions with a structure that exhibits some inference is called: (UGC NET Dec 2015)
  • An explanation
  • An argument
  • An implication
  • A description
Correct Answer: An argument
3. Which one of the following is not an argument? (UGC NET June 2012)
  • Devadutt does not eat in the day so he must be eating at night.
  • If Devadutt is growing fat and if he does not eat during the day, he will be eating at night.
  • Devadutt eats in the night so he does not eat during the day.
  • Since Devadutt does not eat in the day, he must be eating in the night.
Correct Answer: If Devadutt is growing fat and if he does not eat during the day, he will be eating at night.
1. The argument which claims that its conclusion is conclusively supported by its premises is called (UGC NET 21 June 2019 Evening Shift)
  • Analogical Argument
  • Inductive Argument
  • Demonstrative Argument
  • Deductive Argument
Correct Answer: Deductive Argument
2. The product of any three consecutive integers is divisible by 6. Therefore, 3×4×5 (=60), is divisible by 6? Which type of reasoning is embodied here? (UGC NET 2 Dec 2019 Morning Shift)
  • Deductive Reasoning
  • Inductive Reasoning
  • Non-verbal Reasoning
  • Abductive Reasoning
Correct Answer: Deductive Reasoning
3. Among the following which one of the arguments is rooted in empirical investigation? (UGC NET June 2018 evening shift)
  • Hypothetical
  • Inductive
  • Implicative
  • Deductive
Correct Answer: Deductive
1. This barrel contains 100 apples. Three apples selected at random were found to be ripe. Therefore probably all 100 apples are ripe. Which type of argument is exemplified in the above set of statements? (UGC NET 04 Dec 2021- Evening Shift)
  • Inductive
  • Deductive
  • Hypothetical Syllogism
  • Modus Ponens
Correct Answer: Deductive
2. Inductive argument proceeds from: (UGC NET 24 June 2019 Evening Shift)
  • Universal to Particular
  • Particular to Universal
  • Universal to Universal
  • Particular to Particular
Correct Answer: Particular to Universal
3. The reasoning which would be helpful in seeking new knowledge of facts about the world is: (UGC NET Dec 2018 Morning shit)
  • Inductive
  • Demonstrative
  • Deductive
  • Speculative
Correct Answer: Inductive
4. Identify the type of argument based upon the description.
No correct answer provided
1. Semantic barrier of communication is implied when the: (UGC NET 24th June 2019 Evening Paper)
  • signal is lost before reaching the receiver
  • receiver's attention is diverted
  • receiver does not understand the meaning of the message
  • message transmitted by the source is unclear
Correct Answer: receiver does not understand the meaning of the message
2. Which of the following is a semantic barrier? (UGC NET 8th Oct 2022- Evening shift)
  • Redundancy in writing
  • Unclear printing in newspapers
  • Blurred image on television
  • Static broadcasting
Correct Answer: Redundancy in writing
Drag the words into the correct boxes
No correct answer provided
1. In the light of the given statements. choose the correct answer from the options. (UGC NET 05 Jan 2022- Evening Shift) Statement I: The evaluation of an argument involves two steps namely evaluating the link between premises and conclusion and evaluating the truth of the premises. Statement II: Deductive arguments in which the conclusion actually follows from the premises are said to be valid. and those that also have true premises are said to be sound.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
2. Which one of the following options describes a valid deductive argument with all the premises and the conclusion as True? (UGC NET 29 Nov 2021- Evening Shift)
  • Probable Argument
  • Improbable Argument
  • Unsound Argument
  • Sound Argument
Correct Answer: Sound Argument
3. What is the nature of a logical argument? Choose the Correct answer from the following: (UGC NET 24 Sept 2020 Morning Shift)
  • Justified or Unjustified
  • True or false
  • Valid and Invalid
  • Verifiable and not verifiable
Correct Answer: Valid and Invalid
4. Validity in logical reasoning refers to: (UGC NET Dec 2018 Morning shift) (a) Any simple single proposition (b) Relation between premises and conclusions (c) The conclusion alone (d) Truth of the premises
  • b only
  • d only
  • a and b
  • b and c
Correct Answer: b only
5. In which of the following instances, deductive argument is invalid? (UGC NET Dec 2018)
  • When its premises are true but conclusion is false
  • When its premises and conclusion are all true
  • When its premises are false and conclusion is true
  • When its premises and conclusion are all false
Correct Answer: When its premises are true but conclusion is false
6. Which of the following statements are true? (UGC NET Dec 2011) 1. Some arguments, while not completely valid, are almost valid. 2. A sound argument may be invalid. 3. A cogent argument may have a probably false conclusion. 4. A statement may be true or false.
  • 1 and 2
  • 1, 3 and 4
  • 4 only
  • 3 and 4
Correct Answer: 3 and 4
1. In the light of the given statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022- Morning shift) Statement I: If a deductive argument is valid and its premises are true, we say that the argument is sound. Statement II: If an inductive argument is strong and its premises are true, we say that it is cogent.
  • Both Statement I and II are true
  • Both Statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is true but statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and II are true
2. Consider following statements. Statement I- The Inductive Arguments are Valid/Invalid or Sound/Unsound. Statement II- The Deductive Arguments are Strong/Weak or Cogent/non-Cogent.
  • Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
  • Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
1. The standard form categorical proposition of ‘Roses are fragrant’ is (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022- Morning shift)
  • Some Roses are fragrant
  • Some fragrant things are not roses
  • No fragrant Things are roses
  • All roses are fragrant things
Correct Answer: All roses are fragrant things
2. ‘All Judges are fairminded’ is an example of __________ proposition. (UGC NET 20 Jun 2019 Morning Shift)
  • Universal affirmative
  • Universal negative
  • Particular affirmative
  • Particular negative
Correct Answer: Universal affirmative
3. ‘Some animals are not harmful’ is an example of which of the following types of propositions? (UGC NET 13 Nov 2020- Evening Shift)
  • Particular Affirmative
  • Particular Negative
  • Universal Negative
  • Universal Affirmative
Correct Answer: Particular Negative
4. Which sentence cannot fit into the AEIO framework? (UGC NET 12 Nov 2020- Morning Shift)
  • No salt has iodine
  • The salt on the table has iodine
  • All salt has iodine
  • Some salt has iodine
Correct Answer: The salt on the table has iodine
1. Which of the following refers to an attribute of every categorical proposition which is determined by whether the proposition affirms or denies class inclusion? (UGC NET 02 Dec 2019- Morning Shift)
  • Quality
  • Quantity
  • Distribution
  • Comparison
Correct Answer: Quality
2. Copula is that part of proposition which denotes the relationship between: (UGC NET Jun 2007)
  • Subject and predicate
  • Known and unknown
  • Major premise and minor premise
  • Subject and object
Correct Answer: Subject and predicate
1. In the statement “No dogs are reptiles”, which terms are distributed? (UGC NET 06 Dec 2019- Evening Shift)
  • Only subject term
  • Only predicate term
  • Both subject and predicate terms
  • Neither subject nor predicate terms
Correct Answer: Both subject and predicate terms
2. Consider the following statements with reference to categorical propositions: (UGC NET 05 Dec 2019- Evening Shift) (a) “Some birds are mammals” is a particular affirmative proposition and it distributes subject term alone. (b) “Some birds are mammals” is a particular affirmative proposition and it distributes predicate term alone. (c) “Some birds are mammals” is a particular affirmative proposition and it distributes both subject and predicate terms. (d) “Some birds are mammals” is a particular affirmative proposition and it distributes neither subject nor predicate term.
  • Only (a) and (d) are correct
  • Only (c) and (d) are correct
  • Only (b) is correct
  • Only (d) is correct
Correct Answer: Only (d) is correct
3. Consider the following statements with reference to the proposition “Some girls are not students” (UGC NET 04 Dec 2019- Evening Shift) (a) Subjects term students is distributed (b) Predicate term girls is undistributed (c) Predicate term students is distributed (d) Subject term girls is undistributed
  • Only (a) and (c) are correct
  • Only (b) and (c) are correct
  • Only (a) and (d) are correct
  • Only (c) and (d) are correct
Correct Answer: Only (c) and (d) are correct
1. Identify the major term in the given syllogism. (UGC NET 25 Jun 2020- Morning Shift) All gentlemen are polite No criminals are polite No criminals are gentlemen
  • Predicate in the premises
  • Subject in the premises
  • Subject of the first premise and predicate of the conclusion
  • Subject of the second premise and subject of the conclusion
Correct Answer: Subject of the first premise and predicate of the conclusion
2. Which of the following are not true about Categorical Syllogism? (UGC NET Sept 2020- Evening shift) (i) There are 3 Propositions (ii) There are 3 terms, each appearing twice (iii) The Subject “S” and the Predicate “P” are always in Conclusion (iv) First Premises is Major (v) Second Premises is Minor (vi) Subject of Conclusion- Minor Premises (vii) Predicate of Conclusion- Major Premises (viii) Remaining two are called Middle Terms “M”
  • ii only
  • iv and v only
  • iii only
  • None of the statements are true
Correct Answer: None of the statements are true
1. Pick the correct option to represent the given argument (UGC NET 24 Nov 2021- Morning Shift) All artists are egoists Some artists are paupers Therefore, some paupers are egoists
  • AII ‐ I figure
  • AII ‐ II figure
  • AII ‐ III figure
  • AII ‐ IV figure
Correct Answer: AII ‐ III figure
2. Which of the following codes correctly represents the figure and mood of the argument? (UGC NET 28 Nov 2021- Evening Shift) All businessmen are self‐confident No self‐confident men are religious Therefore, no religious men are businessmen
  • AEE ‐ I
  • AEE ‐ II
  • AEE ‐ III
  • AEE ‐ IV
Correct Answer: AEE ‐ IV
3. Which of the following code correctly represents the figure and mood of the argument? (UGC NET 28 Nov 2021- Morning Shift) No musicians are Italians All barbers are Musicians Therefore, No barbers are Italians
  • EAE ‐ I
  • EAE ‐ II
  • EAE ‐ III
  • EAE ‐ IV
Correct Answer: EAE ‐ I
5. Which one of the following decides the figure of a categorical proposition? (UGC NET 24 Sept 2020- Evening Shift)
  • Major term
  • Minor term
  • Middle term
  • Copula
Correct Answer: Middle term
5. What is Mood of following categorical syllogism? No Birds are Mammals All Dogs are Mammals No Dogs are Birds
  • EIO
  • EAE
  • AEI
  • AEO
Correct Answer: EAE
1. Which of the following statements are logically contradictory to each other? (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023- Morning shift) A. All philosophers are industrialists. B. Some philosophers are not industrialists. C. No philosophers are industrialists. D. No industrialists are philosophers.
  • A and B only
  • A, C and D only
  • A and C only
  • C and D only
Correct Answer: A and B only
2. If the statement ‘No philosophers are industrialists' is given as true which of the following statements can be immediately inferred from it to be true? (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023- Morning shift)
  • No philosophers are rich persons
  • All industrialists are philosophers
  • Some philosophers are industrialists
  • Some philosophers are not industrialists
Correct Answer: Some philosophers are not industrialists
3. If the statement "No lions are herbivorous animals", is given as true, then which of the following statements can be immediately inferred to be false? (UGC NET 14 Mar 2023- Morning shift) A. All lions are herbivorous animals. B. Some lions are herbivorous animals. C. Some lions are not herbivorous animals.
  • B only
  • A and B only
  • A and C only
  • C only
Correct Answer: A and B only
4. If the statement "Some golf players are not rich persons", is given as false which of the following statements can be inferred to be true? (UGC NET 16 Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. All golf players are rich persons. B. Some golf players are rich persons. C. No golf players are rich persons. D. Some rich persons are golf players.
  • A and D only
  • B and C only
  • A, B and D only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only
5. Which of the following propositions are so related that they cannot both be false, although they may both be true? (UGC NET 2 Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. Some cars are polluting vehicles. B. Some cars are not polluting vehicles. C. All cars are polluting vehicles. D. No cars are polluting vehicles.
  • C and D only
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and C only
Correct Answer: A and B only
6. Which of the following propositions are so related that if one of them is true, the other has to be false and vice-versa? (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Evening Shift) A. All camels are herbivorous. B. Some camels are herbivorous. C. Some camels are not herbivorous. D. No Camels are herbivorous.
  • A and D only
  • B and D only
  • B and C only
  • A and B only
Correct Answer: B and D only
1. Which of the following are barriers to effective communication? (UGC NET 21st June 2019 Morning Paper) (a) Physical noise (b) Semantic noise (c) Psychological noise (d) Non-semantic noise
  • (a) and (d) only
  • (a), (c) and (d)
  • (a), (b) and (d)
  • (a), (b) and (c)
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c)
2. In communication, a major barrier to reception of messages is: (UGC NET Jun 2010)
  • audience knowledge
  • audience education
  • audience attitude
  • audience income
Correct Answer: audience attitude
3. Which of the following are myths about communication? (UGC NET 24th Nov 2021 Morning paper)  a. Good communicators are born, not made b. Stage fright is not a communication apprehension c. Communication skills have nothing to do with relationships d. Communication has its own barriers e. Practice leads to the right habits of communication
  • b, c and d only
  • a, b and c only
  • a, d and e only
  • c, d and e only
Correct Answer: a, b and c only
4. Which one of the following, is excluded from the list of communication barriers ? (UGC NET 03rd Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Physical
  • Semantic
  • Psychological
  • Philosophical
Correct Answer: Philosophical
1. Which of the following statements are logically contradictory to each other? (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023- Morning shift) A. All philosophers are industrialists. B. Some philosophers are not industrialists. C. No philosophers are industrialists. D. No industrialists are philosophers.
  • A and B only
  • A, C and D only
  • A and C only
  • C and D only
Correct Answer: A and B only
2. If the statement ‘No philosophers are industrialists' is given as true which of the following statements can be immediately inferred from it to be true? (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023- Morning shift)
  • No philosophers are rich persons
  • All industrialists are philosophers
  • Some philosophers are industrialists
  • Some philosophers are not industrialists
Correct Answer: Some philosophers are not industrialists
3. If the statement "No lions are herbivorous animals", is given as true, then which of the following statements can be immediately inferred to be false? (UGC NET 14 Mar 2023- Morning shift) A. All lions are herbivorous animals. B. Some lions are herbivorous animals. C. Some lions are not herbivorous animals.
  • B only
  • A and B only
  • A and C only
  • C only
Correct Answer: A and B only
4. If the statement "Some golf players are not rich persons", is given as false which of the following statements can be inferred to be true? (UGC NET 16 Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. All golf players are rich persons. B. Some golf players are rich persons. C. No golf players are rich persons. D. Some rich persons are golf players.
  • A and D only
  • B and C only
  • A, B and D only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only
5. Which of the following propositions are so related that they cannot both be false, although they may both be true? (UGC NET 2 Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. Some cars are polluting vehicles. B. Some cars are not polluting vehicles. C. All cars are polluting vehicles. D. No cars are polluting vehicles.
  • C and D only
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and C only
Correct Answer: A and B only
6. Which of the following propositions are so related that if one of them is true, the other has to be false and vice-versa? (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Evening Shift) A. All camels are herbivorous. B. Some camels are herbivorous. C. Some camels are not herbivorous. D. No Camels are herbivorous.
  • A and D only
  • B and D only
  • B and C only
  • A and B only
Correct Answer: B and D only
1. Which one of the following propositions is logically equivalent to the proposition-"Some attorneys are logicians"? (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Some logicians are not attorneys
  • Some attorneys are non-logicians
  • Some logicians are attorneys
  • Some non-logicians are not non-attorneys
Correct Answer: Some logicians are attorneys
2. Which of the following statement is logically equivalent to "No birds are mammals"? (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Some birds are not mammals
  • Some non-birds are mammals
  • No mammals are birds
  • All non-birds are mammals
Correct Answer: No mammals are birds
3. Which of the following statements is logically equivalent to the statement -' No metals are gases'? (UGC NET 24 Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • All non-metals are gases
  • No gases are metals
  • No metals are non-gases
  • All non-gases are non- metals
Correct Answer: No gases are metals
1. Which of the following statement is logically equivalent to the statement “All tigers are hunting animals"? (UGC NET 11 Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Some hunting animals are tigers
  • No tigers are non-hunting animals
  • No hunting animals are tigers
  • Some hunting animals are not tigers
Correct Answer: No tigers are non-hunting animals
2. Which of the following propositions is logically equivalent to the proposition- "All frogs are amphibians"? (UGC NET 05 Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • No amphibians are non-frogs
  • No frogs are non-amphibians
  • Some amphibians are frogs
  • Some amphibians are not frogs
Correct Answer: No frogs are non-amphibians
3. Which of the following statements are logically equivalent? (UGC NET 13 Mar 2023 Evening Shift) A. Some physicists are outstanding professors. B. Some physicists are not non-outstanding professors. C. No outstanding professors are physicists. D. Some non-outstanding professors are not non-physicists.
  • A, B and D only
  • A and B only
  • B and D only
  • A and C only
Correct Answer: A and B only
4. Which of the following statements is logically equivalent to the statement-"some plants are carnivorous organisms."? (UGC NET 15 Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • No carnivorous organisms are plants
  • Some plants are non-carnivorous organisms
  • No plants are non-carnivorous organisms
  • Some plants are not non-carnivorous organisms
Correct Answer: Some plants are non-carnivorous organisms
1. Which of the following statements are logically equivalent? (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023 Morning shift) A. No philosophers are industrialists. B. No industrialists are philosophers. C. All non-industrialists are non-philosophers. D. All philosophers are non-industrialists.
  • A, B and C only
  • A, B and D only
  • A, C and D only
  • B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only
2. Which of the following statements are equivalent? (UGC NET 16 Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. All plants are living organisms. B. No plants are non-living organisms. C. Some plants are living organisms. D. All non-living organisms are non- plants.
  • A, B and D only
  • A and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only
3. Which of the following statement is logically equivalent to the following statement- "Some dogs are not aggressive animals"? (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Some aggressive animals are not dogs
  • Some non-aggressive animals are not non-dogs
  • Some dogs are aggressive animals
  • Some non-dogs are aggressive animals
Correct Answer: Some non-aggressive animals are not non-dogs
4. Which of the following statements are logically equivalent? (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. No amphibians are mammals. B. All non-mammals are non-amphibians. C. All amphibians are non-mammals. D. No mammals are amphibians.
  • A, B and C Only
  • A, C and D Only
  • A, B and D Only
  • A and D Only
Correct Answer: A, C and D Only
5. Which of the following statements are logically equivalent? (UGC NET 11 Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. some dogs are not aggressive animals. B. some dogs are aggressive animals. C. some non-dogs are aggressive animals. D. some non-aggressive animals are not non-dogs.
  • A, B and C only
  • A and C only
  • A and D only
  • B and C only
Correct Answer: A and D only
1. "If I were, a heavy smoker, smoking would shorten my life. That's why I do not smoke. And I expect to live a long and healthy life". Which fallacy is committed in the above argument? (UGC NET 11th Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Existential fallacy
  • Undistributed middle
  • Affirming the consequent
  • Denying the antecedent
Correct Answer: Denying the antecedent
2. "Since all professors are competent, and no competent people are underpaid. Therefore no professors are underpaid". Which formal fallacy is committed in the above argument? (UGC NET 2 Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Undistributed middle
  • Affirming the consequent
  • Denying the antecedent
  • Existential fallacy
Correct Answer: Undistributed middle
3. "If you read Professor Harry's book, you should be able to recognize and successfully attack fallacious reasoning, and you are able to do that. Therefore, you must have read Professor Harry's book". Which formal fallacy is committed in the above argument? (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Denying the antecedent
  • Affirming the consequent
  • Existentialist fallacy
  • Undistributed middle
Correct Answer: Affirming the consequent
4. If capital punishment actually deterred people from committing serious crimes, then it would be justified. But as it does not have that deterrent effect, it is not a justifiable practice". Which formal fallacy is committed in the above argument? (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Affirming the consequent
  • Undistributed middle
  • Existential fallacy
  • Denying the antecedent
Correct Answer: Denying the antecedent
5. "Supporters of the ABC Political Party are against gun control and Republicans are also against gun control, so some Republicans must be supporters of ABC Political Party." Identify the fallacy in the above argument. (UGC NET 15 Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Affirming the consequent
  • Denying the antecedent
  • Ad hominem
  • Undistributed Middle
Correct Answer: Undistributed Middle
1. We listen attentively to and favorably interpret messages which boost our self-image, and reject or misinterpret messages which threaten that image. This is called: (UGC NET 25th June 2020 Evening paper)
  • change resistance
  • image rationalization
  • communication selectivity
  • communication distortion
Correct Answer: communication selectivity
2. Find out the correct sequence of selectivity stages in mass communication? (UGC NET 11th Nov 2020 Morning paper) (i) Exposure (ii) Retention (iii) Attitudinal change (iv) Perception (v) Attention
  • (iii), (v), (iv), (i), (ii)
  • (i), (v), (iv), (ii), (iii)
  • (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), (i)
  • (i), (ii), (iii), (v), (iv)
Correct Answer: (i), (v), (iv), (ii), (iii)
1. "First it is staying out late, then it is not calling home, then wild parties, and before you know it, your life will be completely out of control. Someday you will be glad that you had a lockdown." Which informal fallacy is committed in the above argument? (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023- Morning shift)
  • Red herring
  • Slippery slope
  • Strawman
  • Appeal to authority
Correct Answer: Slippery slope
2. Identify the informal fallacy in the following argument – (UGC NET 14 Mar 2023- Morning shift) "No one has ever given an indubitable proof regarding impossibility of life on Planet X therefore one can conclude that there is life on Planet X".
  • Appeal to Ignorance
  • Red Herring
  • Straw man
  • Appeal to Inappropriate authority
Correct Answer: Appeal to Ignorance
3. “You really must try out to be selected in the basketball team because my uncle who teaches philosophy says that you have a real potential". Identify the logical fallacy committed in the above argument. (UGC NET 12 Mar 2023 Evening shift)
  • Hasty Generalisation
  • Appeal to Inappropriate authority
  • Ad hominem
  • Begging the question
Correct Answer: Appeal to Inappropriate authority
4. "I just cannot believe it! Mr. Suresh cannot be guilty of murder since there is no way Mr. Suresh could kill someone". Which fallacy is committed in the above argument (UGC NET 12 Mar 2023- Evening shift)
  • Slippery slope
  • Begging the Question
  • Ad hominem
  • Equivocation
Correct Answer: Begging the Question
5. Which fallacy is committed in the following argument? (UGC NET 1 Mar 2023 Morning Shift) "When I called you, you were neither in your class nor in the laboratory. Why are you avoiding me?"
  • Circular argument
  • Red herring
  • Complex question
  • Slippery slope
Correct Answer: Red herring
6. "Critics of Freudian theory should get themselves psychoanalyzed because opposition to the theory is itself caused by unconscious resistance arising from the Dedipal complex. Which according to Freud distorts ones thinking.” Which logical fallacy is committed in the above argument? (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Appeal to authority
  • Slippery slope
  • Begging the Question
  • Hasty generalization
Correct Answer: Begging the Question
7. Which informal fallacy is committed in the following statement - "Of course you want to buy XYZ toothpaste. There must be a reason, why, 90 per cent of India brushes with XYZ toothpaste"? (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Slippery slope
  • Hasty generalization
  • Argumentum ad populum
  • Strawman Fallacy
Correct Answer: Slippery slope
1. In the light of the given statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET 09 Oct 2022- Morning shift) Statement I: To draw an analogy between two or more entities is to indicate one or more respects in which they are similar. Statement II: Every analogical inference proceeds from the similarity of two or more things in one or more respects to the similarity of those things in some further respect.
  • Both statement I and II are correct
  • Both statement I and II are incorrect
  • Statement I is correct and II is incorrect
  • Statement I is incorrect and II is correct
Correct Answer: Both statement I and II are correct
2. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET 09 Oct 2022- Evening shift) Statement I: Analogical argument involves drawing a likeness between two or more entities in one or more respects. Statement II: Analogical argument is a type of deductive argument.
  • Both Statement I and II are correct
  • Both Statement I and II are incorrect
  • Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect
  • Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect
3. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET 11 Aug 2022- Morning shift) Statement I: The statement- ‘A person without a purpose is like a care with no engine. And that’s a useless piece of machinery’ is an example of analogical argument. Statement II: The statement- “A person with no purpose is like a car with no engine. And that’s a useless piece of machinery” is an example of non-argumentative use of analogy.
  • Both Statement I and II are true
  • Both Statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is true but statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but statement II is true
4. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET 23 Oct 2022 – Evening Shift) Statement I: "To slow a beast, you break its limbs. To slow a nation, you break its people."­ is an example of analogical argument. Statement II: "To slow a beast, you break its limbs. To slow a nation, you break its people"­ is an example of nonargumentative use of analogy.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
5. a, b, c, d all have the attributes P and Q. (UGC NET 20 Oct 2022 – Evening Shift) a, b, c all have the attribute R. Therefore, d probably has the attribute R. Which of the following is true regarding the above argument? A. It is a deductive argument. B. It is an inductive argument. C. It is an analogical argument. D. It is a valid argument. E. It is an invalid argument.
  • B and C only
  • A and D only
  • B and D only
  • B and E only
Correct Answer: B and C only
1. The Environment (protection) Act, 1986 was the result of India’s commitment, to take appropriate action for the protection and improvement of environment, at the: (UGC NET 5th Jan 2022- Evening shift)
  • 1985 Vienna convention for protection of ozone layer
  • United Nation’s Conference on the human environment, Stockholm, 1972
  • Convention on long range trans boundary air pollution, 1983
  • Convention on international trade in endangered species, 1975 (CITES)
Correct Answer: United Nation’s Conference on the human environment, Stockholm, 1972
2. Which of the following provisions are directly covered in the Environment Protection Act, 1986?
  • Protection and conservation of forest and matters connected therewith
  • Protection and safety of wild animals, birds, and plants and for matters connected therewith
  • Prevention and control of water pollution
  • Protection and improvement of quality environment and preventing, controlling, and abating environmental pollution
Correct Answer: Protection and improvement of quality environment and preventing, controlling, and abating environmental pollution
3. The Environment (Protection) Act was adopted in the year ____.
  • 1986
  • 1988
  • 1985
  • 1982
Correct Answer: 1986
1. Article 48A of the Indian Constitution directs the states to ensure protection and improvement of: (UGC NET 26th Nov 2021 Evening shift)
  • Businesses
  • Education
  • Environment
  • Mineral resources
Correct Answer: Environment
2. Which one of the following Articles of the Indian Constitution talks about our duty to protect the environment? (UGC NET 29th Nov 2021 Evening Shift)
  • Article 51A(e)
  • Article 51A(g)
  • Article 51A(c)
  • Article 51A(a)
Correct Answer: Article 51A(g)
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Evening Shift) Statement I: Article 48A: It is the duty of citizens of India to protect and improve the natural environment. Statement II: Article 51: Directive Principles of state policy are to ensure protection and improvement of the natural Environment.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
1. Which of the following are included in the powers of central government to protect the environment, as per The Environment (Protection) Act, 1986? (a) Prevention, control and abatement of environmental pollution. (b) Laying down standards for the quality of environment in its various aspects. (c) Investigations and research relating to problems of environmental pollution. (d) Preparation of manuals, codes or guides for environmental pollution.
  • a and b only
  • a, b and d only
  • b and d only
  • All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 22nd Mar 2023 Morning Shift) Statement I: In many cases, both organisms and human infrastructure will not be able to move or adapt quickly enough to changing climate. Statement II: Infectious diseases are likely to increase as a result of global warming.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
2. Climate change can have serious consequences for: (UGC NET 13th Nov 2020 Evening paper) a. Water security b. Food security c. Erosion of coastal zones d. Soil fertility e. Respiratory health
  • Only a, b and c
  • a, b, c, d and e
  • Only a, b, c and e
  • Only a, b, d and e
Correct Answer: Only a, b and c
3. Assertion “A”: Climate change is going to increase social tension in India. Reason “R”: The frequency and intensity of the extreme weather events will have serious consequences for food security.
  • “A” is true, but “R” is false.
  • “A” is false, but “R” is true.
  • Both “A” and “R” are true and “R” is the correct explanation of “A”.
  • Both “A” and “R” are true and “R” is not the correct explanation of “A”.
Correct Answer: Both “A” and “R” are true and “R” is the correct explanation of “A”.
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 3rd Mar 2023 Evening Shift) Statement I: One of the ways to control greenhouse gas emissions is by encouraging energy efficiency throughout society in our country. Statement II: Improving energy efficiency has significant environmental benefits.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
1. Global warming is attributed to the presence of the following gases in the atmosphere: (UGC NET 11th July 2022 Morning shift) A. Methane B. Sulphur dioxide C. Surface ozone D. Nitrogen dioxide E. Carbon dioxide
  • A, C, E
  • A, B, C, E
  • A, C, D, E
  • A, B, D, E
Correct Answer: A, C, E
1. What are the barriers to effective communication? (UGC NET Jul 2016)
  • Moralizing, being judgmental and comments of consolation
  • Personal statements, eye contact and simple narration
  • Dialogue, summary and self-review
  • Use of simple words, cool reaction and defensive attitude
Correct Answer: Moralizing, being judgmental and comments of consolation
2. Which one of the following makes communication ineffective? (UGC NET 27th December 2021 Evening paper)
  • Clarity
  • Sincerity
  • Ambiguity
  • Brevity
Correct Answer: Ambiguity
3. One of the barriers to reception in communication is: (UGC NET 20th Oct 2022 Evening shift)
  • Message brevity
  • Environmental stimulus
  • Open mindedness
  • Language orderliness
Correct Answer: Environmental stimulus
4. Which of the following are barriers to understand the communicated messages? (UGC NET 29th Oct 2022 Morning shift) 1. Emotional quotient 2. Jargon 3. Personal space 4. Pre-judgement 5. Cultural background
  • 1, 2, and 3 only
  • 3, 4, and 5 only
  • 2, 3, and 4 only
  • 2, 4, and 5 only
Correct Answer: 2, 4, and 5 only
1. Which of the following gases has maximum Global Warming Potential (GWP)? (UGC NET 11th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Methane (CH4 )
  • Carbon dioxide (CO2 )
  • Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs)
  • Sulphur hexafluoride (SF6 )
Correct Answer: Sulphur hexafluoride (SF6 )
2. Which among the following are Green House Gases (GHG)? (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Evening Shift) A. Surface ozone (O3 ) B. Ammonia (NH3 ) C. Methane (CH4 ) D. Carbon monoxide (CO) E. Nitrous oxide (N2O )
  • A, B and C only
  • C, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, C and E only
Correct Answer: A, C and E only
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 5th Mar 2023 Evening Shift) Assertion A: Since pre-industrial times carbon dioxide has contributed maximum to the global warming. Reason R: Carbon dioxide has highest Global Warming Potential (GWP).
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct.
4. Which of the following are greenhouse gases? (UGC NET 1st Oct 2022- Evening shift) A. Carbon dioxide B. Nitrogen dioxide C. Methane D. Chlorofluorocarbons E. Benzene
  • A, C and D
  • C, D and E
  • A, B, C and D
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A, C and D
1. Ozone layer is in (UGC NET 14th Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Mesosphere
  • Troposphere
  • Thermosphere
  • Stratosphere
Correct Answer: Stratosphere
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Morning Shift) Statement-I: Hydro chlorofluorocarbons (HCFCs) were introduced as ozone-safe replacement for chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) Statement-II: Hydro chlorofluorocarbons (HCFCs) do not contribute to greenhouse warming.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
2. Which of the following is measured in Dobson Units? (UGC NET 4th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Stratospheric Ozone
  • Ultraviolet Rays
  • Chloro Fluoro Carbon (CFC)
  • Solar Radiation
Correct Answer: Stratospheric Ozone
3. Which of the following are responsible for formation and destruction of ozone (O3) in upper atmosphere? (UGC NET 11th Mar 2023 Evening Shift) A. Solar radiation B. Oxides of nitrogen (NOx)  C. Black Carbon D. Chlorine (Cl)  E. Ammonia (NH3)
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, B and D only
  • C and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only
4. Halons, kinds of Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS), were essentially and widely used in (UGC NET 15th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Air conditioners
  • Refrigerators
  • Fire Extinguishers
  • Aerosol spray propellants
Correct Answer: Fire Extinguishers
1. Which of the following are responsible for global cooling? (UGC NET 1st Oct 2022- Morning shift) A. Halocarbons B. Stratospheric ozone C. Tropospheric ozone D. Sulphate aerosols E. Black carbon
  • B, D and E
  • B and D
  • A, B and D
  • C and D
Correct Answer: B and D
1. How many national missions are there in the National Action Plan on climate change? (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • 9
  • 6
  • 7
  • 8
Correct Answer: 8

  • C, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 3rd Mar 2023 Evening Shift) Statement I: One of the ways to control greenhouse gas emissions is by encouraging energy efficiency throughout society in our country. Statement II: Improving energy efficiency has significant environmental benefits.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
1. Out of different oxides of nitrogen which of the following are considered as Air Pollutants and known as NOx (UGC NET 22nd Mar 2023 Evening Shift) A. NO (Nitric Oxide)  B. NO2 (Nitrogen dioxide)  C. NO2 (Nitrogen trioxide)  D. N2O (Nitrous oxide)
  • A, B and D Only
  • C and D Only
  • A and B Only
  • B and C Only
Correct Answer: A and B Only
2. Lead pollution, impacts which of the following part of human body most? (UGC NET 4th Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Eye
  • Skin
  • Heart
  • Brain
Correct Answer: Brain
3. Identify the major sources of methane emissions: (UGC NET 12th July 2022 Morning shift) A. Landfills B. Mountain rivers C. Paddy fields D. Wetlands
  • A, C and D
  • B, C and D
  • A, B and D
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A, C and D
4. The air pollutant NOx is a combination of: (UGC NET 26th Nov 2021 Evening shift)
  • Nitrous oxide and Nitrogen dioxide
  • Nitrogen dioxide and Nitric oxide
  • Nitrous oxide and Nitric oxide
  • Nitrogen pentoxide and Nitrogen dioxide
Correct Answer: Nitrogen dioxide and Nitric oxide
5. Given below are two Statements, one is labelled as Assertion A and other is labelled as Reason R. (UGC NET 11th Nov 2020 Evening paper) Assertion A: Carbon monoxide (CO) is a serious asphyxiate; even a short exposure may have fatal health issues. Reason R: Hemoglobin present in the blood has greater affinity towards carbon.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
  • A is correct but R is not correct
  • A is not correct but R is correct
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
1. Dioxins are emitted during combustion of: (UGC NET 14th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Nuclear
  • Natural gas
  • Biomass
  • Coal
Correct Answer: Biomass
2. Full form of PAN, a type of air pollutant, is (UGC NET 5th Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Peroxyacetyl nitrites
  • Peroxyacetyl nitrates
  • Polycyclic acyl nitrates
  • Polycyclic acyl nitrites
Correct Answer: Peroxyacetyl nitrates
3. Dioxins are produced as a byproduct of (UGC NET 23rd Oct 2022 Evening shift) A. Forest fires B. Incineration of plastics C. Chemical processing D. Volcanic eruptions E. Diesel fuel combustion
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, C and D only
  • B, C and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only
4. Which of the following are examples of secondary air pollutants? (UGC NET 10th Oct 2022 Morning Shift) A. Sulphate B. Nitric Oxide (NO) C. Photochemical smog D. Peroxy Acetyl Nitrate (PAN) E. Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAH)
  • A, C, D
  • A, B, C, D
  • C, D, E
  • B, C, D
Correct Answer: A, C, D
1. Which of the following Particulate Matter (PM) type is also commonly known as Respirable Suspended Particulate Matter (RSPM)? (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • PM2.5
  • PM5
  • PM1
  • PM10
Correct Answer: PM10
2. Which one of the following is a secondary aerosol? (UGC NET 12th Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Black carbon
  • Sea salt
  • Mineral particles
  • Sulphate particles
Correct Answer: Sulphate particles

  • A, B and C only
  • C, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and E only

1. Which of the following play a role during formation of photochemical smog? (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. NO2 (Nitrogen dioxide)  B. Black Carbon C. Sunlight D. VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds)  E. CO (Carbon monoxide)
  • A, B and C only
  • A, D and E only
  • A, C and D only
  • B, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
2. Which one of the following is not a constituent of photochemical smog? (UGC NET 16th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Formaldehyde (HCHO)
  • Peroxyacetyl Nitrate (PAN)
  • Ozone (O3)
  • Dioxins
Correct Answer: Dioxins
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 13th Oct 2022 Morning shift) Statement I: Classical smog is formed when oxides of nitrogen combine with particulate matter especially in summer season Statement II: Classical smog reduces atmospheric visibility to a great extent
  • Statement I is false but II is true
  • Both statement I and II are true
  • Both statement II and II are false
  • Statement I is true but II is false
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but II is true
1. Which one of the following pollutants is responsible for acid rain formation? (UGC NET 23rd Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • CH4 (Methane)
  • CO (Carbon monoxide)
  • C6 H6 (Benzene)
  • SO2 (Sulphur dioxide)
Correct Answer: SO2 (Sulphur dioxide)
2. Which of the following air pollutants make rain water acidic? (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Evening Shift) A. Nitric oxide (NO)  B. Nitrogen dioxide (NO2)  C. Nitrous oxide (N2O)  D. Carbon monoxide (CO)  E. Sulphur dioxide (SO2)
  • A, B and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, C and E only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: A, B and E only
3. Rain is termed as acid rain when its pH value is: (UGC NET 29th Nov 2021- Morning shift)
  • 5.6-7.0
  • Less than 5.6
  • More than 7
  • 1-3
Correct Answer: Less than 5.6

  • Carbon monoxide
  • Ozone

  • Nitrogen dioxide

1. Which of the following pollutants is included in the Air Quality Index in India? (UGC NET 25th June 2020 Morning paper)
  • Carbon Dioxide
  • Sulphur dioxide
  • Chlorofluoro carbons
  • Methane
Correct Answer: Sulphur dioxide
2. According to Indian National Ambient Air Quality standards an Air Quality Index (AQI) value of 250 indicates the quality of air as: (UGC NET 23rd Oct 2022 Morning shift)
  • Poor
  • Very poor
  • Satisfactory
  • Moderate
Correct Answer: Poor
