  • Chlorofluorocarbons
  • Fine particulate matter
  • Ozone
  • Carbon monoxide
Correct Answer: Chlorofluorocarbons
1. Thermal Pollution (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • is increase of temperature in urban environment in comparison to surrounding suburban environment.
  • is a pollution of air.
  • is a pollution of water body
  • is a pollution of hot springs
Correct Answer: is a pollution of water body
2. Which pollutant is the major source of marine pollution? (UGC NET 24th June 2019 Evening Paper)
  • Sewage
  • None of the above
  • Industrial waste water
  • Oil spill
Correct Answer: Sewage
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Morning Shift) Statement I: It is relatively easier to monitor and regulate water pollution caused by nonpoint sources than point sources. Statement II: Nonpoint sources of water pollution may be fairly uniform and predictable throughout the year.
  • Both statement I and Statement II are true
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false
2. Non-point sources of water pollution are: (UGC NET 5th Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. from specific location B. diffuse C. episodic D. identifiable E. difficult to monitor
  • B, C and D only
  • B, C and E only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only
3. Point sources of water pollution are: (UGC NET 5th Dec 2021- Morning shift) A. Underground coal mines B. Run-off from farm fields C. Sewage treatment plants D. Run-off from roads and construction sites E. Power plants
  • C, E only
  • A, C, E only
  • B, C, E only
  • A, C, D, E only
Correct Answer: A, C, E only
1. BOD (Biochemical Oxygen Demand) is the measure of: (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • water contamination
  • air pollution
  • soil contamination
  • dissolved oxygen of river water
Correct Answer: water contamination
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 23rd Mar 2023 Evening Shift) Statement I: Amount of oxygen dissolved in water is a good indicator of water quality and of the kinds of life it will support. Statement II: Chemical Oxygen Demand (COD) is a measure of dissolved oxygen consumed by aquatic microorganisms.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
3. With increase in temperature, the dissolved oxygen content in a water body will: (UGC NET 20th June 2019 Morning Paper)
  • may increase or decrease depending on the temperature range
  • decreases
  • increases
  • remain constant
Correct Answer: decreases
4. The concentration of Total Dissolved Solids (TDS) in drinking water should not exceed
  • 200 mg/L
  • 400 mg/L
  • 500 mg/L
  • 300 mg/L
Correct Answer: 500 mg/L
1. Eutrophication in a water body leads to which of the following? (UGC NET 1st Dec 2021- Evening shift) A. Bloom of algae B. Increase in the level of dissolved oxygen (DO) C. Increase in turbidity and odor of the water body D. Difficulty in sustaining normal aquatic life E. Deficiency of nutrients
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
2. Chemical oxygen demand in eutrophic water is: (UGC NET 24th June 2019 Evening Paper)
  • Low
  • High
  • Extremely low
  • Medium
Correct Answer: High
1. Algal blooms in oligotrophic lakes are (UGC NET 24th June 2019 Morning Paper)
  • very rare
  • widespread
  • frequent
  • very frequent
Correct Answer: very rare
2. Which of the following are water borne bacterial diseases? (UGC NET 12th Mar 2023 Evening Shift) A. Cholera B. Hepatitis C. Typhoid D. Schistosomiasis E. Dysentery
  • A, B and C Only
  • A, D and E Only
  • B, C and D Only
  • A, C and E Only
Correct Answer: A, C and E Only
3. Which of the following is not a water-borne disease?
  • Cholera
  • Dengue
  • Typhoid
  • Hepatitis
Correct Answer: Dengue
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Morning Shift) Assertion-A: Rise in water temperature from normal levels, due to thermal pollution, can adversely affect water quality and aquatic life. Reason-R: Oxygen solubility in water increases as temperature increases.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct.
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Evening Shift) Statement I: Thermal pollution, usually effluent from cooling systems of power plants or other industries, alters water temperature in a lake or stream. Statement II: Humans also cause thermal pollution by altering vegetation cover and run-off patterns.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
1. Arsenic pollution in ground water is due to (UGC NET 14th Oct 2022 Morning shift)
  • Nitrates of arsenic
  • Sulphates of arsenic
  • Oxides of arsenic
  • Acids of arsenic
Correct Answer: Acids of arsenic
2. The permissible limit for Arsenic in drinking water, as per Indian Standards [IS:10500] is: (UGC NET 25th Nov 2021- Morning Shift)
  • 0.05mg
  • 2.0 mg
  • 1.0 mg
  • 0.5 mg
Correct Answer: 0.05mg
1. What is the correct sequence of Biomagnification due to contaminated water body? (UGC NET 2nd Mar 2023 Evening Shift) A. Humans B. Zooplanktons C. Bacteria D. Fish
  • C, B, D, A
  • A, D, B, C
  • A, C, D, B
  • B, C, D, A
Correct Answer: C, B, D, A
2. ‘Minamata disaster’ in Japan was caused by pollution due to
  • Lead
  • Zinc
  • Mercury
  • Cadmium
Correct Answer: Mercury
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: Communicative language is the means of transmission of our values and social norms. Statement II: Language defines and communicates the world around us.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
2. Human communication involves (UGC NET 8th Oct 2022- Morning shift) A. Message transmission B. Message reception C. Verbal and non-verbal messages D. Power packed message only E. Messages or non-consumption
  • B, C and D
  • B, D and E
  • A, C and E
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A, B and C
3. Language for communication is a product of: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Everyday life
  • Laboratory simulation
  • Elitist preference
  • Religious affiliations
Correct Answer: Everyday life
1. Identify the health effects related to Noise Pollution (UGC NET 11th Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. Speech interference B. Hearing loss C. Hypertension D. Respiratory disease E. Insomnia
  • A, B and E only
  • A, B, C and E only
  • A, B, C, D and E
  • A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and E only
2. The impact of noise pollution on human health is governed by: (UGC NET 12th Nov 2020 Evening paper) (i) Intensity of noise (ii) Duration of noise (iii) Socio-economic status of an individual (iv) Sensitivity of human ear (v) Frequency range of noise
  • (i), (ii), (iii), (iv) and (v)
  • (i), (ii), (iv) and (v) only
  • (i), (iii), (iv) and (v) only
  • (i), (ii) and (iii) only
Correct Answer: (i), (ii), (iv) and (v) only
1. If the intensity of a given noise increases two-fold, the noise level in decibels (dB) increases by (UGC NET 17th Oct 2020 Morning paper)
  • ~6 dB
  • ~2 dB
  • ~3 dB
  • ~10 dB
Correct Answer: ~3 dB
2. Noise pollution measured in decibels (dB) with reference to a standard sound intensity of the following magnitude (UGC NET 29th Sept 2020 Morning paper)
  • 1 microwatt per m2
  • 1 nanowatt per m2
  • 1 pico watt per m2
  • 1 milliwatt per m2
Correct Answer: 1 pico watt per m2
1. Noise levels at a traffic site are recorded for one hour at a sampling interval of 1 second and percentile indices of noise L1, L10, L60, L90  are computed from the data. The indices are then arranged in increasing order in terms of their values starting from minimum to maximum. Which of the following options represents their correct order?  (UGC NET 5th Dec 2019 Evening Paper)
  • L90, L60, L10, L1
  • L1, L10, L60, L90
  • L10, L60, L90, L1
  • L60, L90, L10, L1
Correct Answer: L90, L60, L10, L1
2. Identify the correct sequence of the following noise pollution indices in decreasing order of their magnitude in an urban area (UGC NET 27th Nov 2021- Morning shift) A. L10 B. L90 C. Leq
  • B, C, A
  • A, C, B
  • B, A, C
  • A, B, C
Correct Answer: A, C, B
1. According to Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules, 2000, the night time Noise standard prescribed for Educational Institutions is: (UGC NET 30th Sept 2020 Morning paper)
  • 55 dB A
  • 50 dB A
  • 45 dB A
  • 40 dB A
Correct Answer: 40 dB A
2. According to Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules, 2000, the night time noise standard for commercial areas in India is? (UGC NET 24th Dec 2021- Morning shift)
  • 45 dB
  • 65 dB
  • 50 dB
  • 55 dB
Correct Answer: 55 dB
1. Identify the sources of soil pollution from the following list: (UGC NET 12th Nov 2020 Morning paper) i) Industrial effluents ii) Eutrophication iii) Unscientific disposal of nuclear waste iv) Off-shore oil drilling v) Improper management of septic systems
  • ii, iv and v
  • i, ii and iii
  • i, iii and v
  • ii, iii and iv
Correct Answer: i, iii and v
2. Which of the following is not a source of pollution in soil?
  • Thermal power plants
  • Transport sector
  • Agriculture sector
  • Hydropower plants
Correct Answer: Hydropower plants

  • B, C, E
  • A, B, C, D
  • A, B, C, E
  • A, B, C
Correct Answer: A, B, C

Statement II: Accelerated erosion of the soil is caused due to manmade activities. The rate of accelerated erosion is equal to the rate of soil formation.
  • Both Statement I and II are true
  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Statement I is false but II is true
  • Both Statement I and II are false
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but II is false

  • ii, iii and iv
  • i, iii and iv
  • iii, iv and v

  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

1. Identify the correct sequence for successful communication. (UGC NET 4th Jan 2022- Morning Shift)
  • Sender → Encode message → Audience → Channel → Decode message → Feedback
  • Sender → Encode message → Decode message → Channel → Audience → Feedback
  • Sender → Encode message → Channel → Decode message → Feedback → Audience
  • Sender → Encode message → Channel → Decode message → Audience → Feedback
Correct Answer: Sender → Encode message → Audience → Channel → Decode message → Feedback
2. Feed-back of a message comes from: (UGC NET Jun 2007)
  • Media
  • Audience
  • Communicator
  • Sattelite
Correct Answer: Audience
3. Identify the correct sequence of the following: (UGC NET Jun 2010)
  • Source, message, receiver, channel
  • Source, receiver, channel, message
  • Source, message, channel, receiver
  • Source, channel, message, receiver
Correct Answer: Source, message, channel, receiver

1. Which of the following sequences of disposal options for low hazardous solid waste from industrial and urban sources is in order of increasing desirability? (UGC NET 6th Dec 2019 Evening Paper)
  • Composting< Landfill < Reuse < Incineration
  • Incineration < Composting < Reuse < Landfill
  • Indiscriminate dumping < Landfill < Incineration < Reuse
  • Landfill< Composting < Reuse < Incineration
Correct Answer: Indiscriminate dumping < Landfill < Incineration < Reuse
1. Aeration technique of water treatment is used for the removal of (UGC NET 2nd Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs)
  • Persistant Organic Pollutants (POPs)
  • Metals
  • Hardness
Correct Answer: Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs)

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.

  • Remove microbes
  • Decrease turbidity
  • Remove hardness
  • Increase salt contents
Correct Answer: Remove microbes

  • Sedimentation
  • Aeration
  • Neutralization
  • Adsorption
Correct Answer: Neutralization

  • Calcium
  • Total nitrogen
  • Total phosphorus
  • Total sulphur
Correct Answer: Calcium

  • Goal‐7

  • Environmental sustainability
  • Human rights

  • Child Mortality

  • A, C, D and E only
  • A, B and D only
  • A, B, C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B and D only

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.

  • Gender equity
  • Protection of Ozone layer
  • Climate action
  • Life below water
Correct Answer: Protection of Ozone layer

  • B, D, C, E, A
  • E, D, B, C, A
  • B, C, D, E, A
Correct Answer: E, D, B, C, A

1. Full form of IPCC, a nodal agency in the context of climate change, is: (UGC NET 23rd Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change
  • Intergovernmental Policy on Climate change
  • International Panel on Climate Change
  • International Policy on Climate Change
Correct Answer: Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change
1. Select the advantage of feedback in the process of communication, from the following: (UGC NET 4th Dec 2019 Evening Paper)
  • It explores the defects in receiver
  • It clarifies the communication
  • It is beneficial in understanding of the subject matter
  • It diagnoses the defects in receiver
Correct Answer: It clarifies the communication
2. When a communicated message is based on reference to another, it is called (UGC NET 10th Oct 2022 Morning Shift)
  • Meta message
  • Sourced message
  • Referential message
  • Ancillary message
Correct Answer: Meta message
3. In communication, meanings refer to a person’s (UGC NET 13th Oct 2022 Morning shift)
  • Subsuming messages for suppression
  • Notions about the world
  • Internal responses to a message
  • External responses only
Correct Answer: Notions about the world

  • Both statement I and II are true
  • Statement I is true but II is false
Correct Answer: Both statement I and II are false

  • Participation of the audience
  • Strategic use of grapevine
  • Persuasive and convincing dialogue
  • One-way transfer of information
Correct Answer: One-way transfer of information

  • Montreal Protocol, 1987
  • Kyoto Protocol, 1997

Correct Answer: Earth Summit at Rio de Janeiro, 1992

  • B, C, D and E only
  • A, C and E only
  • A, B and E only
  • A, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, C and E only

  • Stockholm
  • Copenhagen
  • Kyoto
  • Rio de Janeiro
Correct Answer: Rio de Janeiro

  • Kyoto protocol and Montreal protocol
  • CDM and Nagoya protocol
  • Convention on Biological Diversity and climate change
  • Basel convention and Bamako convention
Correct Answer: Convention on Biological Diversity and climate change
1. The Kyoto Protocol was adapted at which convention?
  • Third conference of the UNFCC in 1997
  • Convention on Biological Diversity
  • Convention on the Trans boundary Effects of Industrial Accidents
  • United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), 1992
Correct Answer: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), 1992

  • COP 25
  • COP 21
  • COP 26
  • COP 27
Correct Answer: COP 27

  • B, C and E only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, B, C and D only
  • B, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only

  • 5.8%
  • 18%
  • 7.6%
  • 15%
Correct Answer: 18%

  • 6
  • 4
  • 7
  • 5
Correct Answer: 6
1. Which of the following are features of Paris Agreement? (UGC NET 25th June 2020 Evening paper) (i) The agreement focuses on mitigation measures for environmental pollution. (ii) The agreement recognizes the principles of equity and common but differentiated responsibilities.  (iii) Paris agreement pertains to 2020 climate actions.
  • (i) and (iii) only
  • (i) and (ii) only
  • (i), (ii) and (iii)
  • (ii) and (iii) only
Correct Answer: (ii) and (iii) only
2. Formulation of long-term emission development strategies by each country was suggested under (UGC NET 17th Oct 2020 Morning paper)
  • Kyoto Protocol
  • Paris Agreement
  • International Solar Alliance
  • Montreal Protocol
Correct Answer: Paris Agreement
3. Which of the following was the central aim of the Paris Agreement? (UGC NET 12th Nov 2020 Morning paper)
  • To reduce the CFCs emissions
  • To address the problem of ozone layer depletion
  • To address biological diversity issues
  • To strengthen the global response to the threat of climate change
Correct Answer: To strengthen the global response to the threat of climate change
4. Paris agreement entered into force when the instruments of ratification were deposited by at least 55 countries which accounted for, at least (UGC NET 26th Nov 2021- Morning shift)
  • 50% of global CO emissions
  • 60% of global CO emissions
  • 55% of global CO emissions
  • 75% of global CO emissions
Correct Answer: 55% of global CO emissions

  • Montreal Protocol
  • Kyoto Protocol
  • Paris Agreement
  • Rio Summit
Correct Answer: Paris Agreement

  • Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

  • Montreal, Canada
  • New York, United States
Correct Answer: Montreal, Canada

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.

  • Paris Agreement
  • Kyoto Protocol
  • Montreal Protocol
  • Basel Convention
Correct Answer: Montreal Protocol
2. Montreal protocol aims at: (UGC NET 26th June 2019 Morning Paper)
  • Prohibiting transboundary movement of hazardous waste.
  • Enhancing cooperation among UN member states for peaceful uses of nuclear energy.
  • Phasing out ozone depleting substances.
  • Reduction in emissions of greenhouse gases.
Correct Answer: Phasing out ozone depleting substances.

  • Global warming
  • Ozone layer depletion
  • Food security
  • Human rights
Correct Answer: Ozone layer depletion

  • 90‐95%

  • 50‐55%
  • 65‐70%
Correct Answer: 80‐85%

  • It diagnoses the defects in receiver

  • It is beneficial in understanding of the subject matter

  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

  • Statement I is false but Statement II is True.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are True.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are False.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is False.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are False.
1. Arrange the following fossil fuels in increasing order of their carbon intensities (gC/MJ): (UGC NET 09 July 2022- Evening shift) A. Natural gas B. Coal C. Petroleum
  • A
  • A
  • C
  • B
Correct Answer: A
2. The second highest concentration in biogas is that of (UGC NET 24th Dec 2021- Morning shift)
  • Methane
  • Carbon dioxide
  • Sulphur dioxide
  • Hydrogen sulphide
Correct Answer: Carbon dioxide
1. According to the classification of Ministry of New and Renewable Energy and Central Electricity Authority of India, small hydro power plants have capacity in the range: (UGC NET 30th Sept 2020 Evening paper)
  • 100-1000 kW
  • 1-100 kW
  • 1-25 MW
  • 1-50 MW
Correct Answer: 1-25 MW
1. Wind energy is very sensitive to the wind velocity because wind power is directly proportional to the: (UGC NET 11th Nov 2020 Evening paper)
  • cube of the wind velocity
  • square root of the wind velocity
  • wind velocity
  • square of the wind velocity
Correct Answer: cube of the wind velocity
2. Which of the following types of energy sources employ direct energy conversion process to produce electricity? (UGC NET 21 June 2019 Evening Paper)
  • Biomass
  • Nuclear
  • Wind
  • Geothermal
Correct Answer: Wind
1. Which of the following sources of energy has the maximum potential in India?
  • Ocean thermal energy
  • Wind energy
  • Solar energy
  • Tidal energy
Correct Answer: Solar energy
2. In which of the following types of electricity power plants, turbines are not required? (UGC NET 24 Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Solar
  • Geothermal
  • Nuclear
  • Hydro
Correct Answer: Solar
1. The main environmental concern associated with geothermal energy is the release of (UGC NET 24th Dec 2021- Evening shift)
  • Carbon dioxide
  • Hydrogen sulphide
  • Methane
  • Carbon monoxide
Correct Answer: Hydrogen sulphide
2. Sources of heat of geothermal energy are: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Morning Shift) A. Radioactive decay of unstable elements B. Nuclear fusion C. Magma D. Temperature gradient inside earth E. Oceanic circulation
  • B, C and D only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
1. Which sector contributes maximum to the India's total electricity production? (UGC NET 6th Mar 2023 Evening Shift)
  • Hydro
  • Nuclear
  • Thermal
  • Renewable
Correct Answer: Thermal
2. Arrange the following renewable energy sources in increasing order of their potential in India. (UGC NET 22nd Oct 2022 Morning shift) A. Solar energy B. Biomass energy C. Wind energy D. Geothermal energy
  • B, D, C, A
  • D, B, A, C
  • B, D, A, C
  • D, B, C, A
Correct Answer: D, B, C, A
3. The share of renewable energy in the energy mix of our country sought to be achieved by 2030 is now (UGC NET 23rd Oct 2022 Evening shift)
  • 40%
  • 35%
  • 45%
  • 50%
Correct Answer: 50%
1. Concept behind Fuel Cell Vehicles (FCVs) is (UGC NET 11 July 2022 Morning shift)
  • Using improvised CNG to run cars
  • Using rechargeable batteries to run cars
  • Using solar energy to run cars
  • Using hydrogen and oxygen to run cars
Correct Answer: Using hydrogen and oxygen to run cars
2. Which of the following statements are true about a fuel cell? (UGC NET 04 Dec 2019 Evening Paper) (a) It is a device that uses electrochemical reactions to produce electric current (b) It consists of a positive electrode and a negative electrode separated by an electrolyte (c) Just like batteries it needs to be recharged with an electric current
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (a) and (c) only
  • (a) and (b) only
  • (b) and (c) only
Correct Answer: (a) and (b) only
1. Given below ate two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R (UGC NET 13th Oct 2022 Morning shift) Assertion A: Energy produced from biomass is considered ‘carbon neutral’ Reason R: Biomass does not add CO2  to the atmosphere
  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
  • A is correct but R is not correct
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct
1. What is the correct sequence of various components of biogas in terms of their abundance? (UGC NET 14th Oct 2022 Morning shift) A. Ammonia (NH3) B. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2 S) C. Methane (CH4) D. Carbon dioxide (CO2)
  • B > D > A > C
  • C > D > B > A
  • D > C > B > A
  • C > D > A > B
Correct Answer: C > D > B > A
2. The main constituents of biogas are
  • Methane and Carbon dioxide
  • Methane and Sulphur dioxide
  • Methane and Nitric oxide
  • Methane, Hydrogen and Nitric oxide
Correct Answer: Methane and Carbon dioxide

  • A, B, C only
  • D, E, A only
  • B, C, D only
  • C, D, E only
Correct Answer: C, D, E only

No correct answer provided

  • C, E, D, A, B
  • A, C, B, D, E
Correct Answer: B, D, C, E, A

  • A, B and C only

Correct Answer: B and D only

  • Controlled
  • Reducer
  • Inhibitor
  • Moderator
Correct Answer: Moderator
2. Which of the following isotopes of Uranium is used as fissile material in nuclear thermal power plants? (UGC NET 23rd Oct 2022 Morning shift)
  • U238
  • U239
  • U235
  • U234
Correct Answer: U235
3. Thermal reactors produce energy by fission of the following nuclear fuels (UGC NET 29th Sept 2020 Morning paper) A. Uranium-235 (239U) B. Uranium-233 (233U) C. Uranium-238 (238U) D. Thorium-232 (232Th) E. Plutonium-239 (238Pu)
  • A, B, C and E only
  • A, B and E only
  • A, B, C, D and E
  • A. B, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and E only
4. Arrange the following naturally occurring Uranium isotopes in the correct sequence as per the proportion of occurrence (UGC NET29th Nov 2021 Evening Shift) 1.U‐234 2. U‐235 3. U‐238
  • 3, 1, 2
  • 2, 3, 1
  • 1, 2, 3
  • 3, 2, 1
Correct Answer: 3, 2, 1
1.Which of the following is not a natural hazard?
  • Nuclear accident
  • Tsunami
  • Earthquake
  • Flash floods
Correct Answer: Nuclear accident
1. Meaning of Tsunami is? (UGC NET 6th Mar 2023 Morning Shift)
  • Oceanic wave
  • Harbour Wave
  • Coastal Wave
  • Oceanic earthquake
Correct Answer: Harbour Wave
2. Tsunami occurs due to:
  • Mild earthquakes and landslides in the oceans
  • Strong earthquakes and landslides in mountains
  • Strong earthquakes and landslides in deserts
  • Strong earthquakes and landslides in the oceans
Correct Answer: Strong earthquakes and landslides in the oceans
3. Which of the following natural hazards is not hydro-meteorological?
  • Sea erosion
  • Tsunami
  • Tropical cyclone
  • Snow avalanche
Correct Answer: Tsunami
4. S and P waves are associated with
  • floods
  • wind energy
  • earthquakes
  • tidal energy
Correct Answer: earthquakes
5. Seismograph is used to measure:
  • floods
  • wind energy
  • earthquakes
  • tidal energy
Correct Answer: earthquakes
1. Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R (UGC NET 4th Jan 2022- Evening shift) Assertion A: Lockdown in 2020 in India was imposed under the Disaster Management Act Reason R: COVID 19 is the first pan‐India biological disaster being handled under the Disaster Management Act
  • Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • A is false but R is true
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
  • A is true but R is false
Correct Answer: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
2. Who is the Executive Head of the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA)? (UGC NET 1st Dec 2021- Evening shift)
  • A member of Parliament appointed by the President
  • President of India
  • Prime Minister of India
  • Chief of the Army Staff
Correct Answer: Prime Minister of India

  • Rio summit
  • Kyoto protocol
  • Sendai framework
  • Montreal protocol
Correct Answer: Sendai framework

  • 2015-2035
  • 2015-2030
  • 2020-2040
  • 2020-2030
Correct Answer: 2015-2030

  • Understanding Risk
  • Inter-Agency Coordination
  • All of the above
  • Investing in DRR – Structural Measures
Correct Answer: All of the above

  • C, B, A, D
  • C, A, B, D
  • A, C, B, D
Correct Answer: C, B, A, D

  • 1.3 years
  • 8 years
  • 13 years
  • 18 years
Correct Answer: 13 years

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

  • Apprehension
  • Pictures in the mind
  • Semantic noise
  • Confused ideas
Correct Answer: Pictures in the mind
3. Understanding how others feel is important in A. Developing empathy B. Reducing prejudice C. Conflict resolution D. Encouraging Selfishness E. Enhancing cooperation Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A, B. C and D Only
  • A. B. C and E Only
  • B. C. D and E Only
  • A. B. D and E Only
Correct Answer: A. B. C and E Only
4. Given below are two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.  Assertion A: Older pre-schoolers have better chances of getting along well with their peers as compared to young pre-schoolers.  Reason R: Older pre-schoolers generally have a better understanding of the intentions of others.  In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
5. Given below are two statements: Statement I: A 2 years old child is likely to have a better understanding of his own intentions than those of others.  Statement II: It is always helpful to coach a child in perspective-taking if the child has the habit of mistreating others because of some behavioural disorder.  In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement Il is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
1. Which of the following countries was allowed to take control of Egypt?
  • Britain
  • France
  • Germany
  • Spain
Correct Answer: Britain
2. Given below are two statements. In light of these statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: Statement I: Competing claims over African colonies were generally settled through war among the European powers. Statement II: France was in conflict only with Britain over Morocco.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
3. Which of the following countries was allowed to have colony in Morocco?
  • Britain
  • France
  • Germany
  • Spain
Correct Answer: France

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.

  • Britain
  • France
  • Germany
  • Spain
Correct Answer: France

  • Pala ruler

  • Chola ruler

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.

  • Strangers

  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Both Statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is false but II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and II are true

  • A, D, E
  • A, B, C
  • A, C, D
  • B, C, E
Correct Answer: A, C, D

  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and C only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A, B and C

  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and C only
  • A, B and C

  • A, B and C only
  • A and C only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

  • A, B and C Only
  • B, C and D Only
  • A,C and D Only
  • A, B and D only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.

  • A, B and C Only
  • B, C and D Only
  • B,D and E Only
  • A, B C D and E

Reason: The global financial crisis immediately led to a major debt crisis in Europe. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
5. Failure on part of the debtors to pay loans would have risked A. Pension Funds B. Investors C.  Northern European Banks Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A and B Only
  • B and C Only
  • A and C only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A, B and C
1. Given below are two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R. Assertion A: Historical evidence suggests that the frequency of conflicts between liberal and non-liberal states is low. Reason R: In liberal states, the decision to go to war is taken by the people, rather than by the Monarch. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is not correct but R is correct.
2. Identify the inferences that you can draw after reading the passage. A. Frequency of conflicts among the liberal states is low. B. Frequency of conflicts between liberal and non-liberal states is low. C. Liberal states are generally rich. Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A and B Only
  • B and C Only
  • A and C Only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A and C Only
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: Communication can create a 'feel good' factor among receivers. Statement II: Communication can be used as an instrument to divide and alienate the receivers.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
2. In governance, communication is normally used as a means of: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Preserving power
  • Alienating the masses
  • Encouraging illegal actions
  • Gender division
Correct Answer: Preserving power
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 14th Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: When messages are delivered by popular sources, they have higher attention and recall of the receivers. Statement II: A highly credible source may not score much in the areas of expertise, trustworthiness and likability
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.

  • Non-critical value
  • Transient value
  • Uncommon value
  • Power value
Correct Answer: Power value

No correct answer provided

Reason R: Liberal States are generally wealthy. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.

Liberal states tend to maintain peace with all other liberal states. C. Liberal states tend to be wealthy. D. Decision to go to war is taken democratically in Liberal states.   • B, C and D Only
  • A, C and D Only

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

1. The change witnessed in India now is due to
  • Social grounding
  • Political interference
  • The market momentum
  • Youth migration
Correct Answer: The market momentum

  • Activism
  • Articulation
  • Politics of marketing
  • Politics of hope
Correct Answer: Politics of hope
3. The youth’s belief in the future is propelled by
  • Disrupted progress
  • Self-help
  • Restricted freedom
  • Unsynchronized imagination
Correct Answer: Self-help

  • Public welfare policies
  • Narratives of backwardness
  • Limited opportunities
  • Absence of public support
Correct Answer: Public welfare policies

  • Controlling the market power
  • Political reforms
  • Urbanisation
  • Economic reforms and liberalisation
Correct Answer: Economic reforms and liberalisation
1. According to Gokhale, what percentage of the total expenditure on education should be borne by the state?
  • ≈ 25%
  • ≈ 33%
  • ≈ 66%
  • ≈ 75%
Correct Answer: ≈ 66%
2. Given below are two statements: Statement I: Gokhale believed that education was necessary for the Indian masses to be liberated from their miserable condition.  Statement II: Gokhale faced little resistance in the introduction of his bill on elementary education. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
1. The linear model of communication can be described as (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Liberal
  • Authoritarian
  • Confessional
  • Participatory
Correct Answer: Authoritarian
2. Which of the following are the key features of linear model of communication? (UGC NET 10th Oct 2022 Evening Shift) A. One way communication B. Manipulated feedback C. Absence of noise D. Used for mass communication E. Sender centric communication
  • A, B, C
  • B, C, D
  • D, C, E
  • A, D, E
Correct Answer: A, D, E
3. The sequence of elements in linear model of communication is (UGC NET 29th Sept 2020 Evening paper) A. Message B. Decoder C. Encoder D. Medium E. Bloke
  • B, D, C, A, E
  • D, E, C, A, B
  • C, A, D, E, B
  • A, C, B, E, D
Correct Answer: C, A, D, E, B
3. Which if the following can be inferred from the passage? A. The growth of education in India was very slow prior to Gokhale. B. There was a need to make education compulsory for all according to Gokhale. C. Gokhale believed that achieving education for all Indians was a distant dream. D. Gokhale suggested that majority of expenditure for education should be met by local bodies. Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A, B and C Only
  • B, C and D Only
  • A, B and D Only
  • A, C and D Only
Correct Answer: A, B and C Only
4. Given below are two statements: Statement I: Gokhale believed that education should be made free for the poor people. Statement II: Gokhale suggested that an additional tax of 8-anna should be imposed on salt. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
5. Given below are two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and other is labelled as Reason R. Assertion A: Gokhale was not in favour of free education for the poor Reason R: He suggested that those students whose family income was Rs. 25 per month or more, should pay the education fees.  In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is not correct but R is correct.
1. According to the passage, international trade A. stimulates economies B. externalizes costs C. is controlled by wealthy countries Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A and B Only
  • B and C Only
  • A and C Only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: B and C Only
2. Given below are two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and other is labelled as Reason R. Assertion A: Tropical hardwood products can be sold at very cheap rates in the United States. Reason R: Factories in the Unites States are very efficient in making hardwood products. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct.
3. Given below are two statements: Statement I: Representatives of powerful countries claim that international trade agreements help the poor regions to sell their products. Statement II: The poor countries sell their natural resources for small gains. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
4. Poor countries are suppliers of A. Timber B. Mineral Ores C. Machines D. Fruit E. Cheap Labour Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A, B, C and D only
  • B, C, D and E only
  • A, C, D and E only
  • A, B, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B, D and E only
5. A consumer in the United States buys a cheap Brazilian hardwood product manufactured in Mexico. The environmental costs of the product would occur at A. Brazil B. Mexico C. The United States Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and C only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A and B only
1. Given below are two statements: Statement I: The Pashmina Shawls were quite popular in Europe. Statement II: The British made it easy for Kashmiri manufacturers to export the Pashmina Shawls to Europe. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
2. Given below are two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and other is labelled as Reason R. Assertion A: The British wanted Ranjit Singh to sign the treaty. Reason R: The British wanted to control the trade through the Indus. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
1. Shannon and Weaver's communication model was not focused on: (UGC NET 13th Mar 2023 Evening) A. Message transmission B. Contents of messages C. Meanings of messages D. Intention behind messages E. Medium of transmission
  • A, B, C only
  • C, D, E only
  • B, C, D only
  • A, D, E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D only
2. The Shannon and Weaver mathematical model of communication was based on a linear system of: (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Print communication
  • Electronic communication
  • New communication
  • Traditional communication
Correct Answer: Electronic communication
3. Who were persuaded by the British to enter into a treaty with them? A. Rustam Khan B. Murad Ali C. Ranjit Singh Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and C only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A and B only
4. Given below are two statements: Statement I: The Sindh amirs were quite pleased and willing to sign the treaty with the British. Statement II: Controlling the navigation through the Indus was high on the British agenda. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
5. Given below are two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and other is labelled as Reason R. Assertion A: The British wanted to control the navigation routes through the rivers. Reason R: Rivers were used for trading goods and the British found it lucrative to make profit by controlling the trade. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.

  • 6
  • 5
  • 4
  • 7
Correct Answer: 6

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.

  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.

  • A, C and D only
  • A, B and D only
  • B, C and D only

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

  • A and B only
  • A and C only
  • B and C only
  • A and D only

  • The end of eighteenth century
  • The beginning of the nineteenth century
  • The middle of the nineteenth century
  • The end of the nineteenth century
Correct Answer: The end of the nineteenth century
1. The disadvantages of Aristotle's model of communication are: (UGC NET 20th Oct 2022 Morning shift) A. Weak encoding B. Audience created content C. One‐way communication D. Stress on the speaker E. Ignorance of noise
  • C, D and E only
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A, D and E only
Correct Answer: C, D and E only
2. Identify the correct sequence of the elements of communication set by Aristotle: (UGC NET 9th July 2022- Morning shift) A. Speech B. Speaker C. Audience D. Occasion E. Effect
  • D, B, A, E, C
  • C, D, A, E, B
  • B, A, D, C, E
  • A, D, B, C, E
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C, E
3. Given below are two statements: Statement I: The territories near the West coast of North America became part of USA much later than those near the East Coast. Statement II: USA gained independence from England in the nineteenth century. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
4. The resistance of American Indians against the territorial expansion of USA ended
  • About 50 years after USA came into existence.
  • About 25 to 30 years after the Civil war in USA.
  • About 25 to 30 years before the Civil war in USA.
  • About 25 to 30 years after USA came into existence.
Correct Answer: About 25 to 30 years after the Civil war in USA.

Statement II: Abolition of slavery was one of the outcomes of civil war in USA. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

  • B, C and D only
  • B, D and E only

  • India
  • Africa
  • Persia
  • South East Asia
Correct Answer: Africa

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement 1 is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

  • Psychological disability
  • Market pressure
  • Ego of Individuals
  • Attention deficit
Correct Answer: Attention deficit

  • Enormous
  • Time-tested

  • Ethical studies
  • Effects theory
  • Culture analysis
  • Causal theory
Correct Answer: Effects theory
3. The carry-over effect in relation to television means
  • Stop watching it
  • Continue watching it
  • Switch over to another medium
  • Complain to network executives
Correct Answer: Continue watching it
4. Default options become powerful when
  • People reject offers.
  • People do not know what to select.
  • People want to switch default option.
  • Default setters endorse them.
Correct Answer: Default setters endorse them.
5. The passage is a deconstruction of
  • The status quo bias and the issue of default options.
  • The psychological exploitation of network executives.
  • Careful selection of magazines.
  • Default options not attracting the market share.
Correct Answer: The status quo bias and the issue of default options.
1. Given below are two statements: Statement I: News publishers have better information about their users as compared to social media platforms.  Statement II: Social media platforms are generally very particular in presenting correct information to the citizens.  In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
2. Identify the correct statements from those given below:  A. Social media platforms have impacted the local news publishers adversely.  B. Social media platforms make much more money as compared to individual [KW& publishers]. C. News publishers are better placed than social media platforms because of their size and information they have about the users.  Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and C only
  • A. B and C
Correct Answer: A and B only

  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement l and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.

  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct.

  • Both Statement I and Statement II arc false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is False but Statement II is true.

  • 2%
  • 3%
  • 4%
  • 5%
Correct Answer: 2%

  • D, A, B, E, C

  • B, D, C, E, A

1. In a classroom situation, a teacher organizes group discussion to help arrive at a solution of a problem. In terms of a model of communication used, it will be called (UGC NET 24th June 2019 Morning Paper)
  • A linear mode
  • A horizontal model
  • A transactional model
  • An interaction model
Correct Answer: A transactional model
2. What are the key features of transactional model of communication? (UGC NET 1st Oct 2022- Morning Shift) A. Absence of noise B. Extensively used in interpersonal communication C. Feedback is a new message D. Role exchange by encoder and decoder E. Encoder and decoder discrimination is the order
  • B, C and D only
  • A, D and E only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only
3. The important features of the transactional model of communication are (UGC NET 05th Mar 2023 Evening) A. Feedback is repetitive. B. It is mostly used for inter-personal communication. C. The senders and the receivers of messages can inter-change their roles. D. Feedback is simultaneous. E. The heavy dose of noise provides a message.
  • A, B and C only
  • C, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only
3. The world is facing unprecedented uncertainly because of A. war in Europe B. high levels of inflation in developed countries C. energy crisis in Europe D. fast pace of interest hikes in US E. normalisation after the end of pandemic Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A, B, C and D Only
  • B, C, D and E Only
  • A, C, D and E Only
  • A, B, C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D Only

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement ll is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
5. Current account deficit in India is increasing because of A. Rise in India's imports B. Rise in India's exports C. Increase in foreign capital inflows D. Fall in India's exports Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A and B Only
  • B and C Only
  • A and D Only
  • C and D Only
Correct Answer: A and D Only
1. Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).  Assertion (A): Zambia was a rich and developed nation in 1964.  Reason (R): It had rich copper resources.  In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
  • Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is NOT the correct explanation of (A).
  • (A) is correct but (R) is not correct.
  • (A) is not correct but (R) is correct.
Correct Answer: (A) is not correct but (R) is correct.
2. Identify the correct statements:  A. Conditions in Zambia have improved since the 1990s.  B. Zambia has one of the lowest living standards in the world.  C. Zambian leader Kenneth Kaunda was quite popular at home in 1990s.  Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and C only
  • A B and C
Correct Answer: A and B only
3. Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).  Assertion (A): South Korea developed much faster than Zambia after 1964.  Reason (R): In 1964, conditions in South Korea were far more promising for growth and development than in Zambia.  In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
  • Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is NOT the correct explanation of (A).
  • (A) is correct but (R) is not correct.
  • (A) is not correct but (R) is correct.
Correct Answer: (A) is correct but (R) is not correct.
4. Given below are two statements:  Statement I: In 1964. Zambia was far more developed than South Korea.  Statement II: Zambia was ruled by an elected president in 1964.  In light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
5. Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).  Assertion (A): The Zambian leader was quite popular in his country in 1964.  Reason (R): Zambia achieved significant growth in its economy under his leadership.  In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
  • Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is NOT the correct explanation of (A).
  • (A) is correct but (R) is not correct.
  • (A) is not correct but (R) is correct.
Correct Answer: (A) is correct but (R) is not correct.

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.

  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and D only

1. The key features of the interaction model of communication are: (UGC NET 11th Oct 2022- Evening shift) A. It is a two way process B. The physical context of communication is unimportant C. The psychological context of communication D. Feedback is not a response to the message received E. It is less message focused
  • B, C, D
  • C, D, E
  • A, C, E
  • A, B, C
Correct Answer: A, C, E

It is associated with the concept of field of experience. D. This model is also known as convergence model. E. Here the communication always happens between two familiar persons.
  • A, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only

  • Both A and R. are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R. are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement 1 is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and C only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A and C only

  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and D only
  • A, C and D only

  • ≈10 years
  • ≈20 years
  • ≈30 years
  • ≈40 years
Correct Answer: ≈20 years

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • A and D only
  • C and D only
Correct Answer: A and D only

  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R. are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.

  • 10-15 percent
  • 25-30 percent
  • 40-45 percent
  • 50-55 percent
Correct Answer: 25-30 percent

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

  • Grapevine Communication
  • Intrapersonal Communication
  • Organizational Communication
  • Interpersonal Communication
Correct Answer: Intrapersonal Communication

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.

No correct answer provided

  • The last 20 years
  • The last 40 years
  • The last 50 years
  • More than 90 years
Correct Answer: More than 90 years

  • Both A and R. are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.

5. For every 100 units of energy consumed in the process of fusion, the National Ignition Facility in California was able to produce how many units of energy?
  • 50
  • 100
  • 125
  • 150
Correct Answer: 150
1. In October, the index of Industrial production fell by
  • 5.88%
  • 6.77%
  • 4%
  • 5.6%
Correct Answer: 4%
2. Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R). Assertion (A): Consumption levels increased sharply after Covid-19 restrictions were lifted. Reason (R): The demand for goods had accumulated due to frequent Covid-19 restrictions and lockdowns. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R. are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R. are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
3. Which of the following registered the maximum percentage reduction in October?
  • Manufacturing
  • Consumer durables
  • Non-durables
  • Capital goods
Correct Answer: Consumer durables
4. Given below are two statements:  Statement I: All the food items this November were cheaper as compared to November last year. Statement II: Vegetables this November were cheaper than those last November   In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
5. Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R). Assertion (A): Food Inflation in winters is generally low. Reason (R): The demand for food items in winter is lower than that in other seasons. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R. are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct.
1. Given below are two statements:  Statement I: Growth in arithmetic progression is faster than that in geometrical progression. Statement II: The only paper that Malthus came out was his Essay on the Principle of Population.   In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
2. Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R). Assertion (A): Malthus could accurately predict the population growth that has taken place in the last two centuries. Reason (R): He believed that food supply could be increased by bringing more land into arable production. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • Both A and R. are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is not correct but R is correct.
1. The simplified communication model created by Wilbur Schramm initially had the elements of: (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Morning) A. An encoding source B. A noise breaker C. A noise marker D. A message for transmission E. A decoder to decode the message.
  • A, B, C only
  • C, D, E only
  • B, C, D only
  • A, D, E only
Correct Answer: A, D, E only
3. Given below are two statements:  Statement I: Malthus believed that population grows faster than the food supply. Statement II: Malthus was greatly influenced by events that occurred in the nineteenth century.   In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
4. Malthus believed that food supply could be increased by
  • Use of artificial fertilisers
  • Use of pesticides
  • Use of high yielding varieties of crops
  • Bringing more land into arable production
Correct Answer: Bringing more land into arable production
5. According to Malthus’s Essay on the Principle of population, human population would be kept in check by A. War B. Moral Restraint C. Famine D. Disease Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
1. What was the criticism of Illich on expert-based institutions?
  • Non-professionalism in sectors like medicine and transport
  • Too much expertise in the field of education
  • Adverse effects of feminization of work
  • Danger to economic progress
Correct Answer: Adverse effects of feminization of work
2. His critiques were set in the context of
  • Global historicity
  • Convivial modes of living
  • Self-degradation
  • Ethical norms
Correct Answer: Convivial modes of living
3. What did Illich foresee in his book?
  • Industrial Society’s self-destruction
  • More scope for mass production
  • Arrival of advanced industrial society
  • End to all struggles in the world
Correct Answer: Industrial Society’s self-destruction
4. The consequences of Industrial Revolution are: A. Damage to environment B. Restricted use of energy C. Conquest of time and space D. Minimal use of resources Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A and B only
  • B and C only
  • C and D only
  • A and C only
Correct Answer: A and C only
5. The inference from the passage is that:
  • Specialized expertise is absolutely essential.
  • An industrial society is a welfare society.
  • Conviviality should have its own limits.
  • Industrialization is highly beneficial
Correct Answer: Conviviality should have its own limits.
1. What was the initial response of western press to Gandhiji’s salt march?
  • Skeptical
  • Appreciative
  • Deceptive
  • Neutral
Correct Answer: Skeptical
2. How did Time magazine describe Gandhiji’s salt march in its first report?
  • People would reject the march.
  • He would not be able to complete it.
  • The British supported the march.
  • Gandhiji had the physical strength to lead the march.
Correct Answer: He would not be able to complete it.

  • Convoluted
  • Non‐transactional
  • Horizontal
  • Authoritarian
Correct Answer: Horizontal

  • Risk communication
  • Personal communication
  • Horizontal communication
  • Vertical communication
Correct Answer: Horizontal communication

No correct answer provided
3. What was the first effect of the salt March?
  • People were confused.
  • Gandhi’s followers were reluctant.
  • Gandhi was able to garner world attention.
  • Gandhiji’s faith in Christianity got reinforced
Correct Answer: Gandhi was able to garner world attention.
4. The salt march was the first nationalist movement to attract/incur
  • The attention of American press
  • Comments by the European Press
  • The wrath of the British Government
  • A large number of women participants
Correct Answer: A large number of women participants
5. According to the passage, the most significant outcome of the salt march was that
  • The British were able to nullify the effects of the movement.
  • Gandhiji could not achieve his aim of breaking the salt law.
  • The British realized the need for devolution of power with Indians.
  • The salt march ended as a mere local movement of tokenism.
Correct Answer: The British realized the need for devolution of power with Indians.

  • Add value to their guidance.
  • Provide them with a warning system.
  • Clarify their duties in fields other than education.
  • By adoption of certain metaphors.
Correct Answer: By adoption of certain metaphors.

  • Too much contribution of the tutor.
  • Disruption during tutorials.
  • Internal divisions.
  • Outside intervention
Correct Answer: Too much contribution of the tutor.

  • Displace teachers from teaching
  • Liberate students for their own learning
  • Strengthen the authority of teachers
  • Avoid critical pedagogy
Correct Answer: Liberate students for their own learning

  • Abandonment of the online tutorial system
  • Vigorous student protestation
  • Emergence of dos and don’ts guidelines
  • Supervisory role of students

  • The traditional educational system
  • The new assessment methodology

Correct Answer: Paradoxes of online tutoring

  • Lower Indo-China

Correct Answer: Low Income Countries

  • Lateral communication
  • Downward communication
  • Upward communication
  • Horizontal communication
Correct Answer: Downward communication

  • The Emergence of wheeled cart
  • Neolithic Revolution
  • Metallurgy
  • Invention of writing
Correct Answer: Invention of writing

  • D, B, A, C
  • D, C, B, A
  • A, D, B, C

Correct Answer: D, B, A, C

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.

  • B and C only
  • A and C only

Correct Answer: A, B and C only

Reason R: Inductive reasoning is more sound logically as compared to deductive reasoning. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct.

  • B and C only
  • A and B only
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: A only

  • Crying
  • A smiling face to pacify the parent
  • Sucking the edge of a blanket
  • ‘Pick-me-up’ gesture
Correct Answer: A smiling face to pacify the parent

Statement II: An infant has little understanding of the emotions conveyed through facial expressions of others.   • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.

  • A is not correct but R is correct.

Native people in the poor countries are quite powerful. C. Most of the world population belongs to indigenous cultures D. Indigenous people possess unique cultures E. Indigenous cultures are facing a threat from western culture Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

Correct Answer: A, D and E only

  • c, d and e only
  • b, c and d only

  • Competing organizations
  • Social networks of employees
  • Top management of an organization
  • Competing organizations
  • External professional agencies
Correct Answer: Social networks of employees

  • B, C, A
