1. Research is (UGC NET Jun 2010)
  • Searching again and again
  • Working in a scientific way to search for truth of any problem
  • None of the above
  • Finding solution to any problem
Correct Answer: Working in a scientific way to search for truth of any problem
1. In the list of statements given below which of them offer a suitable definition of research? (UGC NET 18 Dec 2018 Morning)   (a) Research means a repeated search (b) Research is basically an answer to a question. (c) Research provides an authentic solution to a problem. (d) Research is an Endeavour to prove one’s hypothesis. (e) Research is a meaning- giving process (f) Research means drawing a sample from a defined population.
  • (a), (d) and (f)
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (b), (c) and (f)
  • (b), (c) and (e)
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c)
1. What is a Research Design? (UGC NET Dec 2014)
  • The choice between using qualitative or quantitative methods.
  • A framework for every stage of the collection and analysis of data.
  • A way of conducting research that is not grounded in theory.
  • The choice between using qualitative or quantitative methods.
Correct Answer: A framework for every stage of the collection and analysis of data.
1. When a research study is conducted to know about an unknown area and collect information, it is known as: (UGC NET 08 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Explanatory research
  • Feasibility study
  • Pilot Study
  • Exploratory research
Correct Answer: Exploratory research
1. A study in which a group of participants is observed and measured over a period of time, refers to (UGC NET 22 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Cross-sectional Research
  • Archival Research
  • Longitudinal Research
  • Correlational Research
Correct Answer: Longitudinal Research
2. Nine year olds are taller than seven year olds. This is an example of a reference drawn from (UGC NET Jun 2012)
  • Vertical study
  • Time series study
  • Cross-sectional study
  • Experimental study
Correct Answer: Cross-sectional study
1. In quantitative research, providing a basis for more precise estimation of the degree of relationship among or between concepts is the function of (UGC NET 14 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Measurement
  • Surveying
  • Reviewing
  • Sampling
Correct Answer: Measurement
2. Which of the following represents the Quantitative Research methodology? (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022 Morning) a. One to One Interview b. Survey research c. Focus groups d. Correlation research e. Descriptive research
  • c, d, e Only
  • b, c, d Only
  • b, d, e Only
  • a, d, e Only
Correct Answer: b, d, e Only
1. Arrange the steps in hypothetico-deductive research in the correct sequence: (UGC NET 24 Sept 2020 Evening paper) A. Identifying and defining a research problem B. Defining the population and drawing a sub-set therefrom C. Data collection using appropriate research tasks followed by data analyses D. Hypothesis formulation and developing a design of research E. Taking a decision on the substantive research hypothesis via testing of the Null hypothesis (H0)
  • A, C, B, D, E
  • A, B, C, D, E
  • A, D, B, C, E
  • B, A, C, D, E
Correct Answer: A, D, B, C, E
2. In using the hypothetico-deductive research paradigm which of the following sequences is considered appropriate? (UGC NET 24 Sept 2020 Morning paper)
  • Establishing a research problem, hypothesis making, hypothesis testing arriving at generalisation and conclusion
  • Hypothesis making, hypothesis testing, arriving at generalization and conclusive
  • Hypothesis testing, hypothesis making, finalizing the research problem, arriving at the generalisation and conclusion.
  • Hypothesis making, establishing a research problem, hypothesis testing, arriving at generalisation and conclusion.
Correct Answer: Establishing a research problem, hypothesis making, hypothesis testing arriving at generalisation and conclusion
1. In describing elements of communication, a person or an event which provides verbal or non-verbal cues to which someone can respond is known as: (UGC NET 3rd Dec 2021 Morning paper)
  • Channel
  • Communication context
  • Source
  • Message
Correct Answer: Source
1. Identify the main features of ‘qualitative research’ from the following: (UGC NET 20 Nov Evening 2021) a. It is concerned with understanding the phenomena from the participant’s perspective. b. It assumes that there are social facts with a single objective reality. c. Researcher becomes immersed in the situation, present or past. d. Researcher is detached from the study to avoid bias. e. There is greater flexibility in both the methods and research process.
  • c, d and e only
  • a, b and c only
  • b, c and d only
  • a, c and e only
Correct Answer: a, c and e only
1. In which method of research an independent variable is manipulated with an intent to observe concomitant changes in dependent variables? (UGC NET 22 Nov Evening 2021)
  • Experimental method
  • Case study method
  • ExPost Facto method
  • Descriptive survey method
Correct Answer: Experimental method
1. The research method which focuses on establishing causal relationships with controls among variables- independent, moderator and dependent, is called (UGC NET 01 Oct 2020 Morning paper)
  • Survey method
  • Ex post facto method
  • Case study method
  • Experimental method
Correct Answer: Experimental method
2. For which type of research, the action words – ‘Control, manipulate and observe’ are most relevant? (UGC NET 19 Dec 2018 Morning)
  • Action research
  • Experimental research
  • Grounded theory approach-based research
  • Historical Research
Correct Answer: Experimental research
1. Creating purpose statements, research questions and hypotheses that are narrow and measurable would mark the characteristic features of which research type? (UGC NET 21 Nov 2021 Morning)
  • Narrative research
  • Experimental research
  • Ethnographic research
  • Grounded theory research
Correct Answer: Experimental research
2. Hypothesis testing is the main concept of which type of research? (UGC NET 03 Dec 2019 Morning Paper)
  • Experimental research
  • Survey research
  • Historical research
  • Exegetic research
Correct Answer: Experimental research
1. When the independent variable is explored rather than manipulated, to observe the effect on dependent variable, the method of research is called:  (UGC NET 05 Nov 2020 Morning paper)
  • Case study method
  • Experimental method
  • Descriptive survey method
  • Ex-post facto method
Correct Answer: Ex-post facto method
1. The research which is exploring new facts through the study of the past is called (UGC NET Dec 2009)
  • Content analysis
  • Historical research
  • Mythological research
  • Philosophical research
Correct Answer: Historical research
1. Participatory research is also described as: (UGC NET 21 Dec 2018 Morning)
  • Government-based
  • Community-based
  • Individual-based
  • Group-based
Correct Answer: Community-based
1. Which of the following are the characteristics of case study research? (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Evening) a. It is simulated in a laboratory. b. It is particularistic. c. It is descriptive. d. It is inductive. e. It is disruptive.
  • a, b and c only
  • b, c and d only
  • c, d and e only
  • a, b and e only
Correct Answer: b, c and d only
1. Data of research take the forms of words or pictures with the researcher as the key instrument in which of the following studies? (UGC NET 21 Nov Evening 2021)
  • Participant observation based Studies
  • Descriptive survey Studies
  • Ex Post Facto Studies
  • Experimental Studies
Correct Answer: Participant observation based Studies
1. Constant comparison is a tool used in: (UGC NET 05 Dec Morning 2021)
  • Grand theory
  • Feministic theory
  • Grounded theory
  • Relational theory
Correct Answer: Grounded theory
1. Communication begins usually with: (UGC NET 12th Nov 2020 Evening paper)
  • Pictures in the mind
  • Semantic noise
  • Apprehension
  • Confused ideas
Correct Answer: Pictures in the mind
1. Which of the following are identified as verbal communication skills? (UGC NET 28th Nov 2021 Evening paper) A. Use of aggressive language B. Assertiveness C. Opening feedback channels D. Taking credit for oneself E. Use of affirmative words
  • B, C and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only
2. One of the characteristics of oral communication system is that it is (UGC NET 11th July 2022 Morning shift)
  • Noise laden
  • Point to point
  • Mediated
  • Impersonal
Correct Answer: Point to point
3. A verbal communication technique used in teaching is (UGC NET 4th Dec 2019 Morning Paper)
  • Slow expression of words
  • Varying the speed of voice and tone
  • Resorting to semantic jugglery
  • Presentation without pause
Correct Answer: Varying the speed of voice and tone
1. In which type of research, the steps of research have to be cyclic? (UGC NET 19 Dec 2018 Morning)
  • Experimental research
  • Grounded theory research
  • Grounded theory research
  • Action research
Correct Answer: Action research
2. In doing action research what is the usual sequence of steps? (UGC NET Jan 2017)
  • Plan, act, observe, reflect
  • Reflect, observe, plan, act
  • Act, observe, plan, reflect
  • Plan, reflect, observe, act
Correct Answer: Plan, act, observe, reflect
1. In ethnographic research, the researcher involves himself in a _______ over a period of time. (UGC NET 02 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • political campaign
  • social setting
  • financial transaction
  • philosophical discourse
Correct Answer: social setting
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 11 July 2022 Evening) Statement I: Multivariate studies demand larger samples than univariate studies. Statement II: Multivariate studies do not analyse the data sets involving several responses.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 01st Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: In Focus group discussions, the moderator is supposed to provide a liberal climate for participants to open up. Statement II: Participants of focus group discussions should rant individual experiences for comparison.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
1. When a respondent is aware of being measured then its effect on his behaviour is identified as: (UGC NET 05 Jan Evening 2022)
  • Reactivity
  • Identity effect
  • Artificiality
  • Self — consciousness
Correct Answer: Reactivity
1. A researcher is interested in studying the prospects of a particular political party in an area. What tool should he prefer for the study? (UGC NET Dec 2015)
  • Questionnaire
  • Interview
  • Schedule
  • Rating scale
Correct Answer: Questionnaire
1. In which of the following research methods the emphasis is laid on naturalistic settings and meaning-giving processes? (UGC NET 22 Dec 2018 Evening)
  • Experimental method
  • Experimental method
  • Case study method
  • Ex post facto method
Correct Answer: Case study method
1. Which of the following are the criteria of a successful interviewer? (UGC NET 05 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Ethical B. Open Minded C. Gentle and Sensitive D. Balanced E. Rigid and Harsh in comments.
  • A, B, C, D only
  • A, B, D, E only
  • B, C, D, E only
  • A, C, D, E only
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D only
1. When a fixed list of questions is administered to all the participants in the same order, it is known as (UGC NET 15 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Structured interview
  • Summative interview
  • Formative interview
  • Fixed question interview
Correct Answer: Structured interview
1. The easiest attitudinal scale which is a summated rating scale is the: (UGC NET 25 June 2020 Morning paper)
  • Guttman Scale
  • Thurstone Scale
  • Likert Scale
  • MLA Scale
Correct Answer: Likert Scale
1. In verbal communication, words act as: (UGC NET 20th Dec 2018 Morning)
  • Decorative
  • Passive barriers
  • Symbols
  • Fillers
Correct Answer: Symbols
2. Which of the following are the effects of oral communication? (UGC NET 9th July 2022- Morning shift) A. Fragmented information B. Personal connect C. Feedback D. Objectivity E. Absence of interpretation
  • A, B and C
  • C, D and E
  • A and B
  • B and C
Correct Answer: B and C
1. The issue of research ethics is pertinent at which of the following Stages of research?
  • Data collection, data analysis and reporting of research findings/results
  • Defining the population, sampling procedures and techniques
  • Deciding the quantitative or qualitative tracks or both for pursuing the research problem
  • Identification, definition and delimitation of research problem
Correct Answer: Data collection, data analysis and reporting of research findings/results
1. The major characteristic of correlation analysis is to seek out: (UGC NET 26th June 2019 Morning Paper)
  • Regression among variables
  • Differences among variables
  • Variations among variables
  • Association among variables
Correct Answer: Association among variables
1. With which one of the following techniques communality is associated? (UGC NET Sep 2013)
  • Univariate analysis
  • SWOT analysis
  • Factor analysis
  • Case studies
Correct Answer: Factor analysis
1. The term "File drawer problem" is related to: (UGC NET 29 Nov 2021 Evening)
  • Ethnography
  • Experimentation
  • Meta analysis
  • Case history
Correct Answer: Meta analysis
1. The domain of application in thematic analysis is: (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Text integration
  • Visual aesthetics
  • Discourse revision
  • Group comparison
Correct Answer: Group comparison
1. In research, the combination of different methods, study groups, local and temporal settings, and different theoretical perspectives in dealing with a phenomenon is called: (UGC NET 28 Nov Evening 2021)
  • Mediation
  • Content analysis
  • Corpus
  • Triangulation
Correct Answer: Triangulation
1. Symbolic interactionism is a (UGC NET 06th Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Research question
  • Theory
  • Review
  • Hypothesis
Correct Answer: Theory
1. An analysis of the subjects life for meaning has the focus of: (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Phenomenology
  • Structuralism
  • Sociology
  • Pragmatism
Correct Answer: Phenomenology
1. When the consistency of data collected is measured at different points of time, it is identified as. (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Inter- rater reliability
  • Internal reliability
  • Split half reliability
  • Test- retest reliability
Correct Answer: Test- retest reliability
2. The degree to which observed values/scores are free from errors of measurement, refers to (UGC NET 16 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Criterion Validity
  • Content Validity
  • Reliability
  • Construct Validity
Correct Answer: Reliability
1. The appropriateness, meaningfulness and usefulness of the specific inferences made from the measures, is called (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Test-Retest Reliability
  • Parallel Test Reliability
  • Validity
  • Interrater Reliability
Correct Answer: Validity
2. When results obtained in a research study can be extended to a group larger than the sample (outside the context of the study) it is called (UGC NET 2nd Dec 2019 Morning Paper)
  • External validity
  • Internal validity
  • Functional relationship
  • Hypothetical construct
Correct Answer: External validity
1. The means of non‐verbal communication are: (UGC NET 24th  December 2021) A. Spoken language B. Time language C. Sign language D. Space language E. Written language
  • A, B and C only
  • D, C and E only
  • A, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only
2. Non-verbal communication is mostly (UGC NET 10th Oct 2022 Morning Shift) A. Descriptive B. Aggressive C. Involuntary D. Contextual E. Symbolic
  • A, B, C
  • B, C, D
  • A, D, E
  • C, D, E
Correct Answer: C, D, E
3. Non-verbal communication is considered: (UGC NET 22nd Dec 2018 Morning)
  • Formal
  • Precise
  • Informal
  • Culture-free
Correct Answer: Informal
1. In choosing a research tool which of the following are important considerations? (UGC NET 13 Nov 2020 Evening paper) a. The validity of the research tool b. The reliability of the research tool c. Cost involved in terms of time and resources for use of research tool.  d. Face validity of the research tool e. Opinion of the research supervisor
  • Only a, b and c
  • Only b, d and e
  • Only a, c and e
  • Only c, d and e
Correct Answer: Only a, b and c
1. A common test in research demands much priority on
  • Objectivity
  • Reliability
  • Usability
  • All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above
1. In the context of Research Methodology, what does the word Ontology refer to? (UGC NET 11 July 2022 Evening)
  • Cancers, diseases and their treatments.
  • Concepts and categories, their properties and relationships.
  • Research papers and journals and their citation.
  • A word indexing method.
Correct Answer: Concepts and categories, their properties and relationships.
2. In Social Science, a central issue is the question of whether the social world can be studied using the methods of natural sciences. This statement refers to the issue of: (UGC NET 4th Dec 2019 Evening Paper)
  • Ontology
  • Axiology
  • Etymology
  • Epistemology
Correct Answer: Epistemology
1. Scientists should put aside, their personal beliefs and biases and see the world as it "really" is. Which one of the following philosophical positions supports the above statement? (UGC NET 27 Nov Evening 2021)
  • Positivism
  • Constructivism
  • Inductivism
  • Post-positivism
Correct Answer: Positivism

  • Normative Survey
  • Ethnographic Study

  • Symposium
  • Conference

  • Workshop
Correct Answer: Workshop

  • hands on training/experience
  • showcase new theories
  • multiple target groups
  • giving lectures
Correct Answer: hands on training/experience
1. When academicians are called to deliver lecture or presentation to an audience on certain topics or a set of topics of educational nature, it is called (UGC NET Dec 2014)
  • Seminar
  • Training Program
  • Workshop
  • Symposium
Correct Answer: Seminar
2. Which of the following are the characteristics of a seminar? (UGC NET Dec 2015) (a) It is a form of academic instruction (b) It involves questioning, discussion and debates. (c) It involves large groups of individuals. (d) It needs involvement of skilled persons.
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (a), (b) and (d)
  • (b) and (d)
  • (b) and (c)
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (d)
1. In which of the following activities, potential for nurturing creative and critical thinking is relatively greater? (UGC NET Jul 2018)
  • Participation in a workshop
  • Presenting a seminar paper
  • Participation in research conference
  • Preparing research summary
Correct Answer: Participation in research conference
2. Conferences are meant for (UGC NET Dec 2012)
  • Show-casing new Research
  • Multiple target groups
  • All the above
  • Group discussions
Correct Answer: All the above

  • Introduction
  • References
  • Discussion
  • Abstract
Correct Answer: Introduction
2. Bibliography given in a research report (UGC NET 24 June 2019 Morning Paper)
  • Is an optional part of the report
  • Helps those interested in further research
  • Makes the report authentic
  • Shows the vast knowledge of the researcher
Correct Answer: Helps those interested in further research

  • Symposium/Workshop
  • Thesis/Dissertation
  • Seminar paper/Articles
  • Conference and Seminar Papers
Correct Answer: Thesis/Dissertation
2. The format of thesis writing is the same as in (UGC NET Jul 2016)
  • a research dissertation
  • presenting a workshop / conference paper
  • writing of seminar presentation
  • preparation of a research paper/article
Correct Answer: a research dissertation
1. Which of the following influence non‐verbal communication? (UGC NET 24th Nov 2021 Evening paper)  A. Avoidance of signals B. Invisible incongruence C. Culture D. Geographical location E. Contextuality
  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, D and E only
  • C, D and E only
Correct Answer: C, D and E only
2. Which of the following are the traits of non-verbal communication? (1st Oct 2022- Evening shift) A. It has limited meaning. B. It does not have substitution. C. It can convey contextual meaning. D. It can influence receptors. E. It can affect personal relationship.
  • C, D and E
  • B, C and D
  • A, D and E
  • A, B and C
Correct Answer: C, D and E
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 1st Oct 2022- Evening shift) Assertion A: As regards communication, a major function is to build, manipulate and use symbols. Reason R: One of the functions of communication is to entertain the receivers.
  • A is false but R is true.
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A are R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is true but R is false.
Correct Answer: Both A are R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A.
4. Given below are two statements (10th Oct 2022 Evening Shift) Statement I: Non-verbal signals are used to emphasize and support the verbal communication. Statement II: Non-verbal signals are not a substitute for verbal communication
  • Statement I is false but II is true
  • Both statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Both statement I and II are true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but II is false
1. In a thesis ‘Format and styles of referencing’ have been inappropriately followed, this is an example of (UGC NET 02 Dec 2019 Morning Paper)
  • Inability of the researcher to write a thesis
  • Lack of commitment on the part of researcher to write a thesis
  • Unethical practice of the researcher
  • Technical lapse on the part of researcher
Correct Answer: Technical lapse on the part of researcher
1. In relation to code of conduct in research, what does APA stand for?
  • Association of Psychological Assessments
  • Australian Psychological Association
  • Advanced Psychological Authority
  • American Psychological Association
Correct Answer: American Psychological Association
1. Coding research participants into qualitative variables as male and female represents (UGC NET 15 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • The Thurstone scale
  • The differential scale
  • The Likert scale
  • The nominal scale
Correct Answer: The nominal scale
1. In which of the scales of measurement, the properties of classification and order, both are present? (UGC NET 04 Nov 2020 Morning paper)
  • Interval
  • Ratio
  • Ordinal
  • Nominal
Correct Answer: Ordinal
1. In which scale of measurement, classification, order and equality of units are ensured? (UGC NET 17 Oct 2020 Evening paper)
  • Interval
  • Ordinal
  • Nominal
  • Ratio
Correct Answer: Interval
1. A true zero point is the feature of: (UGC NET 08 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Ordinal scale
  • Ratio scale
  • Nominal scale
  • Interval scale
Correct Answer: Ratio scale
1. When a researcher divides the entire population in sections, it is called as (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Convenience sampling
  • Stratified sampling
  • Cluster sampling
  • Systematic sampling
Correct Answer: Cluster sampling
2. Suppose a researcher created a list of the names of everybody in a population of interest and selected every 10th name in order to get a list of participants comprising the sample. This type of sampling is called: (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Quota Sampling
  • Convenience Sampling
  • Systematic Sampling
  • Simple Random Sampling
Correct Answer: Systematic Sampling
3. If a researcher wants to select a sample from a population such that each member in the population of interest has an equal chance of being selected in the sample, the researcher is following: (UGC NET 23 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Convenience sampling
  • Random sampling
  • Quota sampling
  • Purposive sampling
Correct Answer: Random sampling
1. A major advantage of snowball sampling method is that it helps the research to focus only on (UGC NET 13 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • long standing residents
  • people in an area
  • people of particular interest
  • migrants
Correct Answer: people of particular interest
2. A sample of respondents which is available to researchers because of their access to the respondents is identified as: (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Convenience sampling
  • Snowball sampling
  • Quota sampling
  • Random sampling
Correct Answer: Convenience sampling
1. A hypothesis is a (UGC NET Jun 2016)
  • canon
  • postulate
  • law
  • supposition
Correct Answer: supposition
1. Hypothesis, that is alternative to null hypothesis, is represented as: (UGC NET 29 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • H
  • H1
  • Halt
  • H0
Correct Answer: H1
1. Which of the following constitute the paralanguage in communication? (UGC NET 18th Dec 2018 Evening) (a) Pitch of the voice (b) Internal noise (c) External noise (d) Use of pause (e) Rate and volume of speech
  • (a), (d) and (e)
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (a), (c) and (e)
Correct Answer: (a), (d) and (e)
2. Which of the following is an exclusive example of Non‐verbal cue that includes the pitch, rate, volume and use of pauses? (UGC NET 20th  November 2021 Evening paper)
  • Para‐Language
  • Linear Model of Communication
  • Non‐Verbal Cues
  • Interactional Model
Correct Answer: Para‐Language
3. Which of the following can be categorized as non-verbal communication? (UGC NET 14th Oct 2022 Evening shift) A. Pleasant voice B. Postures C. Gestures D. Facial expressions E. Vociferous greetings
  • C, D and E
  • A, B and C
  • B, C and E
  • B, C and D
Correct Answer: B, C and D
4. In non‐verbal communication, 'Chronemics' refers to: (UGC NET 4th Jan 2022 Evening paper)
  • Place
  • Time
  • Space
  • Person
Correct Answer: Time
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 22 Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: If we accept a hypothesis when it should be rejected, we say type I error has been made. Statement II: If we reject a hypothesis when it should be accepted, we say type II error has been made.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
1. Which of the following is the major objective of education? (UGC NET 11 July 2022 Morning)
  • Developing economy
  • Making students disciplined
  • Developing inherent abilities/ powers of students
  • Making students followers of teachers
Correct Answer: Developing inherent abilities/ powers of students
2. The goal of teaching as compared to training is to provide opportunity of: (UGC NET 11th Nov 2020 Morning)
  • Promotion of organized ideas as a result of disciplined drill
  • Sharing and caring leading to critical and creative reflection
  • Establishing beliefs and values leading to change in attitude
  • Associating ideas which are similar and dissimilar
Correct Answer: Sharing and caring leading to critical and creative reflection
Fill in the missing words
No correct answer provided
1. Teaching is a personal act to facilitate self-development.
No correct answer provided
2. The goal of all teaching is to cause learning.
No correct answer provided
3. Teaching invariably implies changing the opinion of others.
No correct answer provided
4. Teaching is triadic rather than dyadic in nature.
No correct answer provided
5. Teaching means selling ideas
No correct answer provided
6. Teaching means reaching the mind of students.
No correct answer provided
7. Teaching is like selling and learning is like buying.
No correct answer provided
8. Teaching is a social act while learning is a personal act
No correct answer provided
9. Teaching implies learning whereas learning does not imply teaching.
No correct answer provided
10 Teaching is a kind of delivery of knowledge while learning is like receiving it.
No correct answer provided
11. Teaching is an interaction and is triadic in nature whereas learning is an active engagement in a subject domain.
No correct answer provided
1. A history teacher spends time researching and designing a lesson plan on World War II, outlining key events, primary sources, and discussion questions.
  • Planning Phase
  • Execution Phase
  • Reflection Phase
Correct Answer: Planning Phase
2. During a physics class, a teacher conducts experiments on Newton's laws of motion, encourages student participation, and uses multimedia presentations to explain the concepts.
  • Planning Phase
  • Execution Phase
  • Reflection Phase
Correct Answer: Execution Phase
3. An English teacher reviews students' essays, identifies common challenges in understanding a literary concept, and decides to incorporate additional examples in future lessons.
  • Planning Phase
  • Execution Phase
  • Reflection Phase
Correct Answer: Reflection Phase
4. A geography teacher engages students in a virtual reality activity exploring different ecosystems, followed by a discussion on the impact of human activities on the environment.
  • Planning Phase
  • Execution Phase
  • Reflection phase
Correct Answer: Execution Phase
5. An art teacher evaluates students' creative projects, acknowledges diverse expressions, and considers incorporating more collaborative activities in future.
  • Planning Phase
  • Execution Phase
  • Reflection Phase
Correct Answer: Reflection Phase
Arrange the following levels of teaching in ascending order.
No correct answer provided
1. In which level of teaching, the main focus is laid on capturing and systematic presentation of ideas and information? (UGC NET 20 Nov Morning 2021)
  • Memory level
  • Understanding level
  • Reflective level
  • Autonomous development level
Correct Answer: Memory level
2. In which level of teaching, lower-level learning outcomes get focused? (UGC NET 3 Dec 2019 Morning)
  • Memory level
  • Understanding level
  • Reflective level
  • Autonomous development level
Correct Answer: Memory level
3. In which level of teaching, the activities of structuring, guiding and closely supervising the students' behaviour predominate? (UGC NET 30 Sept 2020 Evening)
  • Autonomous development level
  • Reflective level
  • Understanding level
  • Memory level
Correct Answer: Memory level
4. In which level of teaching, the teacher's role is more active rather than being interactive? (UGC NET 11 Nov 2020 Evening)
  • Memory level
  • Understanding level
  • Reflective level
  • Autonomous development level
Correct Answer: Memory level
5. The emphasis in memory level teaching is on which of the following? (UGC NET 6 Dec 2019 Morning) (a) Organisation of thought and ideas (b) Seeing of relationship among facts (c) Systematic presentations to enable quick reproduction (d) Critical thinking (e) Mastery of correct sequencing of facts (f) Segregating one feature from another
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (a), (c) and (e)
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (d), (e) and (f)
Correct Answer: (a), (c) and (e)
1. In which level of teaching, the learner gets an opportunity to discriminate at length between positive and negative exemplars of concepts? (UGC NET 24 Sept 2020 Morning)
  • Memory Level
  • Understanding Level
  • Reflective Level
  • Autonomous Development level
Correct Answer: Understanding Level
2. A teacher gives lot of positive and negative examples to support his / her presentations in the classroom. This will be related to which level of teaching? (UGC NET 21 June 2019 Evening)
  • Autonomous development level
  • Memory level
  • Understanding level
  • Reflective level
Correct Answer: Understanding level
3. Arrange the five steps of understanding level of teaching (according to Morrison) in the ascending sequence: (UGC NET 3 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Organisation B. Assimilation C. Presentation D. Recitation E. Exploration
  • E, C, B, A & D
  • C, B, A, E & D
  • A, C, D, B & E
  • D, E, C, B & A
Correct Answer: E, C, B, A & D
4. Which of the following is true about understanding level of teaching? (UGC NET 05 Dec Morning 2021)
  • Imparting factual information.
  • Teaching to comprehend the concepts.
  • Teaching to explore the field of knowledge.
  • Teaching to develop rational thinking.
Correct Answer: Teaching to comprehend the concepts.
1. Which of the following contributes for effective cross-cultural communication? (UGC NET 1st Oct 2020 Evening paper) a. Quick flow of words b. Use of foreign words c. Selection of simple words d. Taking turns to speak e. Maintenance of etiquette
  • a, b and c only
  • c, d and e only
  • a, d and e only
  • b, c and d only
Correct Answer: c, d and e only
2. People perceive the communicated messages according to their (UGC NET 02nd Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Imagined influences
  • Official status
  • Semantic gaps
  • Cultural values
Correct Answer: Cultural values
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 22nd Oct 2022 Morning shift) Statement I: Enculturisation of societies happen through education and persuasive communication. Statement II: Art and public communication contribute for the non-socialization of people
  • Statement I is false but II is true
  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Both Statement I and II are true
  • Both Statement I and II are false
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but II is false
1. Which level of teaching uses higher level of cognitive abilities as specified in Bloom’s taxonomy? (UGC NET 4 Nov 2020 Evening)
  • Memory level
  • Understanding level
  • Reflective level
  • Autonomous development level
Correct Answer: Reflective level
2. In which level of teaching promotion of critical thinking is the hall mark? (UGC NET 20 Nov Evening 2021)
  • Memory level
  • Understanding level
  • Reflective level
  • Autonomous development level
Correct Answer: Reflective level
3. Which of the following level of teaching lays stress on critical shifting of ideas at the highest cognitive level? (UGC NET 3 Dec Morning 2021)
  • Memory level
  • Understanding level
  • Reflective level
  • Autonomous development level
Correct Answer: Reflective level
4. Which level of teaching is also designated as ‘exploratory understanding’? (UGC NET 21 Nov Evening 2021)
  • Memory level
  • Understanding level
  • Reflective level
  • Autonomous development level
Correct Answer: Reflective level
5. The level of teaching which demands the use of higher order thinking skills is: (UGC NET 05 Jan Morning 2022)
  • Memory level teaching
  • Understanding level teaching
  • Reflective level teaching
  • Creativity level teaching
Correct Answer: Reflective level teaching
1. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 21 Nov Morning 2021) List I (Levels of teaching and learning) a. Autonomous development level b. Memory level c. Understanding level d. Reflective level List II (Main feature) i. It is problem-centred and requires on the part of learners more active participation. more imagination and creativeness. ii. Lays stress on the importance of students’ feelings and minimizes the value of hard thinking. iii. It is comparatively thoughtless. iv. It emphasizes on seeing of relationships between principles and solitary facts.
  • a‐ i, b‐ ii, c‐ iii, d‐ iv
  • a‐ iii, b‐ iv, c‐ i, d‐ ii
  • a‐ ii, b‐ iii, c‐ iv, d‐ i
  • a‐ iv, b‐ i, c‐ ii, d‐ iii
Correct Answer: a‐ ii, b‐ iii, c‐ iv, d‐ i
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 5 Mar 2023 Morning)    Statement I: The objective of the memory level of teaching is to develop rational and critical thinking among students.  Statement II: The objective of the reflective level of teaching is the ability to develop independent thinking and decision making among students.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
3. Match the two sets : (UGC NET 21 June 2019 Morning) Set-I (Levels of Learning)  a. Memory level b. Understanding level c. Analysing level d. Creating level Set-II (Examples) (i) Identifying examples of a given concept (ii) Generating new ideas (iii) Recalling information (iv) Isolating information into parts
  • a- ii, b- i, c- iii, d- iv
  • a- i, b- ii, c- iii, d- iv
  • a- iv, b- iii, c- i, d- ii
  • a- iii, b – i, c- iv, d- ii
Correct Answer: a- iii, b – i, c- iv, d- ii
4. Match the following: Set – I (Levels of Cognitive Interchange) a. Memory level b. Understanding level c. Reflective level Set – II (Basic requirements for promoting cognitive interchange) i. Giving opportunity for discriminating examples and non-examples of a point. ii. Recording the important points made during the presentations. iii. Asking the students to discuss various items of information. iv. Critically analyzing the points to be made and discussed.
  • a – ii, b – iv, c - i
  • a – iii, b –iv, c - ii
  • a – ii, b – i, c - iv
  • a - i, b – ii, c - iii
Correct Answer: a – ii, b – i, c - iv
5. Match the following levels of teaching with their respective features: List 1 (i) Memory level (ii) Understanding level (iii) Reflective level List 2 (a) Introspection (b) Rote Learning (c) A generalized insight
  • i - (b) ii - (c) iii - (a)
  • i - (a) ii - (c) iii - (b)
  • i - (b) ii - (a) iii - (c)
  • i - (c) ii - (a) iii - (b)
Correct Answer: i - (b) ii - (c) iii - (a)
6. Match the two sets : Set-I (Levels of teaching and learning) (a) Memory level (b) Understanding level (c) Reflective level Set-II (Exemplars and Concerns) (i) Encourages critical thinking based cognitive interchange (ii) Protects personal interest and attitudinal concerns (iii) Facilitates recalling and recognizing of facts (iv) Enhances scope for seeing of relationships and meanings
  • (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i)
  • (a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii)
  • (a)-(iii), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iv)
  • (a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i)
1. Which of the following set of statements reflects the basic characteristics of teaching? (UGC NET Aug 2016) i. Teaching is the same as training. ii. There is no difference between instruction and conditioning when we teach. iii. Teaching is related to learning. iv. Teaching is a ‘task’ word while learning is an ‘achievement’ word. v. Teaching means giving information. vi. One may teach without learning taking place.
  • i, ii and iii
  • iii, iv and vi
  • ii, iii and v
  • i, iv and vi
Correct Answer: iii, iv and vi
2. If teaching is viewed as a continuum, which of the following modality, involves active 'give' and 'take' between the teacher and learner? (UGC NET 5 Nov 2020 Evening)
  • Training
  • Conditioning
  • Instruction
  • Indoctrination
Correct Answer: Instruction
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 20 Nov Evening 2021)  Assertion ‘A’: ‘Teaching’ involves critical and creative interchanges between teacher and learner and hence it is different from ‘instruction’ and ‘training’. Reason ‘R’: Both ‘instruction’ and ‘training’ are directed at lower order cognitive interchanges.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
4. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 2 Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: Good teaching is formal in nature.  Statement II: There is no difference between teaching and training.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
5. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 22 Nov Morning 2021) List I (Modalities of Teaching) a. Instruction b. Training c. Conditioning d. Indoctrination List II (Implementation) (i) One way imposition of ideas from the teacher to the students. (ii) Associative presentation of ideas from teacher to students. (iii) Disciplined drill conducted by teacher. (iv) Active interchange of ideas between teacher and students.
  • a-(ii), b-(i), c-(iv), d-(iii)
  • a-(i), b-(ii), c-(iii), d-(iv)
  • a-(iv), b-(iii), c-(ii), d-(i)
  • a-(iii), b-(iv), c-(i), d-(ii)
Correct Answer: a-(iv), b-(iii), c-(ii), d-(i)
Identify these statements which relate to the characteristics of a teaching act.  (a) Teaching is a personal act to facilitate self-development. (b) The goal of all teaching is to cause learning. (c) Teaching invariably implies changing the opinion of others. (d) Teaching is triadic rather than dyadic in nature. (e) Teaching means selling ideas. (f) Teaching means reaching the mind of students.
  • (c), (d) and (e)
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (b), (d) and (f)
  • (f), (e) and (d)
Correct Answer: (b), (d) and (f)
1. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 05 Jan 2022 Evening) List I (Model of Teaching) a. Positive Interdependence b. Structured inquiry c. Role playing d. Jurisprudential inquiry List II (Developer) i. Fannie Shaftel ii. David Johnson iii. Donal Oliver and James Shaver iv. Robert Slavin
  • a- iii, b- ii, c- iv, d- i
  • a- ii, b- iv, c- iii, d- i
  • a- iv, b- i, c- iii, d- ii
  • a- i, b- iii, c- ii, d- iv
Correct Answer: a- ii, b- iv, c- iii, d- i
2. As students mature, the study of social issues at the community, state, national and international levels can be made available to them. Which model is designed for this purpose? (UGC NET 01 Dec 2021 Morning)
  • Role playing
  • Jurisprudential inquiry
  • Structured inquiry
  • Group investigation
Correct Answer: Jurisprudential inquiry
3. Arrange the phases for syntax of Group Investigations Model in correct sequence: (UGC NET 01 Dec 2021 Morning) a. Students formulate study task and organise for study. b. Students analyse progress and process. c. Students encounter puzzling situation. d. Independent and Group study. e. Students explore reactions to the situation.
  • a, c, b, e, d
  • b, a, d, e, c
  • c, e, a, d, b
  • d, e, b, a, c
Correct Answer: c, e, a, d, b
4. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 04 Jan 2022 Evening) List I (Model of Teaching) a. Positive interdependence b. Structured inquiry c. Group investigation d. Role playing List II (Developer) i. Robert Slavin ii. Fannie Shaftel iii. Roger Johnson iv. John Dewey
  • a -iii, b- i, c- iv, d- ii
  • a‐ i, b‐ iv, c‐ ii, d‐ iii
  • a‐ iv, b‐ ii, c‐ iii, d‐ i
  • a‐ ii, b‐ iii, c‐ i, d ‐iv
Correct Answer: a -iii, b- i, c- iv, d- ii
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 29 Nov 2021) Statement I: The advance organiser model is designed to strengthen students' cognitive structures ‐ their knowledge of a particular subject at any given time and how well organised, clear and stable that knowledge is. Statement II: Cognitive structure has nothing to do with what kind of knowledge of a field is in our minds, how much of it is there, and how well it is organised.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
2. Which model is designed to provide students with a cognitive structure for comprehending material presented through lectures, readings and other media? (UGC NET 29 Nov Evening)
  • Inductive thinking
  • Mnemonics
  • Scientific inquiry
  • Advance organisers
Correct Answer: Advance organisers
3. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 27 Nov 2021) List I (Information Processing Model) a. Inductive thinking b. Mnemonics c. Advance Organisers d. Synetics List II (Developer) i. Hilda Taba ii. Michael Pressley iii. Bill Gordon iv. David Ausubel
  • a‐ iii , b‐ i , c‐ ii , d‐ iv
  • a‐ i , b‐ ii , c‐ iv , d‐ iii
  • a‐ ii , b‐ iv , c‐ iii , d‐ i
  • a‐ iv , b‐ iii , c‐ i , d‐ ii
Correct Answer: a‐ i , b‐ ii , c‐ iv , d‐ iii
1. Which of the following are important in intercultural communication? (UGC NET 26th Dec 2021 Morning paper) A. Valuelessness B. Absence of respect C. Power distance D. Individualism E. Gender roles
  • C, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and E only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: C, D and E only
2. From the communication viewpoint which one of the following is a cultural institution ? (UGC NET 03rd Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Trade organizations
  • Political parties
  • Family
  • Military alliances
Correct Answer: Family
3. Assertion ‘A’: No enculturation takes place with resistance. (UGC NET 25th June 2020 Morning paper) Reason ‘R’: People have their own values and self–interest that filter communicated messages.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
  • A is correct but R is incorrect
  • A is incorrect, but R is correct
Correct Answer: A is incorrect, but R is correct
1. A teacher assumes a counselor-like role, guiding students to take control of their own education. How does the non-directive teaching model contribute to students' intellectual development?
  • By enforcing strict academic rules
  • By fostering a collaborative partnership
  • By promoting rote memorization
  • By minimizing student independence
Correct Answer: By fostering a collaborative partnership
2. The "Enhancing Self-esteem" model emphasizes the harmony between personal, social, and academic goals. How does this holistic approach impact students' overall development?
  • By limiting growth to academic achievements
  • By encouraging isolation from social aspects
  • By meeting diverse needs for self-esteem, self-awareness, and peer respect
  • By neglecting the importance of self-perception
Correct Answer: By meeting diverse needs for self-esteem, self-awareness, and peer respect
3. A non-directive teaching model emphasizes fostering a partnership between students and teachers. How does this model differ from traditional teacher-centered approaches in terms of student autonomy?
  • It encourages complete teacher control
  • It limits student independence
  • It allows for substantial student self-direction
  • It disregards collaborative efforts
Correct Answer: It allows for substantial student self-direction
1. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 27 Nov Morning 2021) List I (Behavioral Model) a. Mastery learning b. Direct Instruction c. Simulation d. Social learning List II (Developer)  i. Albert Bandura ii. Tom Good iii. Benjamin Bloom iv. Carl Smith
  • a‐ iii , b‐ ii , c‐ iv , d‐ i
  • a‐ ii , b‐ iv , c‐ i , d‐ iii
  • a‐ iv , b‐ i , c‐ iii , d‐ ii
  • a‐ i , b‐ iii , c‐ ii , d‐ iv
Correct Answer: a‐ iii , b‐ ii , c‐ iv , d‐ i
2. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 22 Mar 2023 Morning) LIST I (Behavioural Models)  A. Mastery learning B. Simulation C. Social learning D. Programmed schedule (task performance reinforcement) LIST II (Developers / Redevelopers)  I. Carl Smith/Mary Smith II. Benjamin Bloom/James Black   III. B.F. Skinner   IV. Albert Bandura/Carl Thoresen/Wes Becker
  • A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
  • A-II, B-I, C-IV, D-III
  • A-II, B-IV, C-I, D-III
  • A-IV, B-I, C-III, D-II
Correct Answer: A-II, B-I, C-IV, D-III
3. Direct instruction is most suited when teachers: (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • teach basic skills
  • have their students explore pathways to solve a mathematics problems
  • encourage their students to refine their creativity in art
  • assign critical thinking exercises
Correct Answer: teach basic skills
4. Direct instruction strategies are indispensable for achieving content mastery, and over learning facts, rules and action sequences. Identify the correct sequence for the direct instructional sequence for learning mastery: (UGC NET 24 Dec Morning 2021) a. Monitor and diagnose progress. b. Teach/ re-teach. c. Provide feedback. d. Present new content. e. practice
  • b, e, a, c, d
  • d, b, e, a, c
  • a, d, e, c, b
  • c, e, b, d, a
Correct Answer: a, d, e, c, b
1. In which of the following, the direction of influence is mainly one way: (UGC NET 17 Oct 2020 Morning paper)
  • Counselling
  • Guiding
  • Teaching
  • Learning
Correct Answer: Learning
2. Which of the following need to be inculcated for developing 21st century skills of students by a teacher? (UGC NET 20 Oct 2022 Morning) a. Creativity b. Rote-learning c. Critical thinking d. Life-long learning e. Learning only for examination.
  • a and c only
  • b and e only
  • a, c and d only
  • a, c and e only
Correct Answer: a, c and d only
3. Learning objectives mean: (UGC NET 25 June 2020 Evening)
  • Learning experience
  • Concise outcomes
  • Academic achievement
  • Intended learning outcomes
Correct Answer: Intended learning outcomes
4. Which of the following will not have direct effect on learner’s learning?
  • Academic and personal needs of the learner
  • Level of Anxiety
  • Learner’s level of previous knowledge
  • None of the above
Correct Answer: None of the above
5. For an efficient and durable learning, learner should have:
  • Desired level of ability and motivation.
  • Opportunities to learn only.
  • Ability to learn only.
  • Requisite level of motivation only
Correct Answer: Desired level of ability and motivation.
6. The most appropriate meaning of learning is:
  • Acquisition of skills
  • Modification of behaviour
  • Personal adjustment
  • Inculcation of knowledge
Correct Answer: Modification of behaviour
1. Which of the following is not the characteristics of learning? (UGC NET 16 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Change in behaviour is relatively enduring.
  • Learning does not necessarily imply improvement.
  • Learning involves reconstruction of experiences.
  • Learning necessarily implies development in right direction.
Correct Answer: Learning necessarily implies development in right direction.
2. Which of the following are the characteristics of learning? (UGC NET 13 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Learning is temporary change in behaviour.  B. Learning ends upto puberty.  C. Learning is active and creative.  D. Learning is goal-directed.  E. Learning is motivated by adjustment.
  • C, D and E only
  • A, C and E only
  • B and D only
  • A, B, C and E only
Correct Answer: C, D and E only
3. Which of the following is outside the purview of characteristics of learning? (UGC NET 01 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Learning is a life-long process.
  • Learning is a temporary change in behaviour.
  • Learning is prompted by individual needs.
  • Learning is transferable.
Correct Answer: Learning is a temporary change in behaviour.
4. Match the following: List I (a) Learning by observation (b) Learning by imitation (c) Learning by Trial and Error (d) Learning by insight List II (i) The learning perceives the situation in its totality. (ii) The number of unsuccessful attempts reduced through practice and successful attempts got strengthened. (iii) tendency to replicate the observed actions of others. (iv) the act of perceiving the stimulus.
  • a - (i) b - (ii) c - (iii) d - (iv)
  • a - (iv) b - (iii) c - (ii) d - (i)
  • a - (iii) b - (iv) c - (ii) d - (i)
  • a - (iv) b - (iii) c - (i) d - (ii)
Correct Answer: a - (iv) b - (iii) c - (ii) d - (i)
5. Assertion “A”: Learning is a lifelong process. Reason “R”: Learning to be useful must be linked with life processes.
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is true, but R is false.
  • A is false, but R is true.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
1. Which one of the following developmental areas of individual differences will be affected, if a child does not want to play with other children as he/she feels shy? (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Physical development
  • Emotional development
  • Social development
  • Language development
Correct Answer: Social development
2. Which of the following Developmental areas of individual differences will be effected, if a Child opts for frequent out bursts and throws tantrums? (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Social
  • Mental
  • Emotional
  • Physical
Correct Answer: Emotional
3. Which of the following statements explains the concepts of inclusive teaching? (UGC NET 24 June 2019 Morning)
  • Teacher facilitates the learning of the gifted students.
  • Teacher facilitates the learning of the weak students.
  • Teacher takes support of parents of the students to make them learn.
  • Teacher makes the students of different backgrounds to learn together in the same class.
Correct Answer: Teacher makes the students of different backgrounds to learn together in the same class.
Dimensions of Learning include: (a) Attitudes and Perceptions. (b) Acquire and Integrate Knowledge. (c) Extend and Refine Knowledge. (d) Use Knowledge Meaningfully. (e) Habits of Mind.
  • (a) and (b) only
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (a), (b), (c), (d)
  • (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)
1. What are the learning styles according to Fleming's VARK model of learning? (UGC NET 24 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Verbal, Auxiliary, Kinesthetic, Rehearsal
  • Visual, Auditory, Reading/writing, Kinesthetic
  • Verbal, Augmentative, Retrospective, Kinetic
  • Visual, Augmentary, Reading, Kinetic
Correct Answer: Visual, Auditory, Reading/writing, Kinesthetic
2. Which of the following types of learners learn with the help of flow charts or diagrams? (UGC NET 12 July 2022 Morning)
  • Tactile
  • Visual
  • Auditory
  • Rote
Correct Answer: Visual
3. Identify the characteristics of ‘Field‐independent learner’: (UGC NET 21 Nov Evening 2021) a. Seeks guidance and demonstrations from teacher. b. Focuses on details of curriculum materials. c. Likes to compete. d. Relates concepts to personal experience. e. Can organize information by himself or herself.
  • a, b and c only
  • a, c and d only
  • b, c and e only
  • c, d and e only
Correct Answer: b, c and e only
4. Identify the characteristics of field-dependent learners from the following? (UGC NET 21 Nov Morning 2021) a. Perceives global aspects of concepts and materials. b. Focuses on facts and principles. c. Prefers to work alone. d. Seeks guidance and demonstration from teacher. e. Likes to cooperate.
  • a, b and c only
  • a, d and e only
  • b, c and d only
  • c, d and e only
Correct Answer: a, d and e only
5. From the following list of learner characteristics, identify those which are associated with 'field independent' learners. (UGC NET 24 Sept 2020 Evening) A. Focuses on facts and principles B. Perceives global aspects of concepts and materials C. Prefers and likes to compete D. Can organize information by himself/herself E. Likes to cooperate
  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
6. What are the characteristics of field-dependent learners?  (UGC NET 13 Nov 2020 Evening) a. Personalizes curriculum b. Rarely seeks physical contact with the teacher c. Seeks guidance and demonstrations from teachers d. Likes to cooperate e. Prefers to work alone
  • Only a, b and c
  • Only b, c and d
  • Only a, c and d
  • Only c, d and e
Correct Answer: Only a, c and d
1. Which of the following are the intellectual development characteristics of Adolescents? (UGC NET 14 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Imagination B. Abstract emotions C. Thinking and reasoning D. Span of attention
  • B, C and D only
  • B and D only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, B and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 13 Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: Adolescence period is the transitional period of growth and development between childhood and adulthood. Statement II: Adolescence is a period of emotional stability and great relief.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
3. Which of the following are the Intellectual characteristics of Adolescents? (UGC NET 13 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Variations in emotional moods.  B. Development of imagination.  C. Increase in span of attention.  D. Increase in pulse rate.  E. Development of thinking and reasoning.
  • A and D only
  • A, B, C and D only
  • B, C and E only
  • A, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only
4. Which of the following is usually NOT a characteristic of Adult learner? (UGC NET 21 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Self-learning
  • Rote learning
  • Time flexibility for learning
  • Social learning
Correct Answer: Rote learning
5. Which of the following are the characteristics of an adolescent? (UGC NET 24 Nov Evening 2021) a. Increasing independence from adult control. b. Rapid physiological changes. c. Emotionally matured. d. Acts rationally. e. Increased focus on activities with peer groups.
  • a, b and c only
  • b, c and d only
  • c, d and e only
  • a, b and e only
Correct Answer: a, b and e only
6. Which of the following are NOT the characteristics of adult learners? (UGC NET 05 Jan 2022 Morning) a. They are matured learners. b. They can act rationally. c. They search for a reasonably stable identity. d. They can make balanced choice. e. Often question contemporary values.
  • a and b only
  • a and d only
  • c and e only
  • c and d only
Correct Answer: c and e only
7. Which of the following are the characteristics of adult learners? (UGC NET 04 Dec 2021 Morning) a. Physiological growth. b. Increased focus of activities with peer group. c. Exercise self-control. d. Ability to act rationally. e. Learning to be independent of guidance and control.
  • a and b only
  • b and c only
  • c and d only
  • c, d and e only
Correct Answer: c and d only
1. Given below are two statements (UGC NET 1st Oct 2020 Evening paper) Statement I: Cross communication promotes teamwork in the classroom Statement II: Exactness of communication in a cross-cultural setting is flexible and responsive.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is false
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is true
2. Which one of the following is important, in cross-cultural communication in a classroom? (UGC NET 21st Oct 2022 Evening shift)
  • Self approval propositions
  • Dignified humour
  • Diversionary tactics
  • Use of strong language
Correct Answer: Dignified humour
1. According to Bloom's taxonomy of educational objectives, which of the following are the categories of cognitive domain? (UGC NET 13 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Receiving B. Valuing C. Application D. Knowledge E. Organisation
  • C and D only
  • A, B, D and E only
  • C and E only
  • A, B and C only
Correct Answer: C and D only
2. In Bloom's taxonomy of learning objectives, which of the following categories come under affective domain? (UGC NET 13 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Receiving B. Responding C. Analysis D. Organization E. Application
  • B, C and E only
  • A and D only
  • A, B and D only
  • A, B, C and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only
3. Arrange the given objectives for cognitive domain in hierarchical order as the basis of the complexity of the task: (UGC NET 27 Nov Evening 2021) a. Application b. Evaluation c. Knowledge d. Analysis e. Synthesis
  • a, e, b, d, c
  • b, d, c, e, a
  • c, a, d, e, b
  • d, b, c, a, e
Correct Answer: c, a, d, e, b
4. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 21 Nov 2021 Morning) Statement I: Knowledge, comprehension and application levels in Bloom's taxonomy belong to the higher level of cognitive learning. Statement II: Organization and characterization belong to higher level of affective outcomes.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
5. Which of the following is not a part of “cognitive domain” of ‘Bloom’s Taxonomy of Learning’?
  • Application
  • Analysis
  • Precision
  • Evaluation
Correct Answer: Precision
1. A learner learns to bake a cake in school. He/she applies the knowledge to bake the cake at home. It is a type of _______ of learning. (UGC NET 13 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Horizontal transfer
  • Vertical transfer
  • Zero transfer
  • Negative transfer
Correct Answer: Horizontal transfer
2. Identify the incorrect statement about the concept of ‘transfer of learning’ from the following statements:
  • Transfer of learning comes from similarity of contents, similarity of techniques, similarity of principles, or a combination of these.
  • Transfer of learning can also be viewed as problem solving, in which experience in one task influences the performance of another.
  • The notion of Transfer of Learning was originally introduced as transfer of practice by Edward Thorndike and Robert S. Woodworth.
  • None of the above
Correct Answer: None of the above
1. Arrange these instructional events for delivering the lesson to students in sequential order from the beginning to the end. (UGC NET 25 Nov 2021 Morning) a. Informing the learner of the objectives. b. Eliciting desired behaviour. c. Gaining attention. d. Presenting the content. e. Providing feedback.
  • a, d, b, c, e
  • d, c, b, a, e
  • c, a, d, b, e
  • b, c, a, e, d
Correct Answer: c, a, d, b, e
2. Identify the instructional events which form part of the structure of a lesson plan.(UGC NET 21 June 2019 Morning) i. Gaining attention of students. ii. Prior knowledge of students. iii. Informing the learner of the objectives. iv. Stimulating recall of pre-requisite learning. v. Checking the availability of reading material in the library. vi. Eliciting the desired response.
  • i, ii, iii, iv
  • i, iii, iv, vi
  • ii, iii, v, vi
  • i, iii, iv, v
Correct Answer: i, iii, iv, vi
3. Which will be the correct hierarchical sequencing for the following types of learning? (UGC NET 9 Oct 2020 Morning) (i) Discrimination learning (ii) Sign learning (iii) Concept learning (iv) Problem solving learning (v) Rule learning
  • (ii), (i), (iii), (v) and (iv)
  • (i), (ii), (v), (iv) and (iii)
  • (iv), (iii), (ii), (i) and (v)
  • (iii), (iv), (v), (i) and (ii)
Correct Answer: (ii), (i), (iii), (v) and (iv)
4. In Gagne’s Learning hierarchy, which of the learning types immediately precedes’ Concept learning? (UGC NET 11 Nov 2020 Morning)
  • Signal learning
  • S-R learning
  • Chain learning
  • Discrimination learning
Correct Answer: Discrimination learning
5. Who had given Nine Levels of Learning model to trainers and educators to use it as a checklist before they engage in teaching or training activities:
  • Robert Gagne
  • Lev Vygotsky
  • Dr. Benjamin Blooms
  • Edward Thorndike
Correct Answer: Robert Gagne
6. How many varieties of learning are identified by Robert Gagne?
  • Three
  • Four
  • Five
  • Two
Correct Answer: Five
1. Due to which of the following disabilities, learners have difficulty in understanding concept of quantity and fractions? (UGC NET 21 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Dyslexia
  • Dyspraxia
  • Dysgraphia
  • Dyscalculia
Correct Answer: Dyscalculia
2. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 22 Oct 2022 Morning) List I (Learning Disabilities)     a. Dyscalculia b. Dyslexia c. Dysgraphia d. Dyspraxia     List II (Symptoms in learners) (i) Difficulty in reading and writing words. (ii) Difficulty in writing correct spellings. (iii) Difficulty in holding objects. (iv) Trouble in counting.
  • a- iv, b- ii, c- iii, d- i
  • a- ii, b- iv, c- i, d- iii
  • a- iii, b- i, c- ii, d- iv
  • a- iv, b- i, c- ii, d- iii
Correct Answer: a- iv, b- i, c- ii, d- iii
3. Dyslexia is associated with: (UGC NET 23 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Writing disorder
  • Reading text disorder
  • Interpreting graphics disorder
  • Mental disorder
Correct Answer: Reading text disorder
4. Match correctly the items of Column I with the Column II (UGC NET 5 Dec 2019 Evening) Column I (a) Dyslexia (b) Dysgraphia (c) Dyscalculia (d) ADHD Column II  (i) Difficulty in doing mathematics (ii) Difficulty in reading (iii) Difficulty in writing (iv) Difficulty in concentrating
  • (a)-(i), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
  • (a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i), (d)-(iv)
  • (a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii), (d)-(ii)
  • (a)-(i), (b)-(iv), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i), (d)-(iv)
5. Dyslexia is associated with
  • Mental disorder
  • Behavioural disorder
  • Reading disorder
  • Writing disorder
Correct Answer: Reading disorder
1. What higher - order knowledge can make the difference between how well and quickly one's students learn material? (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Declarative
  • Rote
  • Meta cognition
  • Procedural
Correct Answer: Meta cognition
2. Metacognition comprises which of the following skills? (UGC NET 26 Dec 2021 Morning) a. Planning b. Developing c. Monitoring d. Costing e. Evaluation
  • a, b and c only
  • a, c and e only
  • b, d and e only
  • a, d and e only
Correct Answer: a, c and e only
3. What is the name of the mental process that assists learners to reflect on their thinking any internalizing, understanding, and recalling the contact to be learned? (UGC NET 03 Dec 2021 Evening)
  • Meta cognition
  • Rubrics
  • Peer tutoring
  • Debriefing
Correct Answer: Meta cognition
4. The field of study concerned with the construction of thought processes, including remembering, problem solving and decision-making is called: (UGC NET 24 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Cognitive development
  • Pedagogy
  • Epistemology
  • Connectivism
Correct Answer: Cognitive development
1. The sequence of elements in a classroom speech is: (UGC NET 5th Jan 2022 Evening paper) A. Introduction B. Description C. Feedback D. Clarification E. Conclusion
  • A, B, C, D, E
  • B, A, C, E, D
  • A, B, E, C, D
  • C, D, A, B, E
Correct Answer: A, B, E, C, D
2. Which of the following elements are needed for the completion of classroom communication? (UGC NET 11th July 2022 Morning shift) A. Source B. Noise C. Content D. Receiver E. Feedback
  • A, C, D, E
  • A, B, C
  • B, C, D, E
  • B, C, D
Correct Answer: A, C, D, E
3. Which of the following will make a student a good listener in the classroom? (UGC NET 25th Sept 2020 Evening) A. Ability to deflect attention B. Concentration C. Desire to understand D. Emotional outbursts E. Humility to know F. Ignoring the other side
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and E only
  • D, E and F only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only
4. Communication skills of students can be improved by (UGC NET 12th Nov 2020 Morning) a. Asking general questions b. Exposure to new technology c. Fostering critical thinking d. Discriminant use of vocabulary e. Limited listening
  • c, d and e
  • a, b and c
  • a, d and e
  • b, c and d
Correct Answer: b, c and d
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 27 Nov 2021 Evening) Statement I: Working memory has a development trajectory‐ it increases throughout childhood, and it decreases on ageing. Statement II: Working memory does not get adversely affected by ongoing stresses.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
2. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 28 Nov 2021 Evening) List I (Neural system of Brain) a. Conscious b. Unconscious c. Motor skills d. Own experiences List II (Type of Memory) i. Implicit Memory ii. Procedural Memory iii. Explicit Memory iv. Episodic Memory
  • a‐ iv, b‐ iii, c‐ i, d‐ ii
  • a‐ iii, b‐ i, c‐ ii, d‐ iv
  • a‐ i, b‐ ii, c‐ iv, d‐ iii
  • a‐ ii, b‐ iv, c‐ iii, d‐ i
Correct Answer: a‐ iii, b‐ i, c‐ ii, d‐ iv
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 04 Jan 2022 Evening) Statement I: Short‐term memory encompasses encoding and short‐term storage and manipulation. Statement II: Short‐term memory has a limited capacity.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
4. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Morning) List I (Factors of memory) a. Remembering b. Retention c. Recall d. Recognition List II (Meaning) (i) The mental revival of the experiences which have been learnt. (ii) The manifestation of our general retaining power. (iii) The factor responsible for preserving the material learnt. (iv) The factor responsible for modification of behaviour through training and learning.
  • a- iii, b- i, c- iv, d- ii
  • a- iv, b- i, c- ii, d- iii
  • a- iv, b- iii, c- i, d- ii
  • a- i, b- iv, c- ii, d- iii
Correct Answer: a- iv, b- iii, c- i, d- ii
1. Which period of learning shows no improvement in learning curve? (UGC NET 02 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Irregular progress
  • Spurts
  • Plateau
  • Initial Stage
Correct Answer: Plateau
2. Which of the following are the causes of plateau associated with learning curve? (UGC NET 11 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Lack of balance among various phases of a complex skill B. Shifting of attention from one phase of performance to another C. Fatigue and boredom D. Positive interest and incentive
  • A, B and C only
  • A and D only
  • B, C and D
  • A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 15 Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: Plateau is a period of no improvement in learning curve.  Statement II: In Plateau, the rate of learning first increases then decreases.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
1. By which of the following means can a teacher establish a good rapport with his/her students? (UGC NET 20 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Showing authority in class.
  • Impressing students by his/her knowledge and skill.
  • Playing the role of a guide/facilitator with a desire to help them.
  • Becoming a friend to the students
Correct Answer: Playing the role of a guide/facilitator with a desire to help them.
2. In which of the following, the direction of influence is mainly one way: (UGC NET 17 Oct 2020 Morning)
  • Counselling
  • Guiding
  • Teaching
  • Learning
Correct Answer: Learning
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 4 Nov 2020 Evening) Assertion A: Teaching-learning systems to be effective must be carefully planned, adequately implemented and appropriately evaluated. Reason R: Effectiveness of teacher-learning systems is a pre-requisite for all levels of education.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
  • A is correct but R is not correct
  • A is not correct but R is correct
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
4. Which of the following statements describe the most critical features of effectiveness of teaching? (UGC NET 13 Nov 2020 Evening) a) To be effective in teaching requires the orchestration and integration of key and helping behaviour. b) Teaching means training the mind of students. c) Effective teachers function as able facilitators and guides for student's knowledge building process. d) Teaching is basically informing the students. e) Through effective teaching students can be taught to become agents of their own learning.
  • Only a, b and c
  • Only a, c and e
  • Only b, c and d
  • Only c, d and e
Correct Answer: Only a, c and e
1. Which of the following statements differentiate teaching from learning? (UGC NET 4 Dec 2019 Morning) (a) Teaching is a social act while learning is a personal act (b) Teaching implies learning (c) Teaching is like selling while learning is like buying (d) Teaching can occur without learning taking place (e) In teaching, influence is directed towards learning and learner, while in learning it is usually towards oneself.
  • (a), (c) and (e)
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (c), (d) and (e)
Correct Answer: (a), (c) and (e)
2. Which of the following set of statements represents acceptable propositions in respect of teaching-learning relationships?  (i) When students fail in a test, it is the teacher who fails. (ii) Every teaching must aim at ensuring learning. (iii) There can be teaching without learning taking place. (iv) There can be no learning without teaching. (v) A teacher teaches but learns also. (vi) Real learning implies rote learning.
  • (ii), (iii), (iv) and (v)
  • (i), (ii), (iii) and (v)
  • (iii), (iv), (v) and (vi)
  • (i), (ii), (v) and (vi)
Correct Answer: (i), (ii), (iii) and (v)
3. Which of the following set of statements best represents the nature and objective of teaching and learning? (a) Teaching is like selling and learning is like buying. (b) Teaching is a social act while learning is a personal act. (c) Teaching implies learning whereas learning does not imply teaching. (d) Teaching is a kind of delivery of knowledge while learning is like receiving it. (e) Teaching is an interaction and is triadic in nature whereas learning is an active engagement in a subject domain.
  • (a), (d) and (e)
  • (b), (c) and (e)
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (a), (b) and (d)
Correct Answer: (b), (c) and (e)
1. Akshay, an eight-year old boy, was emotionally stable and performed well in school. His parents have divorced recently. Due to this, he has become a very anxious child. What can Akshay's teacher do to help alleviate his anxiety in the classroom ? (UGC NET 6 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • His teacher could provide structure, organizational tools and choices.
  • His teacher could respect Akshay's emotional state and leave him alone.
  • His teacher could provide Akshay with counselling regarding his anxiety.
  • His teacher could tell the other children that Akshay is anxious, and that they must be extra nice to him.
Correct Answer: His teacher could provide structure, organizational tools and choices.
2. Listening is important for a teacher to: (UGC NET 24 June 2019 Evening)
  • Address the requirement of the learner.
  • Gain knowledge.
  • Keep the learner in good humour.
  • Evaluate the learner for the progress made.
Correct Answer: Address the requirement of the learner.
3. Given below are two statements – one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R. (UGC NET 6 Dec 2019 Evening) Assertion A: Pedagogy and social interaction are two major result-oriented activities of a teacher. Reason R: Communication has a limited role in both these activities.
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are true and R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is true, but R is false.
  • A is false, but R is true.
Correct Answer: A is true, but R is false.
4. Identify the factors that do not contribute to the effectiveness of teaching from the options given below: (UGC NET 4 Dec 2019 Evening) (a) Socio- economic background of Teacher. (b) Teacher’s skill in pleasing the students. (c) Teacher’s subject knowledge. (d) Teacher’s personal contact with students .
  • (a), (c) and (d)
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (a), (b) and (d)
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (d)
5. Which of the following is the key teaching behaviour to make a teacher effective? (UGC NET 2 Dec 2019 Morning)
  • Teachers’ comments made for the purpose of organizing upcoming teaching process.
  • Use of content or process questions by teacher.
  • Engagement of students in the learning process.
  • Using students’ ideas and contributions.
Correct Answer: Engagement of students in the learning process.
6. Which of the following are hindering factors in effective teaching? Select from the code to give you answer. (a) Teacher’s self-efficacy. (b) Teacher’s subject knowledge. (c) Low ability and willingness level of teacher. (d) Lack of planning and teaching skills in a teacher. (e) Teacher’s mastery of linguistic skills. (f) Inappropriate body language of the teacher.
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (c), (d) and (f)
  • (a), (c) and (f)
  • (a), (e) and (c)
Correct Answer: (c), (d) and (f)
7. Which of the learner characteristics will influence his/her perspective in a course of study? (UGC NET 26 June 2019 Morning) (i) Learner’s commitment. (ii) Parents interest in the learner. (iii) Prior knowledge of the learner. (iv) Skill of the learner in the concerned area. (v) Family size of the learner. (vi) Socio-economic background of the family to which the learner belongs.
  • (i), (iii) and (iv)
  • (i), (ii) and (iii)
  • (iii), (iv) and (v)
  • (iv), (v) and (vi)
Correct Answer: (i), (iii) and (iv)
1. The key behavior of an effective teacher is marked by which of the following features? (UGC NET 20 Nov Evening 2021) a. Structuring b. Teacher task orientation c. Instructional Variety d. Lesson clarity e. Probing
  • a, b and c only
  • a, c and d only
  • b, c and d only
  • c, d and e only
Correct Answer: b, c and d only
2. Which of the following is designated a key behaviour of effectiveness of teaching as evident from researches? (UGC NET 22 Nov 2021 Morning)
  • Using student ideas and contribution
  • Structuring
  • Teacher task-orientation
  • Teacher affect
Correct Answer: Teacher task-orientation
3. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 03 Dec 2021 Morning ) List I (Helping behaviour of effective teaching) a. Using student ideas of contributions. b. Structuring c. Probing d. Teacher affect List II (Description) i. Warm and nurturing relationship with learners. ii. Teacher statements to encourage students to elaborate on an answer. iii. Teacher comments for the purpose of organizing what is to come. iv. Taking a student's response and repeating or applying it.
  • a- iv, b- iii, c- ii, d- i
  • a‐ i, b‐ ii, c‐ iii, d‐ iv
  • a‐ ii, b‐ i, c‐ iv, d‐ iii
  • a‐ iii, b‐ iv, c‐ i, d‐ ii
Correct Answer: a- iv, b- iii, c- ii, d- i
4. From the following, identify those characteristics which go within the category ‘helping behaviour’ for becoming an effective teacher: (UGC NET 4 Nov 2020 Morning) A. Structuring B. Student success rate C. Using student ideas D. Probing E. Instructional variety
  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
5. Which of the following have been identified as key behaviours contributing to effective teaching? (UGC NET 17 Oct 2020 Morning)  I. Lesson clarity II. Instructional variety III. Using student’s ideas and contribution IV. Engagement in learning processes V. Structuring
  • I, II and IV only
  • I, II and III only
  • II, III and IV only
  • III, IV and V only
Correct Answer: I, II and IV only
6. For effective teaching which of the following is a key behaviour? (UGC NET 13 Nov 2020 Morning)
  • Encouraging students to elaborate their own answer or that of other students.
  • Summarizing what was told by a student.
