  • Teacher gives comments for the purpose of organizing what is to come.
  • Making ideas clear to learners who may be at different level of understanding.
Correct Answer: Making ideas clear to learners who may be at different level of understanding.
1. Which of the following make classroom communication interesting? (UGC NET 04th Mar 2023 Morning) A. Many asides while speaking B. Fruitful discussions C. Use of relevant transitions D. Finding out the correct context E. Pressurising the students with authoritarian commands.
  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, D and E onl
  • C, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only
2. To be effective, classroom communication must be (UGC NET 23rd Mar 2023 Evening) A. Top down B. Analytical C. Unresponsive D. Adjustable E. Progressive
  • A, B and C only
  • B, C and D only
  • C, D and E only
  • B, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, D and E only
3. What are the relevant strategies of effective communication in a classroom? (UGC NET 03rd Mar 2023 Evening) A. Understanding the cultural background of students B. Clarity in speech C. Focused listening on both sides - teacher and students D. Inventing cultural labels E. Disdain for collective efforts
  • D, E and A only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only
4.  Given below are the statements: (UGC NET 29th Oct 2022 Morning shift) Assertion A: Teachers must encourage students to ask questions. Reason R: Asking questions can create curiosity and develop passion for learning.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
  • A is not correct but R is correct
  • Both A and R are correct and R is not the correct explanation of A
  • A is correct but R is not correct
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
1. In the context of curriculum, which of the following are correct? (UGC NET 08 Oct 2022 Evening) a. Curriculum should be Modified regularly. b. Curriculum should have theoretical concepts only. c. Curriculum should be derived from constitutional imperatives of the country. d. Curriculum should be made as per needs of industry & society. e. Curriculum should be teacher-centric.
  • a, d and e only
  • c and d only
  • a, c and d only
  • a, b, c and d
Correct Answer: a, c and d only
2. For building a professional environment of an Educational institution: (UGC NET 09 July 2022 Evening) a. A teacher must ask his/her students about other teacher's teaching methodology. b. A teacher must feel envious about other teacher's professional achievements. c. Teachers must work as a team. d. A senior teacher must encourage junior teacher to contribute in research and other academic activities for the institution.
  • a and d only
  • b and c only
  • c and d only
  • a, c and d only
Correct Answer: c and d only
3. Why should a student not be punished severely? (UGC NET 20 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • He/she may leave the institution and join another.
  • He/she may quarrel with the teacher.
  • Parents of students may complain about the teacher.
  • The student may develop a negative attitude towards his/her studies, teachers and institution.
Correct Answer: The student may develop a negative attitude towards his/her studies, teachers and institution.
4. What is true about non-formal learning environment? (UGC NET 05 Dec 2021 Morning) a. Learning does not take place in a structured way. b. Does not aim at certification. c. Learning takes place in a structured manner. d. Takes place outside formal educational structure. e. Intends to achieve pre-determined educational objectives.
  • c and d only
  • d and e only
  • a and b only
  • b and c only
Correct Answer: d and e only
5. For optimising learning outcomes which of the following factors have been identified as most effective in terms of research evidences in the global context? (UGC NET 17 Oct 2020 Evening)
  • Home related factors
  • School related factors
  • Teacher related factors
  • Supplementary technological devices related factors
Correct Answer: Teacher related factors
6. Which of the following potential factors affecting teaching are related to instructional facilities and learning environment? (UGC NET 12 Nov 2020 Morning) i. Praise and encouragement by teachers. ii. Non-availability of textbooks/reading materials for use. iii. Proactive moves in the interactive processes. iv. Shortage of highly qualified teachers. v. Availability of smart classes.
  • i, ii and iii
  • ii, iii and v
  • i, iv and v
  • iii, iv and v
Correct Answer: ii, iii and v
Below are listed some learners’ characteristics. Identify those that help in effective teaching. (UGC NET 21 June 2019 Evening) (a) Learners’ respect for teacher (b) Learners’ level of mental ability (c) Learners’ previous experience (d) Learners’ level of interest to study (e) Learners’ level of interpersonal relation (f) Learners’ view about the society
  • (a), (b), (c) and (f)
  • (c), (d), (e) and (f)
  • (a), (b), (c) and (d)
  • (b), (c), (d) and (f)
Correct Answer: (b), (c), (d) and (f)
1. Which of the following does not come under primary laws of learning ? (UGC NET 22 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Law of effect
  • Law of Readiness
  • Law of Multiple response
  • Law of exercise
Correct Answer: Law of Multiple response
2. Which of the following are the primary laws of learning? (UGC NET 15 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Law of exercise B. Law of partial activity C. Law of readiness D. Law of associative shifting E. Law of effect
  • A, B and D only
  • A, C and E only
  • B, D and E only
  • A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and E only
3. The theory of learning associated with connectionism was propounded by:
  • Thorndike
  • Socrates
  • Kilpatrick
  • Pavlov
Correct Answer: Thorndike
1. The stimulus which does not require any conditioning for desired behaviour is called as (UGC NET 28 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Unconditional stimulus
  • Conditioned stimulus
  • Unconditioned response
  • Conditioned response
Correct Answer: Unconditional stimulus
2. In learning, classical conditioning effects are an example of: (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Implicit Memory
  • Eidetic Memory
  • Retroactive Memory
  • Explicit Memory
Correct Answer: Implicit Memory
3. Find which of the following pair is incorrectly matched in reference to Pavlov’s Classical Conditioning Theory?
  • Unconditioned Response - The behaviour which does not require any training.
  • Conditioned Stimulus – Natural Stimulus.
  • Generalization - If behaviour occurs in presence of other stimulus similar to the conditioned one.
  • None of the above.
Correct Answer: Conditioned Stimulus – Natural Stimulus.
1. ____________ is a learning force which affects desired response more frequently by providing a reinforcing stimulus immediately following the response.
  • Operant Conditioning
  • Classical Conditioning
  • Stimulus Conditioning
  • None of the above
Correct Answer: Operant Conditioning
2. Given below are two statements (UGC NET 30 Sept 2020 Morning) Statement I: Programmed Instructional material uses active responding and immediate feedback as important principles for learning. Statement II: Skinner's reinforcement principle is the basis for the preparation of linear types of programmed instructional material.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
3. Match the two sets: (UGC NET 6 Dec 2019 Morning) Set I (Behaviour modification techniques) (a) Positive reinforcement (b) Negative reinforcement (c) Punishment (d) Extinction Set II (Example) (i) Withdrawal of pleasant stimulus or application of an aversive stimulus to stop the behaviour. (ii) Painful or aversive stimulus is presented to stop the occurrence of behaviour. (iii) The behaviour increases in frequency after the removal of the stimulus. (iv) The behaviour increases in frequency after the presentation of the stimulus.
  • (a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
  • (a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
  • (a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
  • (a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iv)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
4. _________ is a system of teaching-learning within which pre-established subject matter is broken down into small discrete steps which are carefully organised into a logical sequence and which can be rapidly learned by the students.
  • Discrete Instruction
  • Logical Instruction
  • Programmed Instruction
  • None of the above
Correct Answer: Programmed Instruction
1. Communication is a dynamic process across (UGC NET 23rd Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Inanimate phenomena
  • Varied situation
  • The meta universe
  • Specific populations only
Correct Answer: Varied situation
2, Which of the following are considered as more trustworthy than others in communication? (UGC NET 14th Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Sales Persons
  • Paid reviewers
  • Strangers
  • Friends
Correct Answer: Friends
3. Given below are two statements (UGC NET 12th July 2022- Evening shift) Statement I: Communication can facilitate truth. Statement II: Communication can also be used to obscure truth.
  • Statement I is true but II is false
  • Both Statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is false but II is true
  • Both Statement I and II are true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and II are true
4. Which of the following are true of communication? (UGC NET 10th Oct 2022 Morning Shift) A. Communication is inevitable B. Communication is non-social C. Communication is irreversible D. Communication is cultural E. Communication is completely commercial
  • B, C, E
  • A, B, C
  • A, D, E
  • A, C, D
Correct Answer: A, C, D
1. Identify the barriers to communication from the list given below : (UGC NET 20th  November 2021 Evening paper) A. Time and distance B. By‐passed instructions C. Encoding of thoughts and ideas D. Decoding of thoughts and ideas E. Logical sequence
  • D and E only
  • B and C only
  • C and D only
  • A and B only
Correct Answer: A and B only
2. In communication, a major barrier to reception of a message is: (UGC NET 27th December 2021 Morning paper)
  • Knowledge of listeners
  • Attitude of listeners
  • Income of listeners
  • Education of listeners
Correct Answer: Attitude of listeners
Which of the following is said to occur without reinforcement of particular responses and seems to involve changes in the ways information is processed? (UGC NET 02 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Passive learning
  • Latent learning
  • Active learning
  • Insight learning
Correct Answer: Latent learning
1. Which theory and theorist are associated with learning through observation? (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Behaviourist theory, Skinner
  • Constructivist theory, Piaget
  • Social cognitive theory, Bandura
  • Socio cultural theory, Vygotsky
Correct Answer: Social cognitive theory, Bandura
2. Which of the following processes are for observational learning proposed by Bandura? (UGC NET 06 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Attention B. Adaptation C. Retention (Memory) D. Behavioural rehearsal E. Motivation
  • A, C and D only
  • B, C and E only
  • A, B and D only
  • A, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, C, D and E only
3. Which of the following are the elements of observation learning (one of the outcomes of Bandura's Social Cognitive theory of learning)? (UGC NET 28 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Attention B. Retention C. Articulation D. Production E. Motivation
  • A, B and D only
  • C and E only
  • A, B, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B, D and E only
4. Arrange the steps of Social Learning theory as propounded by Albert Bandura and choose among the options of their correct sequence as given below. i Retention ii Attention iii Motivation iv Reproduction
  • i, ii, iii, iv
  • ii, i, iv, iii
  • iv, iii, ii, i
  • ii, iv, i, iii
Correct Answer: ii, i, iv, iii
1. Match List I with the List II: (UGC NET 01 Dec Morning 2021) List I (Piaget's Stages of Cognitive Development) a. Sensorimotor b. Preoperational c. Concrete operational d. Formal operational List II (Approximate age) i. Begins about the first grade to early adolescent, around 11 years old. ii. Adolescent to adulthood. iii. 0 ‐ 2 years iv. Begins about the time the child starts talking to about 7 years old.
  • a‐ iv, b‐ i, c‐ ii, d‐ iii
  • a‐ iv, b‐ i, c‐ iii, d‐ ii
  • a‐ i, b‐ ii, c‐ iii, d‐ iv
  • a‐ i, b‐ ii, c‐ iii, d‐ iv
Correct Answer: a‐ i, b‐ ii, c‐ iii, d‐ iv
2. Match List I with the List II: (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Evening) List I (Piaget's stages of cognitive Development) A. Sensorimotor B. Pre-operational C. Concrete operational D. Formal operational List II (Characteristics) I. Can think logically about concrete problems II. Learns through reflex senses and movements actions on the environment III. Can think hypothetically and deductively IV. Develops language and begins to use symbols to represent objects
  • A - II, B - I, C - IV, D - III
  • A - I, B - IV, C - II, D - III
  • A – III, B - II, C - IV, D - I
  • A - II, B - IV, C - I, D - III
Correct Answer: A - II, B - IV, C - I, D - III
3. According to Jean Piaget, there are ______ stages of cognitive development. (UGC NET 19 Dec 2018 Evening)
  • 2
  • 8
  • 6
  • 4
Correct Answer: 4
4. Which of the following are the components of Jean Piaget’s Cognitive Approach to Learning?
  • Assimilation, Accommodation, Restructuration and Generalization.
  • Differentiation, Generalization, Restructuration and Adaptation.
  • Differentiation, Accommodation, Equilibration and Adaptation.
  • Assimilation, Accommodation, Equilibration and Adaptation.
Correct Answer: Assimilation, Accommodation, Equilibration and Adaptation.
5. Match the following stages with their approximate age with reference to Jean Piaget’s Cognitive Approach to Learning? List I i. Proportional Stage ii. Sensory motor stage iii. Formal Operations Stage iv. Concrete operation Stage List II a From birth to the age 2. b Age 2 to 7 c Age 7 to 11 d Age 11 to 16
  • i- b, ii- a, iii- d, iv- c
  • i- a, ii- b, iii- c, iv- d
  • i- a, ii- c, iii- d, iv- b
  • i- c, ii- a, iii- d, iv- b
Correct Answer: i- b, ii- a, iii- d, iv- c
1. According to the theory of multiple intelligences, the ability to perceive the visual and spatial world accurately, pertains to which human ability? (UGC NET 24 Dec Evening 2021)
  • Naturalist
  • Interpersonal
  • Intrapersonal
  • Spatial
Correct Answer: Spatial
2. Who among the following proposed theory of Multiple Intelligences? (UGC NET 19 Dec 2018 Evening)
  • Sigmund Freud
  • Jean Piaget
  • Albert Einstein
  • Howard Gardner
Correct Answer: Howard Gardner
3. Who developed the theory of ‘Multiple Intelligence’? (UGC NET 24 June 2019 Morning)
  • Alfred Binet
  • L. Thurstone
  • Charles Spearman
  • Howard Gardner
Correct Answer: Howard Gardner
1. The theory Zone of Proximal Development was proposed by: (UGC NET 04 Jan 2022 Evening)
  • Piaget
  • Freud
  • Vygotsky
  • Bloom
Correct Answer: Vygotsky
2. Rahul was trying to solve some mathematics problems related to trigonometry. He tried many times but failed. His teacher helped him, which led him to follow right approach and he succeeded to solve these problems. This is an example of: (UGC NET 24 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Zone of the proximal development
  • Equilibrium
  • Assimilation
  • Schemas
Correct Answer: Zone of the proximal development
3. Jasmine in Chemistry practical class used a 5 ml pipette during her practical exam but the reading was not correct. When she got frustrated, her friend Ranjita guided her to hold the pipette correctly and drop chemical properly. Now, she succeeded and got desired results. This is an example of (UGC NET 28 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Accommodation
  • Equilibriums
  • Assimilation
  • Zone of Proximal Development
Correct Answer: Zone of Proximal Development
4. A child who feels it difficult to do a task alone, is able to do it better with the help of more skilled peers and adults. It is termed as: (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Accommodation
  • Zone of proximal development
  • Assimilation
  • Equilibrium
Correct Answer: Zone of proximal development
5. Which of the following is a technique to provide right kind of support in right amount at right time to increase child's competence? (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Scaffolding
  • Assistance
  • Accommodation
  • Schemas
Correct Answer: Scaffolding
6. _______ is the technique of changing the level of support over the course of a teaching session; more skilled person adjusts the amount of guidance to fit the students current performance. (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Scaffolding
  • Cognitive apprenticeship
  • Tutoring
  • Concept formation
Correct Answer: Scaffolding
Based on the theory of ‘Insight Learning’ as given by Wolfgang Kohler, identify which of the following statements is correct?
  • Learning and teaching should be in total and not in part.
  • The learner should be motivated by arousing the interest and curiosity to well acquaint with the specific aims and purposes of the learning process.
  • The teacher should adhere to inter-disciplinary approach in teaching.
  • All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above
1. Arrange the five Phases of "Constructivist Learning Approach" in a Sequence. (UGC NET 06 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Explore B. Elaborate C. Evaluate D. Explain E. Engage
  • A, B, E, D, C
  • D, A, B, E, C
  • C, D, A, E, B
  • E, A, D, B, C
Correct Answer: E, A, D, B, C
2. Identify from the following the correct sequence of three stages of intellectual development, as given by Bruner?
  • Enactive, Symbolic, Iconic
  • Iconic, Symbolic, Enactive
  • Enactive, Iconic, Symbolic
  • Symbolic, Iconic, Enactive
Correct Answer: Enactive, Iconic, Symbolic
1. Which of the following is an example of physical barrier to communication? (UGC NET 22nd November 2021 Evening paper)
  • Ill health
  • Verbalism
  • Inattention
  • Cultural disparity
Correct Answer: Ill health
According to Dewey, education is a: (UGC NET 09 July 2022 Morning)
  • Social need
  • Personal need
  • Status need
  • Financial need
Correct Answer: Social need
1. Which of the following ‘need strengths’ in Maslow’s hierarchy are related to higher order learning? (UGC NET 17 Oct 2020 Morning) i.  Physiological needs ii. Safety needs iii. Social needs iv. Esteem needs v. Needs for self actualisation
  • i and ii only
  • ii and iii only
  • iii and iv only
  • iv and v only
Correct Answer: iv and v only
2. For promoting competence and excellence in and through education, which of the needs of Maslow’s hierarchy has to be addressed? (UGC NET 19 Dec 2018 Morning)
  • Need for love and belongingness
  • Need for self esteem
  • Need for self-actualization
  • Safety needs
Correct Answer: Need for self-actualization
1. Match List I with the List II: (UGC NET 28 Nov Morning 2021) List I (Erik's stages of Psychosocial Development) a. Basic trust versus Basic mistrust b. Initiative versus Guilt c. Intimacy versus Isolation d. Ego integrity versus Despair List II (Approximate Age) i. Young adulthood ii. Late adulthood iii. 3-6 years iv. Birth to 12‐18 months
  • a‐ iv, b‐ iii, c‐ i, d‐ ii
  • a‐ iii, b‐ i, c‐ ii, d‐ iv
  • a‐ i, b‐ ii, c‐ iv, d‐ iii
  • a‐ ii, b‐ iv, c‐ iii, d‐ i
Correct Answer: a‐ iv, b‐ iii, c‐ i, d‐ ii
2. Match List I with List II: (UGC NET 01 Dec Evening 2021) List I (Erikson's Stages of Psychological Development) a. Basic trust versus basic mistrust b. Industry versus inferiority c. Intimacy versus isolation d. Generativity versus stagnation List II (Relevant Illustrations) i. Parenting/ mentoring ii. Love relationships iii. School iv. Feeding
  • a- i , b- ii, c- iii, d- iv
  • a- ii, b- i, c- iv, d- iii
  • a- iv, b- iii, c- ii, d- i
  • a- iii, b- iv, c- i, d- ii
Correct Answer: a- iv, b- iii, c- ii, d- i
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 06 Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: In adolescence period, foreclosure refers to commitment with going through the period of crises. Statement II: In adolescence period, moratorium is the period without going through the period of crisis.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
1. Which aspect indicates to be the most relevant in decision making process according to Kohlberg's theory of moral development? (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • The age of the Child
  • Knowledge of Law
  • Influence of friends and Siblings
  • How the child arrives at Conclusion
Correct Answer: How the child arrives at Conclusion
2. According to Kohlberg's theory the conventional level of moral development includes the following stages : (UGC NET 04 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Obedience orientation B. Being Nice/Relationships orientation C. Social contract orientation D. Law and Order orientation E. Universal Ethical Principles orientation.
  • A and E only
  • C and D only
  • B and D only
  • B, C and E only
Correct Answer: B and D only
1. While delivering a lecture, these is disturbance created by students in class. Which of the following measures should be taken by a teacher? (UGC NET 22 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Punish those causing disturbance
  • Ignore and continue
  • Leave the class and report to Head of the institution
  • Talk to the students causing disturbance and motivate them for learning
Correct Answer: Talk to the students causing disturbance and motivate them for learning
2.  A newly joined teacher was maltreated in his/her first class by some students. Which of the following measures should be taken by him/her? (UGC NET 23 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Give punishment to the students
  • Ignore the instance and improve his/her qualities for explaining the concept in better way
  • Change his/her time-table to teach some other class
  • Inform the head of the institution for expelling the students
Correct Answer: Ignore the instance and improve his/her qualities for explaining the concept in better way
3. "I never teach my pupils: I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn"-Albert Einstein. The above quote can be best fitted for which of the following models of teaching-learning? (UGC NET 23 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Learner Centered
  • Teacher centered
  • Parents Centered
  • Placement Centered
Correct Answer: Learner Centered
4. In student centred approach, a teacher: (UGC NET 04 Dec Morning 2021)
  • maximizes use of extrinsic rewards.
  • encourages students to take increased responsibility.
  • uses appropriate teaching-learning materials for effective teaching.
  • teacher tries to relate present with the past.
Correct Answer: encourages students to take increased responsibility.
5. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 04 Dec Evening 2021) Assertion ‘A’: A learner-centered approach provides best experience for learners. Reasons ‘R’: Learner-centered approach does not acknowledge the needs of the learner as central to learning experience.
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is true but R is false.
  • A is false but R is true.
Correct Answer: A is true but R is false.
1. Which of the following is a teacher-centered method? (UGC NET 08 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Problem solving
  • Discussion method
  • Inquiry approach
  • Demonstration method
Correct Answer: Demonstration method
2. Which of the following methods of teaching-learning is 'Teacher Centric'? (UGC NET 12 July 2022 Evening)
  • Chalk and Talk
  • Case-studies discussion
  • Activity based
  • Field work
Correct Answer: Chalk and Talk
3. Which of the following is outside the Teacher-Centric Method? (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Demonstration
  • Team teaching
  • Inquiry approach
  • Lecture method
Correct Answer: Inquiry approach
4. Which of the following statement best describes lecture method of teaching? (UGC NET 05 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Small step presentation with feedback provided
  • Content delivery in a lucid language
  • Production of large number of ideas
  • Theme based interaction among participants
Correct Answer: Content delivery in a lucid language
5. Which of the following are the characteristics of Teacher-centered classroom management? (UGC NET 05 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Discipline comes from self B. Teacher is the sole leader C. Students are facilitators for the operations of the classroom D. Students are allowed limited responsibilities.
  • A, B and C only
  • C and D only
  • B and D only
  • A, C and D only
Correct Answer: B and D only
1. Which of the following can be considered as personal barriers in communication? (UGC NET 21st Oct 2022 Morning shift) a. Regular message assessment b. Immediate feedback c. Poor retention d. Failure to respond e. Trust deficit in encoder
  • c, d, e
  • b, c, d
  • a, b, c
  • a, c, d
Correct Answer: c, d, e
1. Which of the following is a Group-centered method of teaching-learning? (UGC NET 08 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Providing lecture notes
  • Team-teaching
  • Demonstration method
  • Brainstorming
Correct Answer: Brainstorming
2. Which of the following is a learner-centered method? (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Inquiry approach
  • Lecture method
  • Demonstration method
  • Team teaching
Correct Answer: Inquiry approach
3. In a learner‐centric approach, a teacher should: (UGC NET 24 Nov Evening 2021)
  • clarify concepts by citing examples
  • facilitate student learning
  • explain concepts by using adequate support materials
  • demonstrate inside the classroom
Correct Answer: facilitate student learning
4. Which of the following is related to Learning - Centred approach of Education? (UGC NET 12 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Imposed
  • Authoritarian
  • Self-controlled
  • Autocratic
Correct Answer: Self-controlled
5. Which of the following are the advantages of lecture-cum-demonstration method? (UGC NET 11 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Clear and Permanent Knowledge B. Helping the task of the teacher C. Helpful in mental development D. Economical method
  • B and D only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, B, C and D
  • B and C only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D
6. In the spectrum of teaching methods which of the following will be called ‘dialogic’? (UGC NET 3 Dec 2019 Morning) (a) Demonstration method (b) Problem-solving method (c) Chalk and talk method (d) Team teaching based method (e) Interactive presentation (f) Tutorials
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (c), (d) and (e)
  • (b), (e) and (f)
Correct Answer: (b), (e) and (f)
1. A teacher teaches in a scaled clown actuation of teaching. Which of the following terms can be used for this type of teaching? (UGC NET 22 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Macro teaching
  • Sampling teaching
  • Cooperative teaching
  • Micro teaching
Correct Answer: Micro teaching
2. Micro teaching is more effective:
  • During the preparation for teaching-practice.
  • During the teaching-practice.
  • After the teaching-practice.
  • Always
Correct Answer: During the teaching-practice.
3. Condition necessary for micro teaching is___________?
  • Controlled environment.
  • Repeated manifestation of only one skill.
  • Observation and criticism.
  • All of the above.
Correct Answer: All of the above.
4. Micro teaching is most effective for the student-teacher:
  • after the practice-teaching
  • none of the above
  • before the practice-teaching
  • during the practice-teaching
Correct Answer: during the practice-teaching
1. Which teaching aids enhance the skills like reading, listening and pronunciation? (UGC NET 21 June 2019 Morning)
  • Audio-lingual teaching aids
  • Scientific teaching aids
  • General knowledge teaching aids
  • Theoretical based teaching aids
Correct Answer: Audio-lingual teaching aids
2. There are teaching aids which are centered around certain skills such as reading, listening and pronunciation etc. such teaching aids are called as:
  • Scientific teaching aids
  • General knowledge teaching aids
  • Skill based teaching aids
  • Audio-lingual teaching aids
Correct Answer: Audio-lingual teaching aids
3. Prime objective of using audio-lingual aids in a classroom is to keep students to develop:
  • Spelling and punctuation skills
  • Reading and writing skills
  • Listening and speaking skills
  • Vocabulary and grammar
Correct Answer: Vocabulary and grammar
4. Teacher uses visual-aids to make learning:
  • simple
  • more knowledgeable
  • quicker
  • interesting
Correct Answer: interesting
5. Which of the following statements about teaching aids are correct? (a) They help in retaining concepts for longer duration. (b) They help students learn better. (c) They make teaching learning process interesting. (d) They enhance rote learning.
  • (a), (b), (c) and (d)
  • (a), (b) and (c)
  • (b), (c) and (d)
  • (a), (b) and (d)
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c)
1. Identify the tools for shared viewing of visual and other interactive content within real-time environments: (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022 Morning) a. Virtual whiteboard b. Slide showing c. Polling d. Quizzing e. Avatars
  • a, b, c, d only
  • a, b, d, e only
  • a, c, d, e only
  • b, c, d, e only
Correct Answer: a, b, c, d only
2. Which of the following sequences correctly reflects the development of teaching support systems in Indian higher education? (UGC NET 13 Nov 2020 Morning)
  • Audio-visual, Aural-oral, Visual and ICT based
  • Aural-oral, Visual, Audio-visual and ICT based
  • ICT based. Audio-visual. Aural-oral and Visual
  • Visual, Aural-oral, ICT based and Audio-visual
Correct Answer: Aural-oral, Visual, Audio-visual and ICT based
3. Identify the only Visual Teaching Learning Resources from the following : (i) Gramophone (ii) Flannel Board (iii) Bulletin Board (iv) Radio (v) Tape Recorder (vi) Chalk Board (vii) Film Projector (viii) Maps
  • (i), (ii), (iii). (vi) and (viii)
  • (ii), (iii), (vi) and (viii)
  • (ii), (iii), (iv), (v) and (vii)
  • (ii), (iii), (vii) and (viii)
Correct Answer: (ii), (iii), (vi) and (viii)
4. Which of the following does not belong to a projected aid?
  • Overhead projector
  • Blackboard
  • Epidiascope
  • Slide projector
Correct Answer: Blackboard
5. The black-board can be utilised best by a teacher for:
  • putting the matter of teaching in black and white
  • making the students attentive
  • writing the important and notable points
  • highlighting the teacher himself
Correct Answer: writing the important and notable points
6. Which of the following belongs to a projected aid?
  • Blackboard
  • Diorama
  • Epidiascope
  • Globe
Correct Answer: Epidiascope
1. What is the type of graphic organiser or mind tool used for knowledge organisation that can help learners interpret, represent, and organise information by making a graphic in cooperation with others? (UGC NET 26 Nov Evening)
  • Concept mapping
  • Divergent question
  • Gestural prompts
  • Hyper media
Correct Answer: Concept mapping
2. Which of the following is a graphical tool for organising and representing knowledge? (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Concept maps
  • Lesson plan
  • Summary
  • Diagram
Correct Answer: Concept maps
3. ____________ help a learner to organize the scattered views at one place and establish relationships.
  • Knowledge Domain
  • Concept Maps
  • View Maps
  • Scattered Domain
Correct Answer: Concept Maps
4. A drawing that charts the relationships among ideas is known as: (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Divergent thinking
  • Concept map
  • Episodic memory
  • Embodied cognition
Correct Answer: Concept map
1. Which of the following statements clearly defines purpose of Assessment and Evaluation? (i) To identify students’ strengths and weaknesses. (ii) To assess the effectiveness of a particular instructional strategy. (iii) To assess and improve the effectiveness of curriculum programmes. (iv) To assess and improve teaching effectiveness. (v) To communicate with and involve parents and guardians in their children’s learning. (vi) To assist in student learning.
  • (ii), (iii) and (iv)
  • (i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v) and (vi)
  • (ii), (iv) and (vi)
  • (i), (ii), (iii) and (iv)
Correct Answer: (i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v) and (vi)
2. ______________ is “a systematic procedure for collecting information that can be used to make inferences about the characteristics of people or objects”.
  • Measurement
  • Assessment
  • Evaluation
  • Judgement
Correct Answer: Assessment
3. When a teacher observes the learners in the process of learning, collect feedback on their learning, improve his/her teaching-learning strategy to facilitate them for maximum learning, s/he is doing _________________.
  • Measurement
  • Assessment
  • Evaluation
  • Judgement
Correct Answer: Assessment
4. Ms. Preeti is a secondary school teacher. She conducted a unit test in all the sections of class IX in her school. It was a 20 marks objective type test. She collected and assessed all the answer scripts. She compiled the scores class wise and also made some groups like above average, average and below average. She returned the answer scripts with remarks like your performance is average/below average/above average. She also identified some topics where a large number of learners were not responded well or made mistakes. She decided to provide additional activities for those topics in order to facilitate learners. Based on above passage, identify which of the following are measurement and which are assessment? 1. Preeti assigned 1 mark for correct answer and 0 for the wrong one. 2. Preeti calculated total score of each learner. 3. Preeti categorized learners’ performance as below average, average and above average. 4. Preeti identified the topics/areas where learners have not performed well.
  • Statements 3 and 4 belong to measurement and statements 1 and 2 belong to assessment.
  • Statements 1 and 3 belong to measurement and statements 2 and 4 belong to assessment.
  • Statements 1 and 2 belong to measurement and statements 3 and 4 belong to assessment.
  • Statements 2 and 4 belong to measurement and statements 1 and 3 belong to assessment.
Correct Answer: Statements 1 and 2 belong to measurement and statements 3 and 4 belong to assessment.
1. Which of the following scales of measurement is synonymous to ranking or grading? (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Nominal scale
  • Ordinal scale
  • Interval Scale
  • Ratio Scale
Correct Answer: Ordinal scale
2. Which of the following is considered as the highest scale in measurement? (UGC NET 29 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Nominal
  • Internal
  • Ratio
  • Ordinal
Correct Answer: Ratio
3. Match the following scales of measurement with their purpose: List 1 (a) Nominal (b) Ordinal (c) Interval (d) Ratio List 2 (i) It classifies people or objects into various categories, classes or sets. One set or group is assigned one number for a common trait/ characteristics among all members of the group/set. (ii) It ranks people or objects according to the amount of a characteristic they have. (iii) It ranks people or objects on a scale of equal units. (iv) It has all the properties of interval along with an absolute (true) zero point on scale.
  • a - (i) b - (ii) c - (iii) d - (iv)
  • a - (iv) b - (iii) c - (ii) d - (i)
  • a - (iv) b - (ii) c - (iii) d - (i)
  • a - (ii) b - (i) c - (iv) d - (iii)
Correct Answer: a - (i) b - (ii) c - (iii) d - (iv)
1. Which of the following can be considered as psychological barriers to effective communication? (UGC NET 29th Sept 2020 Morning paper) a. Descriptive message b. Inattentiveness c. Too much reliance on the written word d. Limited retention e. Logical organization f. Flow of thought
  • d, e and f only
  • b, c and d only
  • a, b and c only
  • c, d and e only
Correct Answer: b, c and d only
2. Identify the psychological barriers to communication: (UGC NET 20th Nov 2021- Morning shift) a. Noise b. Invisibility c. Prejudice d. Disinterest e. Inattention
  • a, c and d only
  • b, c and d only
  • a, b and c only
  • c, d and e only
Correct Answer: c, d and e only
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 21st Oct 2022 Evening shift) Statement I: Lack of common understanding is a psychological barrier in communication Statement II: Inadequacy of language, devoid of experience, will lead to failure in communication
  • Both statement I and II are true
  • Statement I is false but II is true
  • Both statement I and II are false
  • Statement I is true but II is false
Correct Answer: Both statement I and II are true
3. From the list given below, identify the psychological barriers to communication: (UGC NET 20th November 2021 Morning paper) A. Noise B. Invisibility C. Prejudice D. Disinterest E. Inattention
  • C, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, C and D only
Correct Answer: C, D and E only
5. Physical barriers to communication are rapidly disappearing, but psychological obstacles remain owing to which of the following? (UGC NET 21st November 2021 Evening paper)   A. By formal language B. By visual presentation C. By use of technology D. By emotional appeal E. By cultural attitude
  • C, D and E only
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, D and E only
1. The main focus of the teacher in designing assessments should be on: (UGC NET 23 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • activities
  • leaming outcomes
  • attendance
  • his/her behaviour
Correct Answer: leaming outcomes
2. While designing assessments, teacher must focus on which of the following as per Outcome Based Education (OBE)? (UGC NET 01 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Activities
  • Reading material
  • Pre-requisites
  • Learning outcomes
Correct Answer: Learning outcomes
3. Assessment helps in maintaining __________ to/in communication. Choose the most appropriate answer from the following:
  • Continuity
  • Speed
  • Flexibility
  • Rigidity
Correct Answer: Continuity
4. The main focus while using assessment as part of the teaching learning should be:
  • To identify the current learning-level of the learners
  • To establish what learners are going to learn
  • To link next learning with learners’ previous learning and experiences
  • All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above
5. Match the following: List 1 (i) Assessment of Learning (ii) Assessment for Learning (iii) Assessment as Learning List 2 (a) Self-Assessment (b) Summative Assessment (c) Formative Assessment
  • i - (b) ii - (c) iii - (a)
  • i - (a) ii - (b) iii - (c)
  • i - (c) ii - (b) iii - (a)
  • i - (a) ii - (c) iii - (b)
Correct Answer: i - (b) ii - (c) iii - (a)
6. Assessment drives learning.
No correct answer provided
1. Which among the following factors doesn’t contribute to assessment bias? (UGC NET 4 Dec 2019 Evening)
  • When language of the test and the tester is different from the language of the students.
  • Answers that support middle- class values.
  • If assessment procedures are flexible and diverse to make disadvantage students comfortable.
  • Objective test for assessing abstract reasoning of the student.
Correct Answer: If assessment procedures are flexible and diverse to make disadvantage students comfortable.
2. Identify the statement among the following which does not reflect the purpose of evaluation?
  • To ascertain the worth of time, energy and resources invested in a programme.
  • To help teachers to determine the effectiveness of their teaching techniques and learning materials.
  • To ensure an economical and efficient management of scarce resources.
  • None of the above.
Correct Answer: None of the above.
3. Evaluation provides _________ to the curriculum. Choose the most appropriate answer from the following:
  • Shape
  • Finality
  • Feedback
  • None of the above
Correct Answer: Feedback
4. What are the characteristics of Continuous and Comprehensive Evaluation? (a) It increases the workload on students by taking multiple tests. (b) It replaces marks with grades. (c) It evaluates every aspect of the student. (d) It helps in reducing examination phobia.
  • (a) (b) (c) and (d)
  • (b) and (d)
  • (a) (b) and (c)
  • (b), (c) and (d)
Correct Answer: (b), (c) and (d)
5. Evaluation may be considered as an umbrella term which includes measurement and assessment.
No correct answer provided
6. Without value judgment, there is no evaluation.
No correct answer provided
1. Which of the following are the characteristics of an Ideal Evaluation in teaching-learning process ? (UGC NET 12 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Comprehensiveness B. Validity C. Reliability D. Subjectivity
  • B and D Only
  • A, B and C Only
  • A, C and D Only
  • B and D Only
Correct Answer: A, B and C Only
2. Identify the incorrect statement among the following:
  • A valid evaluation measures the behaviour described by the objective (s), under scrutiny.
  • A reliable evaluation mechanism is dependent of the characteristics of individual evaluator.
  • Fair Evaluation can be possible by accurate reflecting of range of expected behaviours as desired by the course objectives.
  • Feedback in evaluation help learners to prove their current strengths and weaknesses.
Correct Answer: A reliable evaluation mechanism is dependent of the characteristics of individual evaluator.
3. Reliability and validity of an examination/ test is determined by how hard (tough) it is.
No correct answer provided
1. In order to identify individual differences of learners in a class, which of the following can be used by a teacher? (UGC NET 12 July 2022 Morning)
  • Summative Assessments
  • Formative Assessments
  • Diagnostic Assessments
  • Peer Assessments
Correct Answer: Formative Assessments
2. Which of the following types of evaluation is done during the teaching-learning process? (UGC NET 21 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Summative
  • Integrative
  • Formative
  • Diagnostic
Correct Answer: Formative
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 22 Oct 2022 Morning) Assertion (A): Formative assessments are used for providing feedback to the learner for improvement. Reason (R): Formative assessments improve teaching-learning process.
  • Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is true but R is false.
  • A is false but R is true.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
4. Match List I with List II gives their characteristic features: (UGC NET 20 Nov Evening 2021) List I (Modes of Evaluation)  a. Formative Evaluation b. Summative Evaluation c. Criterion‐referenced Evaluation d. Norm‐referenced Evaluation List II (Characteristic Features) i. Compares one student with another student. ii. Compares the progress of a student against prespecified standards. iii. Used primarily for motivational and monitoring purposes of learning. iv. Used primarily for gradation of progress made.
  • a‐ iv, b‐ iii, c‐ i, d‐ ii
  • a‐ iii, b‐ iv, c‐ ii, d‐ i
  • a‐ ii, b‐ i, c‐ iii, d‐ iv
  • a‐ i, b‐ ii, c‐ iv, d‐ ii
Correct Answer: a‐ iii, b‐ iv, c‐ ii, d‐ i
5. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 03 Dec Morning 2021) Statement I: In norm-referenced testing of students, test data helps us determine a students place or rank. Statement II: In Criterion-referenced testing, the test data tells us about a student’s level of proficiency.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
6. The type of evaluation which gives feed-back to students as well as teachers is: (UGC NET 05 Jan Morning 2022)
  • Placement evaluation
  • Formative evaluation
  • Summative evaluation
  • Diagnostic evaluation
Correct Answer: Formative evaluation
7. In NRT test data tell us about a student's level of proficiency in mastery of some skills or set of skills.
No correct answer provided
8. Which of the characteristics in classroom teaching behaviour as given below will be classified as a part of formative assessment? (UGC NET 9 Oct 2020 Morning) (i) The teacher asks question to elicit classification from students. (ii) The teacher specifies the level of mastery attained by students. (iii) The teacher prompts and probes the students while making presentation. (iv) The teacher pauses for a few seconds, looks at students and asks questions. (v) The teacher indicates performance criteria and given judgmental values.
  • (i), (ii) and (iii) only
  • (i), (iii) and (iv) only
  • (ii), (iii) and (iv) only
  • (iii) (iv) and (v) only
Correct Answer: (i), (iii) and (iv) only
1. Which of the following is INCORRECT regarding CBCS? (UGC NET 20 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • CBCS is a framework to provide choices for electives and optionals to students.
  • CBCS can be implemented only through online programmes.
  • MOOCs can be used to provide choices for CBCS.
  • Generic Electives and skill enhancement courses are provided under CBCS framework.
Correct Answer: CBCS can be implemented only through online programmes.
2. The provision of earning credits from Optional and Elective courses was introduced in higher Education Institutions by which of the following? (UGC NET 22 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Academic Bank of Credit
  • MOOCS on SWAYAM portal
  • Choice Based Credit System
  • Vocational courses
Correct Answer: Choice Based Credit System
3. Choice based credit system allows students to choose which of the following? (UGC NET 27 Nov 2021 Evening) a. Interdisciplinary b. Intradisciplinary c. Skill‐oriented papers d. Open‐book examinations e. Cataloguing services
  • a, b and c only
  • b, c and d only
  • c, d and e only
  • a, d and e only
Correct Answer: a, b and c only
4. Which of the following is indicative of innovations in evaluation system at present? (UGC NET 12 Nov 2020 Morning)
  • Semesterization system
  • Project based evaluation system
  • Choice based credit system
  • Objective based evaluation system
Correct Answer: Choice based credit system
5. Choice-based credit system in Indian Higher Education is a new entry.
No correct answer provided
6. The _________________ enables a student to obtain a degree by accumulating required number of credits prescribed for that degree.
  • Semester System
  • Grading System
  • Compulsory Credit System
  • Choice-based Credit System
Correct Answer: Choice-based Credit System
Identify the incorrect statements with respect to tests?
  • Tests have some organized stimuli (test items) in an organized sequence to test some specific trait/attribute.
  • Test can be used as tool for quantitative measurement as well as qualitative assessment.
  • Test is a systematic tool to measure sample behaviour.
  • None of the above
Correct Answer: None of the above
1. In communication, cross‐cultural barrier refers to: (UGC NET 29th Nov 2021 Evening paper)
  • General human values
  • Physical entities
  • Perceptions of people
  • Sincerity of speaker
Correct Answer: Perceptions of people
Drag the words into the correct boxes
No correct answer provided
Match List I with List II (UGC NET 25 Sept 2020 Morning) List I (Methods of estimating the reliability of a test) A. Test-retest method B. Alternate form method C. Split-half method D. Inter-rater method List II (Description) I. Administering the test in one session with two equivalent halves of the test for correlation. II. Two or more raters score the test independently. III. Administering the same test to the same group at two different sessions. IV. Administering the two forms of the test to the same group at two different sessions.
  • A - I, B - II, C - III, D - IV
  • A - II, B - I, C - IV, D - III
  • A - IV, B - III, C - II, D - I
  • A - III, B - IV, C - I, D - II
Correct Answer: A - III, B - IV, C - I, D - II
Match the type of validity with its major source of problem: LIST 1 (a) Construct validity (b) External Validity (c) Internal Validity LIST 2 (i) Faulty or poor measure, resulting in mislabeling/ misinterpreting behaviour. (ii) Treatment and no-treatment groups were unequal before the study began. (iii) Sample of participants was not representative.
  • (a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii)
  • (a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii)
  • (a)-(i), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii)
  • (a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii)
1. Achievement tests are commonly used for the purpose of:
  • Making selections for a specific job.
  • Selecting candidates for a course.
  • Identifying strengths and weaknesses of learners.
  • Assessing the amount of learning after teaching.
Correct Answer: Assessing the amount of learning after teaching.
2. Match the following tests with their purpose: List 1 (i) Rorschach Test (ii) Holtzman Ink Block Test (iii) Rosenzweig Test (iv) Tomkins-Horn Picture arrangement test List 2 (a) consists of series of cartoons with empty balloons. (b) consists of 45 cards, which are based on colour, movement, shading. (c) consists of 10 cards having prints of inkblots. (d) consists of five plates each containing three sketches.
  • i - (c) ii - (b) iii - (d) iv - (a)
  • i - (d) ii - (c) iii - (a) iv - (b)
  • i - (b) ii - (c) iii - (d) iv - (a)
  • i - (c) ii - (b) iii - (a) iv - (d)
Correct Answer: i - (c) ii - (b) iii - (a) iv - (d)
3. TMAT refers to:
  • Teacher Made Test
  • Theme Made Test
  • Thematic Apperception Test
  • None of the above
Correct Answer: Teacher Made Test
4. As a teacher, you wish to predict the capacity and potential success in your subject. Your main purpose is to predict, or to identify individuals who have greatest potential for development along special lines or who are likely to profit most by special training. Which test you would apply to accomplish that?
  • Personality test
  • Intelligence test
  • Prognostic test
  • Aptitude test
Correct Answer: Aptitude test
5. In a school, in which there are large number of failures, you may like to develop test for elimination those who are likely to have substantial difficulties in meeting the academic goals of teaching. For this you need to develop test which should be able to predict the individual’s ability or readiness to undertake the study of a school subject successfully. What is the name of such tests?
  • Achievement tests
  • Attitude tests
  • Prognostic tests
  • Analytical tests
Correct Answer: Prognostic tests
When the middle of the scale is followed by a rater, then it is known as:
  • Error of leniency
  • Error of Central Tendency
  • Halo Effect
  • Proximity Error
Correct Answer: Error of Central Tendency
Teacher 'A' uses chalk and board and dictates notes to students in classroom. Teacher 'B' uses Videoconferencing tool and LMS for providing digital resources. Which modes of teaching are used by teacher A and teacher B? (UGC NET 29 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • Both online
  • Both offline
  • Teacher-A: online; Teacher-B: offline
  • Teacher-A: offline; Teacher-B: online
Correct Answer: Teacher-A: offline; Teacher-B: online
1. For effective integration of ICT in teaching-learning, the following should be used for providing online content, assessments, and for seamless virtual interaction of teachers with learners: (UGC NET 20 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • WhatsApp
  • Content Management System
  • Learning Management System
  • Facebook
Correct Answer: Learning Management System
2. LMS is a software application used for the: (UGC NET 20 Oct 2022 Morning)
  • Administration, documentation, tracking, reporting and delivery of educational courses.
  • Authentication, documentation, transfer, reporting and designing of educational courses.
  • Administration, documentation and depository of e-resources.
  • Authentication, reporting, analysis and depository of e-resources.
Correct Answer: Administration, documentation, tracking, reporting and delivery of educational courses.
3. Students participating in online classes are taught by an instructor. Following the lesson, the instructor intends to incorporate reading materials (e-content, Power point presentation, etc.) that can be viewed by the students. What option would instructor choose? (UGC NET 22 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Content creation tools
  • Networking tools
  • Learning Management System (LMS)
  • Links of the websites
Correct Answer: Learning Management System (LMS)
1. Semantic barrier of communication is implied when the: (UGC NET 24th June 2019 Evening Paper)
  • signal is lost before reaching the receiver
  • receiver does not understand the meaning of the message
  • receiver's attention is diverted
  • message transmitted by the source is unclear
Correct Answer: receiver does not understand the meaning of the message
2. Which of the following is a semantic barrier? (UGC NET 8th Oct 2022- Evening shift)
  • Blurred image on television
  • Unclear printing in newspapers
  • Static broadcasting
  • Redundancy in writing
Correct Answer: Redundancy in writing

No correct answer provided

  • Modular Object Oriented Dynamic Learning Environment
  • MOOCs Oriented Digital Learning Environment
  • Multiple Object Oriented Dynamic Learning Environment
Correct Answer: Modular Object Oriented Dynamic Learning Environment

  • Marketing of offline courses
  • Admission of students
  • Creating institutional websites
  • Creating virtual student-teacher groups
Correct Answer: Creating virtual student-teacher groups

  • B and E only
  • C, D and E only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D only
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 15 Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: In synchronous communication, interaction between teacher and student does not occur at the same instant of time. Statement II: In Asynchronous communication, interaction between teacher and student occurs at the same instant of time.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
3. Match List I with the List II (UGC NET 12 Mar 2023 Evening) LIST I (E-Learning strategies) A. Podcasts B. Blogs C. Wiki D. Webcasting LIST II (Meaning) I. The personal websites that contain contents organised like a Journal or diary.  II. The dissemination of recorded or live content over the internet.  III. The digital audio or video files containing meaningful content for learning.  IV. The open, dynamic websites with collaboratively constructed knowledge, information and resources which are freely available on internet.
  • A-II, B-IV, C-III, D-I
  • A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II
  • A-IV, B-II, C-III, D-I
  • A-II, B-I, C-IV, D-III
Correct Answer: A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II

  • TPACK
  • SAMR
  • RAT
  • PICRAT
Correct Answer: RAT
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: TPACK (Technological Pedagogical Content Knowledge) framework has been developed by Mishra and Kochler in 2006. Statement II: TPACK framework comprises of total six components.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.

  • Automated Text Marker (ATM)

  • Discourse structure analysis
  • Calibrand Marker
Correct Answer: E- Portfolios
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 11 July 2022 Evening) Assertion ‘A’: Flipped classroom is a learner-centric effective model for ICT enabled teaching-learning or blended learning. Reason ‘R’: Students learn concepts through videos and in classroom, teacher-guided discussions and problem solving is done in face-to-face mode.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
2. Which tool is used to create online bulletin board where you can display information in the form of pictures, texts, videos etc.? (UGC NET 11 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Quizzizz
  • Padlet
  • Screen Castify
  • Windows
Correct Answer: Padlet

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
1. Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a MOOC? It can be accessed: (UGC NET 09 July 2022 Evening)
  • Anytime
  • From any device having Internet browser
  • Only in the classroom
  • Anywhere
Correct Answer: Only in the classroom
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 10 Oct 2022 Morning) Statement I: In MOOCs' the word 'Massive' means that there can be huge number of learners who can enroll for the course. Statement II: MOOC involves the use of ICT to make education accessible to students located in remote areas or who are unable to reach conventional classrooms.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
3. Given below are two statements : (UGC NET 20 Oct 2022 Evening) Assertion A: MOOCs are learner-centric courses. Reason R: MOOCs can only be accessed by a learner in the presence of his/her teacher.
  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct.

  • Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
  • A is correct but R is not correct.
  • A is not correct but R is correct.
Correct Answer: A is correct but R is not correct.

  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.

  • (a), (b) and (d)

Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c)

  • audience education
  • audience knowledge
  • audience income
  • audience attitude
Correct Answer: audience attitude

  • b, c and d only

  • c, d and e only
  • a, d and e only
Correct Answer: a, b and c only

1. We listen attentively to and favorably interpret messages which boost our self-image, and reject or misinterpret messages which threaten that image. This is called: (UGC NET 25th June 2020 Evening paper)
  • communication selectivity
  • change resistance
  • communication distortion
  • image rationalization
Correct Answer: communication selectivity
2. Find out the correct sequence of selectivity stages in mass communication? (UGC NET 11th Nov 2020 Morning paper) (i) Exposure (ii) Retention (iii) Attitudinal change (iv) Perception (v) Attention
  • (i), (ii), (iii), (v), (iv)
  • (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), (i)
  • (i), (v), (iv), (ii), (iii)
  • (iii), (v), (iv), (i), (ii)
Correct Answer: (i), (v), (iv), (ii), (iii)
1. What are the barriers to effective communication? (UGC NET Jul 2016)
  • Personal statements, eye contact and simple narration
  • Moralizing, being judgmental and comments of consolation
  • Dialogue, summary and self-review
  • Use of simple words, cool reaction and defensive attitude
Correct Answer: Moralizing, being judgmental and comments of consolation
2. Which one of the following makes communication ineffective? (UGC NET 27th December 2021 Evening paper)
  • Clarity
  • Sincerity
  • Brevity
  • Ambiguity
Correct Answer: Ambiguity
3. One of the barriers to reception in communication is: (UGC NET 20th Oct 2022 Evening shift)
  • Environmental stimulus
  • Language orderliness
  • Open mindedness
  • Message brevity
Correct Answer: Environmental stimulus
4. Which of the following are barriers to understand the communicated messages? (UGC NET 29th Oct 2022 Morning shift) 1. Emotional quotient 2. Jargon 3. Personal space 4. Pre-judgement 5. Cultural background
  • 2, 4, and 5 only
  • 1, 2, and 3 only
  • 2, 3, and 4 only
  • 3, 4, and 5 only
Correct Answer: 2, 4, and 5 only
Drag the words into the correct boxes
No correct answer provided
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Morning) Statement I: Communication can create a 'feel good' factor among receivers. Statement II: Communication can be used as an instrument to divide and alienate the receivers.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
2. In governance, communication is normally used as a means of: (UGC NET 21st Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Encouraging illegal actions
  • Gender division
  • Preserving power
  • Alienating the masses
Correct Answer: Preserving power
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 14th Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: When messages are delivered by popular sources, they have higher attention and recall of the receivers. Statement II: A highly credible source may not score much in the areas of expertise, trustworthiness and likability
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
4. In any modern society, communication has (UGC NET 12th July 2022- Evening shift)
  • Power value
  • Uncommon value
  • Transient value
  • Non-critical value
Correct Answer: Power value
Drag the words into the correct boxes
No correct answer provided
1. In mass communication the audience is: (UGC NET 22nd Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Relatively small
  • Homogeneous
  • Identifiable
  • Heterogeneous
Correct Answer: Heterogeneous
2. One of the cool media of communication is: (UGC NET 04th Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Photograph
  • Print
  • Television
  • Radio
Correct Answer: Television
3. Which of the following are true with regard to mass communication? (UGC NET 13th Oct 2022 Morning shift) a. Messages are prepared by non-professionals b. Messages are prepared by professionals c. Messages are rapidly disseminated d. Messages are supposed to be understood e. Media audiences are homogenous
  • b, c, d
  • c, d, e
  • a, b, c
  • a, d, e
Correct Answer: b, c, d
4. One of the features of broadcast communication is that it is (UGC NET 02nd Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Static for the audience
  • Static for the audience
  • High-brow for the audience
  • Live for the audience
Correct Answer: Live for the audience
1. The Internet based communication for learning is: (UGC NET 14th Oct 2022 Morning shift) a. Isolated b. Inter dependent c. Interactive d. Automatic e. Wide ranging
  • a, d, e
  • b, c, d
  • c, d, e
  • a, b, c
Correct Answer: c, d, e
2. In both mass communication and classroom communication, filtering of information and contents is referred to as: (UGC NET 25th June 2020 Morning paper)
  • Gate keeping
  • Content correction
  • One-way flow
  • Rationalisation
Correct Answer: Gate keeping
3. Gate keeping by media to ensure what audiences consume is indicative of: (UGC NET 25th June 2020 Evening paper)
  • Media’s control on society
  • Feedback received by the media
  • Media's role in creating culture
  • The audiences’ voice in media programming
Correct Answer: Media’s control on society
4. Which of the following is a characteristic of modern mass media? (UGC NET 24th June 2019 Evening Paper)
  • Capital intensive
  • Labour intensive
  • Developmental
  • Sustainable
Correct Answer: Capital intensive
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: In the earlier days of mass communication, content creators played an important role in the society. Statement II: They represented and defined reality by authoring narratives to explain to the audience.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
2. Today’s media-society equation is largely: (UGC NET 24th June 2019 Morning Paper)
  • Morally bound
  • Consumer conscious
  • Tradition centric
  • Mystical
Correct Answer: Consumer conscious
1. Every year Press Council of India celebrates the National Press‐Day on: (UGC NET 20th  November 2021 Morning paper)
  • January 30
  • November 16
  • October 15
  • May 30
Correct Answer: November 16
2. All India Radio (A.I.R) for broadcasting was named in the year: (UGC NET Jun 2012)
  • 1936
  • 1946
  • 1926
  • 1956
Correct Answer: 1936
3. The nodal agency of the Government of India for advertising by various Ministries, public sector undertakings and autonomous bodies is:
  • Doordarshan
  • DAVP
  • None of the above
  • AIR
Correct Answer: DAVP
1. The term ‘Yellow Journalism’ refers to: (UGC NET Dec 2014)
  • Sensational news prints in yellow paper
  • Sensationalism and exaggeration to attract readers / viewers
  • Sensational news about arts and culture
  • Sensational news about terrorism and violence
Correct Answer: Sensationalism and exaggeration to attract readers / viewers
2. In two-step flow of communication, message pass through: (UGC NET 1st Oct 2022- Morning Shift) a. Mass media b. Opinion leaders c. Bureaucracy d. Spiritual leaders
  • c and d
  • a and b
  • b and c
  • a and c
Correct Answer: a and b
1. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: In ancient India, education was free. Statement II: In ancient India, education was centralised.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 02 March 2023 Morning) Statement I: According to ancient Hindu system of Education, an aspect of education which is emphasized by the upholders of education in democratic society is that education should be free as far as practicable. Statement II: According to ancient Hindu system of education an aspect of education which is emphasized by the upholders of education in democratic society is that education should be compulsory as far as practicable
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
3. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 06 Mar 2023 Evening) Statement I: In ancient India only informal system of education was in existence. Statement II: In ancient India the Indigenous education was imparted at home, in temples, Pathshalas and Gurukulas.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
4. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 4 Nov 2020 Morning) Statement I: Holistic education in ancient India was not just acquisition of knowledge as preparation for life in this world or life beyond schooling but for complete realization and liberation of the self. Statement II: Values of pluralism, mutual understanding and peace constituted the foundation of holistic education during ancient education
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
1. The ancient system of education in India included education of which of the following ancient texts? (UGC NET 01 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Vedas B. Brahmanas C. Upanishads D. Dharmasutras
  • A, B, C and D
  • B and D Only
  • A. C and D Only
  • A and C Only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D
2. Ayurveda, which deals with indigenous system of medicine, could be traced to: (UGC NET 17 Oct 2020 Morning)
  • Yajurveda
  • Atharveda
  • Samaveda
  • Rigveda
Correct Answer: Atharveda
3. Paravidya, according to the vedic tradition implies: (UGC NET 5 Nov 2020 Morning)
  • Knowledge based on human experience.
  • Knowledge that transcends human experience
  • Knowledge acquired from teachers.
  • Knowledge acquired from texts.
Correct Answer: Knowledge that transcends human experience
1. Which of the following ancient systems is focused on laws of matter and force and of combination and disintegration? (UGC NET 22 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Grihya Sutras
  • Chhanda
  • Nirukta
  • Vaisesika
Correct Answer: Vaisesika
2. Match List I with the List II. (UGC NET 11 Mar 2023 Morning) List I (Discipline/Subject) A. Logic B. Interpretation C. Etymology D. Ritual List II (Ancient Name) I. Nirukta II. Anviksiki III. Kalpa IV. Mimamsa
  • A - IV, B- II, C - I, D - III
  • A - B- IV, C- Ill, D - I
  • A – II, B- IV, C - I, D - III
  • A - III, B- IV, C - I, D - II
Correct Answer: A – II, B- IV, C - I, D - III
3. Match the following. (UGC NET 14 Oct 2022 Evening) List I (Name of the Subject) A. Kavya B. Aniviksiki C. Varta D. Ntrukta List II (Domain and Subject Matter) I. Agriculture, Trade, Commerce, Animal Husbandry II. Etymology III. Logic IV. Imaginative and creative literature
  • Answer 1
Correct Answer: Answer 1
4. Match the following. (UGC NET 11 Nov 2020 Evening) List-I (a) Nirukta (b) Chhandas (c) Shiksha (d) Kalpa List-II (i) Phonetics (ii) Ritual (iii) Metrics (iv) Etymology
  • a-(ii), b-(iv), c-(iii), d-(i)
  • a-(iv), b-(iii), c-(i), d-(ii)
  • a-(i), b-(ii), c-(iv), d-(iii)
  • a-(iii), b-(i), c-(ii), d-(iv)
Correct Answer: a-(iv), b-(iii), c-(i), d-(ii)
1. Who among the following were prominent women vedic scholars? (UGC NET 22 Oct 2022 Evening) A. Maitreyi B. Viswambhara C. Apala D. Gargi E. Lopamudra
  • A, C, D, E only
  • A, B, C, D, E
  • A, D, E only
  • A, C, D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D, E
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 12 Jul 2022 Evening) Statement I: In ancient India, indigenous education was imparted at home, in temples and gurukuls.  Statement II: In ancient India, students went to viharas for higher knowledge.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
3. The prominent women scholars reported during the Vedic period are: (UGC NET 11 Nov 2020 Morning) (i) Gargi (ii) Maitreyi (iii) Sanghamitra (iv) Viswambhara (v) Apala
  • (i), (ii), (iii), (iv) only
  • (i), (iii), (iv), (v) only
  • (i), (ii), (iv), (v) only
  • (ii), (iii), (iv), (v) only
Correct Answer: (i), (ii), (iv), (v) only
1. The linear model of communication can be described as (UGC NET 24th Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Participatory
  • Confessional
  • Liberal
  • Authoritarian
Correct Answer: Authoritarian
2. Which of the following are the key features of linear model of communication? (UGC NET 10th Oct 2022 Evening Shift) A. One way communication B. Manipulated feedback C. Absence of noise D. Used for mass communication E. Sender centric communication
  • A, D, E
  • A, B, C
  • D, C, E
  • B, C, D
Correct Answer: A, D, E
3. The sequence of elements in linear model of communication is (UGC NET 29th Sept 2020 Evening paper) A. Message B. Decoder C. Encoder D. Medium E. Bloke
  • A, C, B, E, D
  • C, A, D, E, B
  • D, E, C, A, B
  • B, D, C, A, E
Correct Answer: C, A, D, E, B

  • A and B only
  • B and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • C and D only
Correct Answer: B and D only

  • A, C and D only
  • A, B, C and D
  • A and D only
  • A, B and D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

  • B and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • A and C only
Correct Answer: A and C only

  • A and C only
  • A, C and D only
  • A, B, C and E only

  • Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.
  • Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

  • 1990
  • 1992
  • 1978
  • 1980
Correct Answer: 1980

  • International relations
  • Trade and Commerce
  • Medical science and surgery
  • Veterinary science
Correct Answer: Medical science and surgery

  • Vallabhi
  • Mithila
  • Nalanda
  • Takshashila
Correct Answer: Takshashila

  • D and E only
  • A and B only
  • A and C only
  • B and D only
Correct Answer: B and D only

  • Takshashila University
  • Nalanda University
  • Vikramshila University
  • Banaras Hindu University
Correct Answer: Takshashila University

  • A, B, C and D
  • A and C only
  • A, C and D only
  • B and D only
Correct Answer: A and C only

  • Technical curriculum
  • Professional curriculum
  • General curriculum
  • Specialised curriculum
Correct Answer: Specialised curriculum

  • Pataliputra
  • Nalanda
  • Takshashila
  • Sridhanya Katak
Correct Answer: Takshashila

  • A, B, C and D
  • B and C only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, B and D only
Correct Answer: B and C only
5. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 22 Oct 2022 Morning) Statement I: The medical treatises of Charaka and Sushruta were included among ancient sources of education in India.  Statement II: Among ancient sources of education no distinction was drawn between Shastras (Learned disciplines) and Kavyas (imaginative and creative literature)
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
6. Ancient literary work such as Banabhatta's Kadambari described good education as knowledge of how many arts (Kalaas)?
  • 32
  • 16
  • 64
  • 25
Correct Answer: 64
Arrange the following in chronological order of their occurrence: (UGC NET 28 Nov 2021 Evening) A. Hartog Commission B. Sadler Commission C. Macaulay’s Minutes D. Sargent Plan E. Wood’s Despatch
  • C, E, B, D, A
  • C, E, A, B, D
  • C, B, E, A, D
  • C, E, B, A, D
Correct Answer: C, E, B, D, A
Which act sanctioned a sum of Rs.1 lakh towards education of Indians in British ruled India? This act also gave an impetus to the missionaries who were given official permission to come to India.
  • Charter Act of 1813
  • English Education Act 1935
  • Charter Act of 1833
  • None of above
Correct Answer: Charter Act of 1813
1. Which of the following were the outcomes of the introduction of English system of higher education in India? (UGC NET 13 Mar 2023 Morning) A. Status quo in Indian education system.  B. Relegation of women's education to the lowest level.  C. Rise of social consciousness in India.  D. Emphasis on material prosperity.  E. Acquaintance of western literature and scientific knowledge.
  • B, C and D only
  • A, B and C only
  • A, C and E only
  • C, D and E only
Correct Answer: C, D and E only
2. Who is fully credited with the introduction of English education system in India, officially through the necessary order issued by Bentinck, the Governor General of India on 7th March 1835? (UGC NET 12 Jul 2022 Morning)
  • Alexander Duff
  • Charles Tevelyan
  • Thomas Babington Macaulay
  • Zachary Macaulay
Correct Answer: Thomas Babington Macaulay
1. Which of the following recognised for the first time that the government should give 'frank and cordial support' to female education and take effective measure for its expansion? (UGC NET 08 Oct 2022 Evening)
  • National Council of Women
  • The Woods Despatch
  • Women's Indian Association
  • All India Women's Conference
Correct Answer: The Woods Despatch
2. Given below are two statements: (UGC NET 23 Oct 2022 Morning) Statement I: As a result of the recommendation of the 'Woods despatch' modern University education in India began in 1857, when the universities of Calcutta, Bombay and Madras were founded by the British. Statement II: The Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi was established in the year 1927.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
  • Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
  • Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
  • Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
1. The Universities of Calcutta, Bombay and Madras were to be set up on the model of: (UGC NET 02 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Cambridge University
  • Oxford University
  • University of Edinburgh
  • University of London
Correct Answer: University of London
2. The Act of Incorporation passed by Lord Canning in February 1857, provided for the establishment of which of the following universities? (UGC NET 03 Mar 2023 Evening) A. Calcutta B. Delhi C. Bombay D. Madras
  • A, B and D only
  • A, C and D only
  • B, C and D only
  • A and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only
3. Universities in Calcutta, Bombay and Madras were established through the acts of incorporation passed by which of the Governor-General and Viceroy, in January 1857? (UGC NET 16 Mar 2023 Morning)
  • Lord Canning
  • Lord Mountbatten
  • Lord Linlithgow
  • Lord Curzon
Correct Answer: Lord Canning
4. Who among the following was the Governor-General and the Viceroy who passed the acts of incorporation in January 1857, which provided for the establishment of universities at Calcutta, Bombay and Madras? (UGC NET 21 Mar 2023 Evening)
  • Lord Curzon
  • Lord Dalhousie
  • Lord Lansdowne
  • Lord Canning
Correct Answer: Lord Canning
